P/T Sentence Text: Gaskets in flanged connections shall be of a material resistant to the liquid being carried and capable of withstanding temperatures of at least 650" without damage that would impair its function.

National Article Title: Frequency and Methods of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
National Sentence Text: Every storage tank, piping system and sump, including those at fuel-dispensing stations, shall be tested and monitored for leaks in conformance with Tables 4.4.1.2.-A to 4.4.1.2.-E, which establish the minimum requirements regarding the frequency and methods to be used for commissioning testing, subsequent in-service monitoring, and testing when a leak is suspected.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems including those at fuel dispensing stations shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Sentences (2) and (3) (a) whenever a leak is suspected, and (b) at the time of installation (i) before backfilling in the case of underground piping, or (ii) before putting into service in the case of exposed piping.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.3.2.(1), pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air or an inert gas shall include the application of soap and water to the storage tank and piping surface, fittings, joints and connections to help in the detection of leaks.
P/T Sentence Text: When exposed piping systems are subjected to a pneumatic leakage test, it shall be in conformance with Article 4.4.6.4., and the piping, including the joints, shall be soaped to assist in the detection of leaks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where a leak is detected as described in Sentence 4.4.1.3.(1) or 4.4.1.3.(2), the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: If a leak is detected in a piping system during the leakage test, the piping system shall be repaired or replaced and the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: The piping system shall be considered to be leaking if any pressure decline is detected within the time periods stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.4.6.1.(3) shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop or a volume loss within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure had been removed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.4.3.4.(6) and 4.4.3.4.(7), test pressure shall be the greater of 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 4.4.6.6., piping systems shall be pressure tested at pressures of not less than 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, whichever is greater.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Pneumatic Leak Detection Testing of Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Test pressures shall be the greater of 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, and not exceed the piping manufacturer's test specifications.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 4.4.6.6., piping systems shall be pressure tested at pressures of not less than 350 kPa (gauge) or 1.5 times the maximum operating pressure, whichever is greater.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
National Sentence Text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be permitted unless the piping system is designed for such pressures.
P/T Sentence Text: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be used except when the piping system is designed for such pressures.

National Sentence Text: Where continuous leak detection is provided on an underground piping system, it shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping
P/T Sentence Text: When an underground piping system is provided with continuous leakage detection, it shall be in conformance with ULC/ORD-C107.12, "Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping".

National Sentence Text: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.

National Sentence Text: It is not permitted to use any portion of a piping system in a manner that could damage it or for any purpose other than the transfer of product.
P/T Sentence Text: No portion of a piping system shall be used in a manner that could cause damage to the piping system.

National Sentence Text: Where vehicular, watercraft or floatplane impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for aboveground outdoor piping.
P/T Sentence Text: When vehicular impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for piping referred to in Sentence (1) and for fill pipes for storage tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground piping systems shall be supported such that they are not in direct contact with the surface of the ground.

National Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in Article 4.5.6.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in Article 4.4.7.7.

National Sentence Text: Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with TC General Order No. O-32, C.R.C., c1148 Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be supported on undisturbed or compacted soil, or not less than 150 mm of clean sand, pea gravel or clean crushed stone, and backfilled on the top and sides with not less than 300 mm of pea gravel or clean crushed stone, or 300 mm of clean sand, free of cinders and stones, and compacted in layers not more than 300 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be supported on undisturbed or compacted soil, and backfilled on the top and sides with not less than 300 mm of pea gravel or clean crushed stone, or 300 mm of clean sand, free of cinders and stones and compacted in layers not more than 300 mm thick.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than maintenance personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than for maintenance purposes.

National Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.

National Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.8.(1) shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.

National Sentence Text: Where piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.8.(1) passes through a wall that would restrict the expansion or contraction of the piping, pipe sleeves shall be provided at the wall penetration to facilitate such movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping referred to in Sentence (1) passes through a wall which would restrict the expansion or contraction of the piping, pipe sleeves shall be provided at the wall penetration to facilitate such movement.

National Sentence Text: Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to Article 4.5.6.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to Article 4.4.7.9.

National Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.9.(1) shall not be installed under combustible flooring.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall not be installed under combustible flooring.

National Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10.(1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2.(2) of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence (1) contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Overhead piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be installed close to the ceiling or beams or along walls not less than 1.8 m above the floor to protect it against mechanical damage.

National Sentence Text: Where practicable, overhead piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11.(1) shall be supported from building framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where practical, overhead piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported from building framing members.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded. (See Note A-4.5.6.12.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors of the expansion shield type used to suspend piping shall not be used to suspend piping from unsound or lightweight concrete or from gypsum assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.

National Sentence Text: To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S633-99 Flexible Underground Hose Connectors for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible metallic pipe and fittings conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S667-11 Metallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC ULC/ORD-C536-1998 Flexible Metallic Hose are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: To prevent excessive stresses resulting from vibration, settling or temperature changes flexible non-metallic hose connectors conforming to CAN/ULC-S633, Standard for Flexible Underground Hose Connectors for Flammable and Combustible Liquids are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, flexible non-metallic pipe and fittings conforming to CAN/ULC-S660, Standard for Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids , are permitted to be used where necessary in underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or flexible metallic hose connectors conforming to ULC/ORD-C536, Flexible Metallic Hose , are permitted to be used where necessary in aboveground and underground piping systems carrying flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.5.7.1.(2) and 4.5.7.1.(3), valves in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed to accommodate the temperatures and pressures of those systems and shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C842-84 Guide for the Investigation of Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3) and (4), valves in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed to accommodate the temperatures and pressures of those systems and shall conform to ULC-C842, Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids .

National Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-16 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve shall conform to CAN/ULC-S620, "Standard for Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Every emergency valve shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S651-16 Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Every emergency valve shall conform to CAN/ULC-S651, "Standard for Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids".

National Sentence Text: Where practicable, valves referred to in Sentence 4.5.7.2.(1) shall be located outdoors or be immediately accessible from outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: Where practical, valves referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located outdoors or be immediately accessible from outdoors.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.7.2.(4), steel shut-off valves shall be provided at connections to all aboveground storage tanks, on supply piping where it enters buildings or structures, on branch lines from the main supply line, on supply lines at dispensing locations, to isolate one part of a piping system from another, and to isolate meters and air eliminators.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), steel shut-off valves shall be provided at connections to all aboveground storage tanks, on supply piping where it enters buildings or structures, on branch lines from the main supply line, on supply lines at dispensing locations, to isolate one part of a piping system from another, and to isolate meters and air eliminators.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel, monel metal or lined steel bodied valves are permitted to be used when special conditions warrant their use.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel, monel metal or lined steel bodied valves are permitted to be used when special conditions warrant their use.

National Sentence Text: Diaphragm valves shall have no direct connections between the liquid and air sections that might permit leakage of the liquid past the packing into the air lines.
P/T Sentence Text: Diaphragm valves shall have no direct connections between the liquid and air sections that might permit leakage of the liquid past the packing into the air lines.

National Sentence Text: Globe valves shall be arranged so that the packing is on the low pressure side.
P/T Sentence Text: Globe valves shall be arranged so that the packing is on the low pressure side.

National Sentence Text: Rising stem or other indicating valves shall be used where necessary to determine whether the valves are open or shut.
P/T Sentence Text: Rising stem or other indicating valves shall be used where necessary to determine whether the valves are open or shut.

National Sentence Text: All valves shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
P/T Sentence Text: All valves shall be identified in conformance with CPPI, "Using the CPPI Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification", or to CAN/CGSB-24.3-92, "Identification of Piping Systems".
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Every identification tag shall be kept clean so that its colour and inscription are easily recognizable.
P/T Sentence Text: Every identification tag shall be kept clean so that its colour and inscription are easily recognizable.

National Sentence Text: Heating equipment for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed not to overheat or create an ignition source for the liquids being heated.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating equipment for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed not to overheat or create an ignition source for the liquids being heated.

National Sentence Text: A pressure regulator shall be provided in the steam line with a relief valve on the downstream side of the regulator.
P/T Sentence Text: A pressure regulator shall be provided in the steam line with a relief valve on the downstream side of the regulator.

National Sentence Text: Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating shall conform to part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating, shall conform to Subsection 4.1.4.

National Sentence Text: Thermal electrical conduction heating conforming to Sentence 4.5.8.4.(2) is permitted to be used by passing a low-voltage alternating current through the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Thermal electrical conduction heating conforming to Sentence (2) is permitted to be used by passing a low-voltage alternating current through the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Systems permitted in Sentence 4.5.8.4.(1) shall be installed and tested as complete units and shall conform to the following: unheated sections of piping shall be isolated from heated sections by means of nonconductive fittings, thermostatic controls, high temperature limit controls and fuses shall have the lowest practical rating to ensure satisfactory operation, all parts of the piping and fittings shall be enclosed by insulating coverings of a type that will prevent accidental grounding of the systems, and switches, transformers, contactors and other spark-producing equipment shall be located in an area not subject to flammable vapours.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems permitted in Sentence (1) shall be installed and tested as complete units and unheated sections of piping shall be isolated from heated sections by means of nonconductive fittings, thermostatic controls, high temperature limit controls and fuses shall have the lowest practical rating to ensure satisfactory operation, all parts of the piping and fittings shall be enclosed by insulated coverings of a type which will prevent accidental grounding of the systems, and switches, transformers, contactors and other spark-producing equipment shall be located in an area not subject to flammable vapours.

National Sentence Text: Upon completion of installation, systems permitted in Sentence 4.5.8.4.(1) shall be tested to ensure that all components are functioning as intended.
P/T Sentence Text: Upon completion of the installation, systems permitted in Sentence (1) shall be tested to ensure that all components are functioning as intended.

National Sentence Text: The use of open flames as a heat source shall not be permitted for heating piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (2), open flames shall not be used as a heat source to heat piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Pumps for flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping systems installed aboveground and outside of buildings shall be located not less than 3 m from the property line, and 1.5 m from building openings.
P/T Sentence Text: Pumps for flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping systems installed aboveground and outside of buildings shall be located not less than 3 m from the property line, and 1.5 m from building openings.

National Sentence Text: Pumps for piping systems shall be provided with duplicate control switches to shut down the pumps in case of emergency, with one located in the operating area and the other at a remote location.
P/T Sentence Text: Pumps for piping systems shall be provided with duplicate control switches to shut down the pumps in case of emergency, with one located in the operating area and the other at a remote location.

National Sentence Text: Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1) shall be designed to prevent water pressure in excess of the design pressure of the tank or piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed to prevent water pressure in excess of the design pressure of the tank or piping.

National Sentence Text: Operating pressures shall be controlled by a constant-level float valve or a pressure-regulating valve on the water supply side of the hydraulic transfer system referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Operating pressures shall be controlled by a constant-level float valve or a pressure-regulating valve on the water supply side of the hydraulic transfer system referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1) shall be arranged so that there is no water pressure on the system except when liquid is being discharged.
P/T Sentence Text: Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be arranged so that there is no water pressure on the system except when liquid is being discharged.

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred as a result of displacement by the expansion of nitrogen, carbon dioxide or other inert gases, all pressure vessels involved shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred as a result of displacement by the expansion of nitrogen, carbon dioxide or other inert gases, all pressure vessels involved shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC, "Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code".

National Sentence Text: Pressure regulators for inert gas transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.6.(1) shall be provided in the gas line to control the pressure of the gas at the minimum pressure required to force the liquid through the piping system at the required rate.
P/T Sentence Text: Pressure regulators for inert gas transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be provided in the gas line to control the pressure of the gas at the minimum pressure required to force the liquid through the piping system at the required rate.

National Sentence Text: A relief valve with a slightly higher setting than the pressure required in Sentence 4.5.9.6.(2) shall be provided on the downstream side of the regulator or on the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: A relief valve with a slightly higher setting than the pressure required in Sentence (2) shall be provided on the downstream side of the regulator or on the tank.

National Sentence Text: Means of automatically shutting off the gas supply and bleeding the gas pressure in the event of fire shall be provided on all inert gas transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.6.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Means of automatically shutting off the gas supply and bleeding the gas pressure in the event of fire shall be provided on all inert gas transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.9.7.(2), the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a closed piping system by means of compressed air or other non-inert gas pressure shall not be permitted.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to Sentence (2), compressed air or other non-inert gas pressure shall not be used in the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a closed piping system.

National Sentence Text: A non-inert gas pressure is permitted to be used in a closed piping system referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.7.(1) provided it is the vapour or gas of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred, or it is a vapour or gas that will not support combustion reaction and is non-reactive with the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred.
P/T Sentence Text: A non-inert gas pressure is permitted to be used in a closed piping system referred to in Sentence (1) provided it is the vapour or gas of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred, or it is a vapour or gas that will not support combustion reaction and is non-reactive with the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred.

National Sentence Text: Standard procedures for normal operation and for emergencies shall be given in printed form to all employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids and shall be posted for convenient reference.
P/T Sentence Text: Standard procedures for normal operations and for emergencies shall be given in printed form to all employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids and combustible liquids and shall be posted or readily available for convenient reference.

National Sentence Text: All employees concerned with transfer operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the procedures referred to in Article 4.5.10.1., the importance of constant attendance during all loading or unloading operations, extinguishing procedures for fires involving flammable liquids and combustible liquids, and the flammable liquid and combustible liquid colour coding and identification system required in Article 4.5.7.6.
P/T Sentence Text: All employees participating in transfer operations involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the procedures referred to in Article 4.4.11.1., the importance of constant attendance during all loading or unloading operations, extinguishing procedures for fires involving flammable liquids and combustible liquids, and the flammable liquids and combustible liquid colour-coding and identification system required in Article 4.4.8.6.

National Sentence Text: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.
P/T Sentence Text: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.

National Sentence Text: Signs indicating the location of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves shall be posted in conspicuous locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Signs indicating the location of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves shall be posted in conspicuous locations.

National Sentence Text: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80-B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.
P/T Sentence Text: A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.

National Sentence Text: A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment, to detect leakage, and any leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practicable.
P/T Sentence Text: A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment, to detect leakage, and any such leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practical.

National Sentence Text: Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.

National Sentence Text: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link-operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.
P/T Sentence Text: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.5.10.7.(6), maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (6), maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.

National Sentence Text: Vent piping and connections for filling and emptying storage tanks shall be located in conformance with part 4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids and dangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Section shall apply to that portion of a property where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are received in bulk quantities and are stored or handled for the purpose of being distributed.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to that portion of a property where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are received in bulk quantities and are stored or handled for the purpose of being distributed.

National Sentence Text: Requirements of this Section that pertain to the location of dispensers, storage tanks, pumps, piping and their ancillary equipment inside buildings shall not apply to a canopy that is open on not less than 75% of its perimeter.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.6.2.1.(3), outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall have an individual capacity of not more than 80 000 L, and their aggregate capacity shall not exceed 200 000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The individual capacity of outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations is permitted to exceed the individual capacity limit of 80 000 L required in Sentence 4.6.2.1.(2), provided they conform to ULC ULC-S655-98 Aboveground Protected Tank Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids and their aggregate capacity does not exceed 200 000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be provided with physical protection against collision damage, measures to prevent unauthorized access to the storage tank and its ancillary equipment, measures to contain accidental spillage in conformance with part 4., an overfill protection device in conformance with Sentence 4.3.1.8.(2), where a tight-filled connection is provided, and where the piping is connected to the storage tank at a point that is lower than the maximum fill level, an external valve to prevent gravity discharge in the event the piping is severed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In cases where a compartmentalized tank is used, the entire tank shall be treated as one tank with the aggregate of all compartments totaling the total capacity of that tank.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: All packaged flammable liquid and combustible liquid products stored or sold at a fuel-dispensing station shall be in closed containers conforming to Article 4.2.3.1., distinctly marked with the generic name of the liquid they contain.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At bulk plant rail loading and unloading facilities, the minimum distance from a storage tank to a railway line shall be in conformance with TC General Order No. O-32, C.R.C., c1148 Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: At bulk plant rail loading and unloading facilities, the minimum distance from a storage tank to a railway line shall be in conformance with Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: All piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids at a fuel-dispensing station shall be in conformance with Article 4.5.2.1.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Joints in piping systems shall comply with part 4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Underground piping systems shall comply with Sentence 4.5.6.1.(1).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be supported and backfilled in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: All piping, valves and fittings at a fuel-dispensing station shall be protected against corrosion in conformance with Article 4.5.3.1.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored outdoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.11., except that the distance between the piles and property lines and the distance between piles need not apply when the containers are stored in an area that does not present a hazard to neighbouring property.
P/T Sentence Text: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored outdoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.11., except that the distance between the piles and property lines and the distance between piles need not apply when the containers are stored in an area that does not present a hazard to neighbouring property.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be firmly supported and protected by means of guarding devices where necessary to prevent vehicular, watercraft or floatplane impact damage, or other physical damage.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Pits for subsurface pumps or for piping connected to submersed pumps shall conform to Article 4.5.9.3.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The outdoor area occupied by aboveground storage tanks, container storage, ancillary equipment and unloading facilities shall be fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.
P/T Sentence Text: An outdoor area used for aboveground storage tanks, container storage, ancillary equipment and unloading facilities for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry, not less than 1.8 m high, and provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Fixed dispensers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to CSA B346-M1980 Power-Operated Dispensing Devices for Flammable Liquids
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Dispenser sumps shall conform to the construction and performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C107.21-1992 Under-Dispenser Sumps
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Dispensers used by the general public to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles shall not be located at a bulk plant unless separated by a fence or equivalent barrier from the area in which the bulk storage operations are conducted.
P/T Sentence Text: Dispensers serving the general public for dispensing flammable liquids or combustible liquids into fuel tanks of vehicles shall not be located at a bulk plant unless separated by a fence or equivalent barrier from the area in which the bulk storage operations are conducted.

National Sentence Text: Fixed dispensers for Class I liquids shall be installed outside buildings and not less than 3 m from any right-of-way and any property line, 3 m from any propane gas dispenser, 1.5 m from any natural gas dispenser, 6 m horizontally from any fixed source of ignition, 6 m horizontally from any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or storage tank, and 3 m from any building openings, other than those that serve as shelter for operating personnel and in which electrical installations conform to Article 4.1.4.1.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The location of dispensers of Class I liquids within a building shall conform to Subsection 3.3.5. of Division B of the NBC.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Fixed dispensers shall be protected against collision damage by a concrete island not less than 100 mm high, or posts or guardrails.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Article Title: Dispensing into Metal Containers or Tanks
National Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be dispensed into a metal container or storage tank unless it is electrically connected in conformance with Article 4.1.8.2.
P/T Article Title: Dispensing into metal containers or tanks
P/T Sentence Text: Class I liquids shall not be dispensed into a metal container or storage tank unless it is electrically connected in conformance with Article 4.1.8.2.

National Sentence Text: Dispensers at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall be in a location that will prevent watercraft or floatplane impact, or other physical damage.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At a loading or unloading facility for tank vehicles or tank cars, the horizontal distance from the fill stem to an aboveground storage tank, a building or a property line shall be not less than 7.5 m for Class I liquids, and 4.5 m for Class II and IIIA liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: At a loading or unloading facility for tank vehicles or tank cars, the horizontal distance from the fill stem to an aboveground storage tank, a building or a property line shall be not less than 7.5 m for Class I liquids, and 4.5 m for Class II and IIIA liquids.

National Sentence Text: The device required in Sentence 4.3.7.2.(1) shall be clearly identified and readily accessible to attendants and emergency responders.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At bulk plant rail loading and unloading facilities, the minimum distance from a loading structure to a railway line shall be in conformance with TC General Order No. O-32, C.R.C., c1148 Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: At bulk plant rail loading and unloading facilities, the minimum distance from a loading structure to a railway line shall be in conformance with Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.

National Sentence Text: Steel shut-off valves shall be provided at connecting outlets on aboveground storage tanks.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Buildings for the shelter of personnel or pumps shall be considered a part of the loading or unloading facility.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings for the shelter of personnel or pumps shall be considered a part of the loading or unloading facility.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.4.2.(2) and in addition to the device required by Sentence 4.6.4.1.(1), an emergency shut-off switch to simultaneously stop the flow of fuel at all dispensers at self-service outlets shall be located at the central control console described in Sentence 4.6.8.2.(2) so that it is readily accessible to the attendant.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When piping and pumping systems have been used for the transfer of either flammable liquids or combustible liquids at loading or unloading facilities, the system shall be cleaned of vapours before the other class of liquid is introduced.
P/T Sentence Text: When piping and pumping systems have been used for the transfer of either flammable liquids or combustible liquids at loading or unloading facilities, the system shall be cleaned of vapours before the other class of liquid is introduced.

National Sentence Text: At card- or key-activated self-service outlets, the emergency shut-off switch required in Sentence 4.6.4.2.(1) shall be readily accessible to the customer.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At marine fuel-dispensing stations, a readily accessible valve shall be provided in each pipeline at or within 7.5 m of the pier to shut off the supply from shore.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Systems through which tank cars or tank vehicles discharge into aboveground storage tanks by means of pumps shall be provided with check valves to prevent backflow and the inadvertent mixing of liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems through which tank cars or tank vehicles discharge into storage tanks by means of a pump shall be provided with backflow preventers located to prevent spills and inadvertent mixing of liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Systems referred to in Sentence 4.7.4.3.(1) shall be designed, installed and maintained to prevent leakage or spillage.
P/T Sentence Text: Systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed, installed and maintained to prevent leakage or spillage.

National Sentence Text: Valves installed to control the filling of tank vehicles or tank cars shall be of the self-closing type.
P/T Sentence Text: Valves installed to control the filling of tank vehicles or tank cars shall be of the self-closing type.

National Sentence Text: Control valves referred to in Sentence 4.7.4.4.(1) shall be held open manually, except where automatic devices are provided for shutting off the flow in order to prevent the overfilling of tank vehicle or tank car compartments. (See Note A-4.7.4.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Control valves referred to in Sentence (1) shall be held open manually, except where automatic devices are provided for shutting off the flow in order to prevent the overfilling of tank vehicle or tank car compartments.

National Sentence Text: Bonding, grounding and isolation components for protection against static charges during the loading or unloading of tank vehicles or tank cars shall be provided when transferring flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: Bonding, grounding and isolation components for protection against static charges during the loading of tank vehicles or tank cars shall be provided when transferring flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred from or into railway tank cars, the railway tracks shall be bonded throughout their length and permanently grounded in conformance with TC SOR/82-1015 Railway Prevention of Electric Sparks Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred into railway tank cars, railway tracks shall be bonded throughout their length and permanently grounded in conformance with Railway Prevention of Electric Sparks Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.

National Sentence Text: Bonding required in Sentence 4.7.4.5.(1) shall consist of a metallic bond wire connected to the fill stem or to some part of the loading or unloading structure that is in electrical contact with the fill stem in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Bonding required in Sentence (1) shall consist of a metallic bond wire connected to the fill stem or to some part of the loading structure in electrical contact with the fill stem in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Bonding wires for tank vehicles shall be provided with a pull-off connector attached so as to be in electrical contact with the cargo tank of the tank vehicle.
P/T Sentence Text: Bonding wires for tank vehicles shall be provided with a pull-off connector attached so as to be in electrical contact with the cargo tank of the tank vehicle.

National Sentence Text: The bonding connection required in Sentence 4.7.4.5.(1) shall be fixed to the tank vehicle or storage tank before dome covers are raised and shall remain in place until filling is completed and all dome covers have been closed and secured.
P/T Sentence Text: The bonding connection required in Sentence (1) shall be fixed to the tank vehicle or storage tank before dome covers are raised and shall remain in place until filling is completed and all dome covers have been closed and secured.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.8.2.(3), when tank vehicles or tank cars are filled with Class I or II liquids through the top of the tank, the fill pipe shall terminate within 150 mm of the bottom of the tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.8.2.(2), when tank vehicles or tank cars are filled with Class I or II liquids through the top of the tank, the fill pipe shall terminate within 150 mm of the bottom of the tank.

National Sentence Text: Delivery hose shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S612-16 Hose and Hose Assemblies for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At least 2 portable extinguishers, each having a rating of not less than 80-B:C, shall be provided at hazardous locations in bulk storage plants for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
P/T Sentence Text: At least two portable extinguishers, each having a rating of not less than 80B:C, shall be provided at hazardous locations in bulk storage plants for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.

National Sentence Text: Where a retracting mechanism is used, a maximum extended length of 6 m shall be permitted.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At marine fuel-dispensing stations or at card- or key-activated dispensers, the length of extended hose is permitted to exceed the values in Sentences 4.6.5.1.(2) and 4.6.5.1.(3).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve through which a Class I or II liquid is dispensed by a motorized dispenser into a vehicle tank shall be automatic closing as required in Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2), and conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-16 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.6.5.2.(3) to 4.6.5.2.(5), a hose nozzle valve shall be constructed so that the valve can be kept open only by the continuous application of manual pressure, or is equipped with a hold-open device that is an integral part of the nozzle and that will allow automatic dispensing, automatically shut off when the vehicle tank is filled, and shut off if the nozzle is dropped or falls from the fill pipe.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A hose nozzle valve at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall be of the type without a hold-open device, in conformance with Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2).
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is used at an attended self-service outlet, a break-away coupling conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S644-16 Emergency Breakaway Fittings for Flammable and Combustible Liquids shall be provided.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Subsection shall apply to systems for dispensing flammable liquids or combustible liquids where such liquids are transferred from bulk storage to individual or multiple dispensers by pumps located elsewhere than at the dispensers.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Facilities to control possible spills of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be provided at loading and unloading points in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Facilities to control possible spills of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be provided at loading and unloading points in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Pumps, including associated control equipment, shall be designed so that the system will not be subject to pressures above the design working pressure.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Pumps shall be securely anchored and protected against damage from vehicles.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: An emergency valve conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S651-16 Emergency Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids shall be installed in the supply line so that the shear point of the valve is at a level not higher than the base of the dispenser nor more than 25 mm below it.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The emergency valve required in Sentence 4.6.6.3.(1) shall be maintained in operating condition and serviced at intervals not greater than 12 months.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Pumps installed aboveground and outside buildings shall be located not less than 3 m from any property line, and 1.5 m from any building opening.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: When an outside pump location is impractical, pumps are permitted to be installed inside buildings or in pits as provided in Article 4.6.2.6.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.6.6.5.(2), tanks and pumps not integral with the dispenser at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall be located on the shore or on a pier of the solid-fill type.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where shore locations would result in excessively long supply lines to the dispenser, storage tanks are permitted to be installed on a pier provided that the applicable portions of part 4. relating to spacing, secondary containment and piping are complied with, and the quantity stored does not exceed 5 000 L aggregate capacity.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: No storage tank at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall be located closer than 4.5 m horizontally from the normal annual high-water mark.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks located on shore and supplying marine fuel-dispensing stations are permitted to be located aboveground where rock or a high water table make underground tanks impracticable.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Where storage tanks at a marine fuel-dispensing station are elevated above the dispenser, an automatically operated valve that is designed to open only when the dispenser is being operated, so as to prevent gravity draining of the tank in the event of a rupture of the supply line to the dispenser, shall be provided at the storage tank outlet, positioned adjacent to and outside the valve specified in Article 4.3.6.1.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Piping between storage tanks located on shore and dispensers at a marine fuel-dispensing station shall conform to part 4., except that where dispensing is from a floating structure, it is permitted to use suitable lengths of flexible hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice between the piping on shore and the piping on the floating structure. (See Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Areas where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are dispensed shall be designed to be able to handle accidental spillage in conformance with part 4., and control a spill of not less than 1 000 L.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.8.1.(2), every fuel-dispensing station shall have at least one attendant referred to in Article 4.6.8.5. on duty when the station is open for business.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Fuel-dispensing stations that do not serve the general public do not require an attendant.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted at self-service outlets, a qualified attendant shall be in constant control of the dispensing of Class I and II liquids into the fuel tanks of motor vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, or into containers.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Duties of attendants and fuel-dispensing procedures, as stated in Articles 4.6.8.5. and 4.6.8.6., shall be posted at every fuel-dispensing station.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A control console shall be provided at self-service outlets within 25 m of all dispensers so that the attendant has an unobstructed view of all units at the same time.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The control console referred to in Sentence 4.6.8.2.(2) shall be equipped to regulate the operation of each dispenser.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: A 2-way communication system between the control console and each pump island shall be provided at self-service outlets.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 4.6.8.4. for card- or key-activated equipment, special dispensers including coin-operated, card-operated and preset units, shall not be permitted at self-service outlets unless there is at least one qualified attendant on duty for each 12 hoses that can be operated simultaneously while the outlet is open to the public.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Card- or key-activated dispensers are permitted at unattended self-service outlets and fuel-dispensing stations that are not open to the general public, in conformance with Sentences 4.6.8.4.(2) to 4.6.8.4.(6). (See Note A-4.6.8.4.(1).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 4.6.8.4.(3) to 4.6.8.4.(6), the installation of card- or key-activated dispensers shall conform to the requirements for self-service outlets and fuel-dispensing stations in this Section.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Operation of card- or key-activated dispensers shall be restricted to persons authorized by the supply agent to possess a card or key to operate the dispensers.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Clearly legible operating instructions, visible at all times, shall be posted at every dispenser island.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Emergency instructions, including the telephone number of the local fire department, shall be conspicuously posted to advise the user, in the event of a spill or accident, to use the emergency shut-off switch required in Article 4.6.4.2., and to call the fire department.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Attendants on duty at fuel-dispensing stations shall supervise the dispensing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, activate the controls to permit the dispensing of fuel at an individual dispenser only after the customer at the unit is ready to activate the nozzle, prevent the dispensing of flammable liquids and combustible liquids into containers that do not conform to Article 4.2.3.1., or are in a vehicle, take appropriate measures to prevent sources of ignition from creating a hazard at the dispensers, take appropriate action in the event of a spill to reduce the risk of fire, shut off the power to all dispensers in the event of a spill or fire, and perform routine visual inspections in accordance with Article 4.5.10.5.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements in Sentence 4.6.8.5.(1), attendants on duty at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall activate the controls to permit the dispensing of fuel at an individual dispenser only after all ports and hatches on the watercraft have been closed, and ensure that containers for flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are not filled beyond their safe filling level, and are filled only after they have been removed from the watercraft or floatplane.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Attendants shall be trained on how to conduct their duties.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.8.6.(2), flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be dispensed into the fuel tank of a motor vehicle, watercraft or floatplane while the engine is running.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: It is permitted to dispense a Class II or IIIA liquid into the fuel tank of a motor vehicle while its engine is running provided it is dispensed not less than 6 m away from any Class I liquid dispenser. (See Note A-4.6.8.6.(2).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Class I and II liquids shall not be dispensed at a fuel-dispensing station into the fuel tank of a motor vehicle while any part of the motor vehicle or any vehicle attached to it is on a street.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Smoking and non-fixed sources of ignition shall not be permitted within 7.5 m of a dispenser at a fuel-dispensing station.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At least one weather-resistant sign conforming to Sentences 4.6.8.8.(2) to 4.6.8.8.(4) shall be provided for each dispenser in a location visible to every driver approaching the dispenser.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The sign required in Sentence 4.6.8.8.(1) shall indicate that smoking is not permitted in the vicinity of the dispenser and that the ignition must be turned off while the vehicle is being refuelled. (See Note A-4.6.8.8.(2).)
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The sign required in Sentence 4.6.8.8.(1) shall have a minimum dimension of 200 mm, and except as permitted in Sentence 4.6.8.8.(4), have letters not less than 25 mm high.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: The sign required in Sentence 4.6.8.8.(1) is permitted to display the international "No Smoking Ignition Off" symbol not less than 100 mm in diameter.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Personnel involved in the transfer operations of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in accordance with Article 4.5.10.2.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: At least 2 portable extinguishers, each having a rating of not less than 40-B:C, shall be provided at every fuel-dispensing station.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Absorbent material to soak up liquid spillage shall be provided for use by attendants at fuel-dispensing stations in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to flammable liquid and combustible liquid installations on piers and wharves, but does not include marine fuel dispensing stations.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to flammable liquid and combustible liquid installations on piers and wharves, but does not include marine fuel dispensing stations.

National Sentence Text: Piers and wharves where cargos of flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred in bulk quantities to or from tanks of marine vessels shall be not less than 30 m from any bridge over a navigable waterway, and an entrance to a superstructure of any vehicular or railroad tunnel under a waterway.
P/T Sentence Text: Piers and wharves where cargos of flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred in bulk quantities to or from tanks of marine vessels shall be not less than 30 m from any bridge over a navigable waterway, and an entrance to a superstructure of any vehicular or railroad tunnel under a waterway.

National Sentence Text: The termination of fixed piping for loading and unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be not less than 60 m from a bridge or from an entrance to a tunnel.
P/T Sentence Text: The termination of fixed piping for loading and unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be not less than 60 m from a bridge or from an entrance to a tunnel.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks shall be installed on shore in conformance with Subsections 4.3.2. to 4.3.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks shall be installed on shore in conformance with Subsections 4.3.2. to 4.3.7.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be located in buildings on piers and wharves of solid-fill or noncombustible construction provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.13. to 4.3.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be located in buildings on piers and wharves of solid-fill or noncombustible construction provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.12. to 4.3.14.

National Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be buried in piers and wharves of the solid-fill type provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.8. to 4.3.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tanks are permitted to be buried in piers and wharves of the solid-fill type provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.8. to 4.3.11.

National Sentence Text: The method of installation and materials used for piping, valves and fittings shall conform to Section 4.5.
P/T Sentence Text: The method of installation and materials used for piping, valves and fittings shall conform to Section 4.4.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be properly supported and arranged to prevent excessive vibration or strain on equipment connected to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be properly supported and arranged to prevent excessive vibration or strain on equipment connected to it.

National Sentence Text: Piping supports shall consist of wood having no dimension less than 150 mm, steel, or concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping supports shall consist of wood having no dimension less than 150 mm, steel, or concrete.

National Sentence Text: Where pipe is supported more than 1.2 m above the pier deck, piping supports shall have a minimum fire-resistance rating of 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Where pipe is supported more than 1.2 m above the pier deck, piping supports shall have a fire"resistance rating not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Piping between the shore and piers or wharves shall be provided with swing joints or flexible connections designed in conformance with good engineering practice to permit the independent movement of the pier or wharf and shore piping without strain on the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping between the shore and piers or wharves shall be provided with swing joints or flexible connections designed in conformance with good engineering practice to permit the independent movement of the pier or wharf and shore piping without strain on the pipe.

National Sentence Text: A readily accessible valve to shut off the supply from shore shall be provided in each pipeline within 7.5 m of piers and wharves.
P/T Sentence Text: A readily accessible valve to shut off the supply from shore shall be provided in each pipeline within 7.5 m of piers and wharves.

National Sentence Text: Access openings for inspection purposes below deck shall be provided for valves required in Article 4.8.4.5. and for connections to pipelines, and suitable signs shall be posted indicating their locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Access openings for inspection purposes below deck shall be provided for valves required in Article 4.7.4.5. and for connections to pipelines, and suitable signs shall be posted indicating their locations.

National Sentence Text: No freight or materials shall be placed on piers and wharves in such a manner as to obstruct the access openings required in Sentence 4.8.4.6.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: No freight or materials shall be placed on piers and wharves in such a manner as to obstruct the access openings required in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Identification tags or labels of metal or other material impervious to water and to the flammable liquids or combustible liquids being transferred shall be attached to and maintained on all pipelines and control valves to designate their use.
P/T Sentence Text: Identification tags or labels of metal or other material impervious to water and to the flammable liquids or combustible liquids being transferred shall be attached to and maintained on all pipelines and control valves to designate their use.

National Sentence Text: Piping systems shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Section 4.4. before being put into service and before reactivation when used on a seasonal basis.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping systems shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsection 4.4.6. before being put into service and before reactivation when used on a seasonal basis.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.8.4.8.(1) shall be tested at intervals no greater than 12 months.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground piping systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be tested at intervals not greater than 12 months.

National Sentence Text: Railway tracks on piers and wharves shall be bonded throughout their length and permanently grounded in conformance with TC SOR/82-1015 Railway Prevention of Electric Sparks Regulations
P/T Sentence Text: Railway tracks on piers and wharves shall be bonded throughout their length and permanently grounded in conformance with Railway Prevention of Electric Sparks Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.

National Sentence Text: Insulating joints shall be placed in all rails where entering upon the pier or wharf.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating joints shall be placed in all rails where entering upon the pier or wharf.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers having a rating of 40-B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of Class I liquid pumps and fuel dispensers.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers having a rating of 40B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of Class I liquid pumps and fuel dispensers in conformance with Section 6.2.
Variation Label: Flammable and combustible liquids, and flammable gases

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be kept in the pump house or other suitable location where they will be accessible in the event of an emergency, but not accessible to the public.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers shall be kept in the pump house or other suitable location where they will be accessible in the event of an emergency, but not accessible to the public.

National Sentence Text: Where marine vessels are loading or unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids or are being refuelled, portable extinguishers with a rating of not less than 40-B:C shall be placed on the pier or wharf in the vicinity of loading or unloading operations so that they are accessible in the event of a fire emergency.
P/T Sentence Text: Where marine vessels are loading or unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids or are being refuelled, portable extinguishers with a rating of not less than 40B:C shall be placed on the pier or wharf in the vicinity of loading or unloading operations, so that they are accessible in the event of a fire emergency.

National Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers provided in conformance with Sentence 4.8.6.1.(3) shall be in addition to those provided on board the marine vessels.
P/T Sentence Text: Portable extinguishers provided in conformance with Sentence (3) shall be in addition to those provided on board the marine vessels.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.8.7.1.(2), the bulk transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be permitted only on piers and wharves used exclusively for that purpose.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the bulk transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall take place only on piers and wharves used exclusively for that purpose.

National Sentence Text: Where it is not practicable to locate bulk transfer stations on separate piers and wharves, such stations are permitted to be located on general purpose piers and wharves provided that guards or fences are installed around valves or pumping equipment to prevent entry of unauthorized personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Where it is not practical to locate bulk transfer stations on separate piers and wharves, such stations may be located on general purpose piers and wharves provided that guards or fences are installed around valves or pumping equipment to prevent entry of unauthorized personnel.

National Sentence Text: Measures to accommodate possible leakage or spillage from hose couplings shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Measures to accommodate possible leakage or spillage from hose couplings shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made to prevent spillage resulting from the disconnection of hoses.
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made to prevent spillage resulting from the disconnection of hoses.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.8.7.3.(2), hose connections on piping shall be of the bolted flange type, and all such connections shall be provided with shut-off valves.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), hose connections on piping shall be of the bolted flange type, and all such connections shall be provided with shut-off valves.

National Sentence Text: Hose connections shall not project beyond the face of piers and wharves.
P/T Sentence Text: Hose connections shall not project beyond the face of piers and wharves.

National Sentence Text: Cargo hose shall be maintained in satisfactory operating condition and be pressure tested, at intervals not greater than 12 months, to 1.5 times the maximum working pressure but not less than 350 kPa (gauge).
P/T Sentence Text: Cargo hose shall be maintained in satisfactory operating condition and be pressure tested, at intervals not greater than 12 months, to 1.5 times the maximum working pressure but not less than 350 kPa (gauge).

National Sentence Text: Cargo hose shall be supported where it is not run on a solid foundation.
P/T Sentence Text: Cargo hose shall be supported where it is not run on a solid foundation.

National Sentence Text: Cargo pumps capable of producing pressures in excess of the safe working pressure of the cargo hose shall be provided with pressure relief devices such as return lines or relief valves.
P/T Sentence Text: Cargo pumps capable of producing pressures in excess of the safe working pressure of the cargo hose shall be provided with pressure relief devices such as return lines or relief valves.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.8.9.2.(2), cargo pumps shall be located on shore or on piers and wharves either of noncombustible construction or of the solid-fill type, and not less than 3 m from other buildings or structures.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), cargo pumps shall be located on shore or on piers and wharves either of noncombustible construction or of the solid-fill type, and not less than 3 m from other buildings or structures.

National Sentence Text: Where it is not practicable to install cargo pumps as required in Sentence 4.8.9.2.(1), they are permitted to be installed on piers and wharves of combustible construction if located in pump houses conforming to Subsection 4.8.10., and located not less than 3 m from other buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Where it is not practicable to install cargo pumps as required in Sentence (1), they are permitted to be installed on piers and wharves of combustible construction if located in pump houses conforming to Subsection 4.7.10., and located not less than 3 m from other buildings.

National Sentence Text: Pump houses shall be of noncombustible construction with floors that are chemically resistant to the liquid being handled, liquid-tight and equipped with curbs or flashings around the base of the wall not less than 100 mm in height to contain any spilled liquid.
P/T Sentence Text: Pump houses shall be of noncombustible construction with floors that are chemically resistant to the liquid being handled, liquid-tight and equipped with curbs or flashings around the base of the wall not less than 100 mm in height to contain any spilled liquid.

National Sentence Text: Transfer operations shall be carried out only under the continuous supervision of a person qualified to supervise such operations.
