National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5 (2)., systems for the ventilation of commercial cooking equipment shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to NFPA 96 Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., all commercial cooking equipment shall be provided with ventilation systems designed, constructed and installed to conform to NFPA 96, "Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations".

National Sentence Text: Fire protection systems for commercial cooking equipment referred to in Sentence 6.3.1.7.(1) using vegetable oil or animal fat shall conform to UL ANSI/UL 300, Fire Testing of Fire Extinguishing Systems for Protection of Commercial Cooking Equipment or ULC ULC/ORD-C1254.6, Fire Testing of Restaurant Cooking Area Fire Extinguishing System Units
P/T Sentence Text: Fire protection systems for high efficiency, high temperature commercial cooking equipment using vegetable oil or animal fat shall conform to,(a) ANSI/UL 300, "Fire Extinguishing Systems for Protection of Commercial Cooking Equipment", or (b) ULC/ORD-C1254.6, "Fire Testing of Restaurant Cooking Area Fire Extinguishing System Units".

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by Part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by Part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection does not apply to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit within the scope of Part 9.

National Sentence Text: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, and installed so that water drains freely from the pan.
P/T Sentence Text: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are,(a) designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality", (b) provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, (c) installed so that water drains freely from the pan, and (d) provided with a drain line that is indirectly connected to a drainage system in accordance with Article 7.4.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Ducts that are used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be resistant to moisture induced corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials in Sentences (1) to (4) installed in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be corrosion-resistant.

National Sentence Text: All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed as recommended in SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Standards.
P/T Sentence Text: All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed in conformance with SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Handbooks.

National Sentence Text: All duct materials shall be suitable for exposure to the temperature and humidity of the air being carried and shall be resistant to corrosion caused by contaminants in the air being conveyed in the duct.
P/T Sentence Text: All duct materials and fittings shall be,(a) suitable for exposure to the temperature and humidity of the air being conveyed, and (b) resistant to corrosion due to contaminants in the air being conveyed in the duct.

National Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have tight-fitting connections throughout.
Coverings,linings and associated adhesives and insulation used in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.4.
The clearance of ducts and plenums from combustible materials shall comply with Article 3.6.5.6.
Air duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.3. Connections and Openings in Air Duct Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Air duct systems shall have,(a) tight-fitting connections throughout, and (b) no openings other than those required for proper operation, inspection and maintenance of the system.

National Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed and installed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, not be connected directly to a sewer, and be installed and constructed of materials recommended by ASHRAE and SMACNA Standards and HRAI Manuals.
P/T Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall,(a) be constructed and installed with a slope to provide interior drainage to all low points, (b) not be connected directly to a sewer, and (c) be installed and constructed of materials in conformance with ASHRAE Handbooks, SMACNA Manuals and the HRAI Digest.

National Sentence Text: Fire dampers shall conform to Article 3.1.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire dampers shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 3.1.8.

National Sentence Text: Air handling systems shall incorporate smoke detectors where and as required by Article 3.2.4.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Air handling systems shall incorporate smoke detector control where required by Article 3.2.4.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(2), exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Note A-6.3.2.10.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for inspection and cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) designed and installed so that the entire duct can be cleaned, and (c) constructed of smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(12) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (10) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences 6.3.2.10.(10) and 6.3.2.10.(11) may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building, provided the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent the passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(12)(b)).
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences (8) and (9) may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building provided,(a) the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or (b) the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming on the inside or outside of the ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming inside or outside of the ducts.

National Sentence Text: In a care or residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: In a residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor or public stairway.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts referred to in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(10) are permitted to exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors, provided the storage garage's exhaust system runs continuously, the capacity of the storage garage's exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S112.1 Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building's exhaust fan is shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: Where exhaust ducts are provided in conformance with Sentence 6.2.3.8.(6), they may exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors provided, (a) the storage garage exhaust system runs continuously, (b) the capacity of the storage garage exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and (c) a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with CAN/ULC-S112.1, "Leakage Rated Dampers for Use in Smoke Control Systems", is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building's exhaust fan is shut down.

National Sentence Text: Return-air systems shall comply with Article 3.6.5.8.
Where a ceiling space is used as a return-air plenum, the requirements of Article 3.6.4.3. shall apply.
Makeup air facilities required by Sentence 6.3.2.8.(1) shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.
P/T Sentence Text: Make-up air facilities required by Sentence (1) shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.

National Sentence Text: Where makeup air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.
P/T Sentence Text: Where make-up air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 m above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 000 mm above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diameter sphere.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to prevent the screen openings from icing over.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to avoid icing over of the screen openings.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence 6.3.2.9.(4) shall be accessible for maintenance.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence (3) shall be accessible for maintenance.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices covering supply, return, intake and exhaust openings shall comply with Article 3.6.5.7. 3.6.5.7.(1) Combustible grilles, diffusers, and other devices for supply, return and exhaust air openings shall conform to the flame spresd rating and smoke developped classification requirements for the interior finish of the surface on which hey are installed.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.12. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices for supply, return and exhaust air openings in rooms shall conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements for the interior finish of the surface on which they are installed.

National Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened and, in dwelling units, when the system circulating fan is not operating.

National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air quality conditions do not meet the requirements of Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2), ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1) shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce particles and gases to the maximum acceptable levels described in Sentence 6.2.1.2.(2)prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

Where contaminants of concern are present in the outdoor air of the local area of the building site, ventilation required by Sentence 6.3.1.1.(1)shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce the concentrations of contaminants to those permitted in the ACGIH s Industrial Ventilation: A Manual of Recommended Practice for Design prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Discharge from evaporative cooling towers to ventilation air intakes shall comply with Sentence 6.3.2.9.(2), and CSA CAN/CSA-Z317.2-10 Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning (HVAC) Systems in Health Care Facilities
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14. Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers
P/T Sentence Text: Discharge from evaporative cooling towers to ventilation air intakes shall comply with CAN/CSA-Z317.2, "Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Systems in Health Care Facilities".

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article2.6.2.1. of Division B of the NPC.

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Water treatment equipment for biological growth control shall be provided in accordance with Sub-Section 7.6.2. of ASHRAE Guideline 12, Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14. Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with water treatment equipment for biological growth control in accordance with Subsection 7.6.2. of ASHRAE Guideline 12, "Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems".

National Article Title: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
National Sentence Text: Drains, overflows and blow-downs shall be connected to the building s drainage system in accordance with Clause 2.4.2.1.(1)(e) of Division B of the NPC.
The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative air cooler enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14A. Evaporative Cooling Sections, Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers andHumidifiers
P/T Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative cooling section enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Sumps for air washers and evaporative air coolers shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14A. Evaporative Cooling Sections, Evaporative Air Coolers,
P/T Sentence Text: Sumps for air washer and evaporative cooling sections shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.

National Sentence Text: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12, Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.14A. Evaporative Cooling Sections, Evaporative Air Coolers,
P/T Sentence Text: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12, "Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems".

National Sentence Text: The filter and water evaporation medium of every air washer and evaporative air cooler enclosed within a building shall be made of noncombustible material.

Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and does not allow the air in the duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler room or furnace room.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.3.15. Fans and Associated Air Handling Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation, (a) does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and (b) does not allow the air in the air duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler-room or furnaceroom.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by Part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of this Subsection apply to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit within the scope of Part 9.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall be constructed and installed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, not be connected directly to a sewer, and be installed and constructed of materials recommended by ASHRAE and SMACNA Standards and HRAI Manuals.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.3. Construction and Installation of Ducts and Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Underground ducts shall, (a) be constructed and installed with a slope to provide interior drainage to all low points, (b) not be connected directly to a sewer, and (c) be installed and constructed of materials in conformance with ASHRAE Handbooks, SMACNA Manuals and the HRAI Digest.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: Linings of ducts shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop stop flaps and other closures.
P/T Sentence Text: Linings of ducts shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence 6.3.2.9.(4) shall be accessible for maintenance.
P/T Article Title: 6.2.4.13. Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
P/T Sentence Text: Screens required in Sentence (3) shall be accessible for maintenance.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.
P/T Sentence Text: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or when the system circulating fan is not operating.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: Except for appliances installed in dwelling units, fuel-fired heating appliances shall be located, enclosed or separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with part 3. (See also part 9.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for appliances installed in dwelling units, fuel-fired heating appliances shall be located, enclosed or separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Section 3.6.
Variation Label: Air Ducts for Low Capacity Systems

National Sentence Text: Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to Table 6.2.9.3.

National Sentence Text: Every steam or hot water radiator and convector shall be installed so as to conform to the clearance requirements of Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Every steam or hot water radiator and convector shall be installed to conform to the clearance requirements of Table 6.2.9.3.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles 3.1.5.19., 3.1.9.1., 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7. for fire safety requirements.)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal service space or a vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on that piping shall have a flame-spread rating, on any exposed surface and on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, not more than 25 in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, or not more than 75 in a building permitted to be of combustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (7), where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal or vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on such pipes shall have a flame-spread rating throughout the material of not more than 25 in buildings of noncombustible construction and not more than 75 in buildings of combustible construction.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence (2) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than that required for the interior finish of the ceiling of the room or space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (7), insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence (3) shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than that required for the interior finish for the ceiling of the room or space.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 70° C. (See Note A-6.5.1.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 70° C. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: No flame-spread rating or smoke developed classification limits are required for combustible insulation and coverings used on piping located within a concealed space in a wall, floor slab, or noncombustible enclosure.
P/T Sentence Text: No flame-spread rating or smoke developed classification limitations are required where combustible insulation and coverings are used on piping when such piping is, (a) located within a concealed space in a wall, (b) located in a floor slab, or (c) enclosed in a noncombustible raceway or conduit.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 6.7.1.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 6.2.9.3.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above l20°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Unprotected steam or hot water pipes that pass through a storage space shall be covered with not less than 25 mm thickness of noncombustible insulation to prevent direct contact with the material stored.
P/T Sentence Text: Unprotected steam or hot water pipes that pass through a storage space shall be covered with not less than 25 mm of noncombustible insulation to prevent direct contact with the material stored.
Variation Label: Piping for Heating and Cooling Systems

National Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired fumace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the fumnce, provided the fumace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace, provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed, (a) in parallel with the heating furnace, (b) upstream of the furnace, provided the furnace is designed for such application, or (c) downstream of the furnace, provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.
Variation Label: Refrigerating Systems and Equipment for Air-Conditioning

National Sentence Text: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where solid fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.

National Sentence Text: A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening

National Sentence Text: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy or in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.

National Sentence Text: For each suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage is located in a building containing a residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide (CO) alarms required by this Article shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the electrical system serving the suite (see Note A-6.9.3.1.(2)(c)), and be mechanically fixed at a height above the floor as recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: The carbon monoxide alarms required by Article 6.2.12.2. shall,(a) except as permitted in Sentence (2), be permanently connected to an electrical circuit and shall have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the carbon monoxide alarm, (b) be wired so that its activation will activate all carbon monoxide alarms within the suite, where located within a suite of residential occupancy, (c) be equipped with an alarm that is audible within bedrooms when the intervening doors are closed, where located in a suite of residential occupancy, and (d) conform to, (i) CAN/CSA-6.19, "Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices", or (ii) UL 2034, "Single and Multiple Station Carbon Monoxide Alarms".

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to laboratories where dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that creates a fire or explosion hazard.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to laboratories intended as a location where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that dangerous goods vapours and particles do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.
P/T Sentence Text: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that flammable vapours,(a) do not accumulate in the laboratory, (b) are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, (c) do not accumulate in the ventilation system, (d) are exhausted to the outdoors, and (e) are not returned to the building.

National Sentence Text: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the NFC.

The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC shall conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.
P/T Sentence Text: The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3. shall,(a) conform to NFPA 91, "Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists and Noncombustible Particulate Solids", (b) provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, (c) confine flammable vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, (d) not return the exhausted air to the building, and (e) be provided with well identified control switches that are, (i) located outside the power-ventilated enclosure, and (ii) readily accessible in case of an emergency.

National Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the NFC and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences 6.3.4.4.(2) and 6.3.4.4.(3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.
P/T Sentence Text: The power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3. and its exhaust duct system shall,(a) except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the flammable vapours and particles being exhausted, and (b) be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating required by Sentence 6.3.4.4.(2) is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating required in Sentence (2) is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 6.3.3.2. and 6.3.3.3., the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standard listed in Article 6.2.1.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 6.3.1.2. and 6.3.1.3., the products of combustion from solid fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standards listed in Article 6.2.1.4.

National Sentence Text: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to part 9. if they serve appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or fireplaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to Part 9 if they serve,(a) appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or (b) fireplaces.

National Sentence Text: Masonry or concrete chimneys other than those described in Sentence 6.3.3.2.(1) shall be designed and installed in conformance with the appropriate requirements in NFPA 211, Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry or concrete chimneys other than those described in Sentence (1) shall be designed and installed in conformance with the appropriate requirements in NFPA 211, "Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances".

National Sentence Text: Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2.5 m from ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2 500 mm from ground level.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 6.2.1.5., vented products of combustion, other than those referred to in Sentence (1), shall be discharged away from the building, so as not to re-enter it, to a distance not less than 2.15 m above sidewalks and driveways, 3m from outdoor air intakes, 3 m horizontally or vertically from doors and operable windows, and 3 m horizontally or vertically from occupiable outdoor spaces, excluding maintenance spaces. (See Note A-6.3.3.1.(2).)
Dwelling units shall be equipped with plumbing facilities as required in Section 9.31

Except as provided in Sentence 9.3.1.1.(2) and Articles 9.3.1.6. and 9.3.1.7., unreinforced and nominally reinforced concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed, cured and tested in accordance with the requirements for "R" class concrete stated in Section 9 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Articles 9.3.1.6. and 9.3.1.7., unreinforced and nominally reinforced concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed, cured and tested in accordance with the requirements for "R" class concrete stated in 9 of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.3.1.1.(4), reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), Subsection 9.15.4. and Section 9.39., reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.

National Sentence Text: For flat insulating concrete form walls not exceeding 2 storeys in building height and having a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, in buildings of light-frame construction containing only a single dwelling unit, the concrete and reinforcing shall comply with Part 4 or the concrete shall conform to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction with a maximum aggregate size of 19 mm, and the reinforcing shall conform to CSA G30.18-09 Carbon Steel Bars for Concrete Reinforcement have a minimum specified yield strength of 400 MPa, and be lapped a minimum of 450 mm for 10M bars and 650 mm for 15M bars (see also Articles 9.15.4.5. and 9.20.17.2. to 9.20.17.4.).
P/T Sentence Text: For flat insulating concrete form walls described in Clause 9.15.1.1.(1)(c) or 9.20.1.1.(1)(b), the concrete and reinforcing shall comply with Part 4 or,(a) the concrete shall conform to CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction", with a maximum aggregate size of 19 mm, and (b) the reinforcing shall, (i) conform to CSA G30.18, "Carbon Steel Bars for Concrete Reinforcement", (ii) have a minimum specified yield strength of 400 MPa, and (iii) be lapped a minimum of 450 mm for 10M bars and 650 mm for 15M bars.

National Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

National Article Title: Concrete in Contact with Sulphate Soil
National Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulphate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6 of CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction
P/T Article Title: 9.3.1.3. Concrete in Contact With Sulfate Soil
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulfate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6. of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

National Sentence Text: Site-batched concrete used for garage and carport floors and exterior steps shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%.
P/T Sentence Text: Site-batched concrete used for garage floors, carport floors and exterior flatwork shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%.

National Sentence Text: For pre-mixed concrete and for the site-batched concrete mixes described in Table 9.3.1.7., the maximum ratio of water to cementing materials measured by weight shall not exceed 0.70 for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 0.65 for floors other than those in garages and carports, and 0.45 for garage and carport floors, and exterior steps.
P/T Sentence Text: For pre-mixed concrete and for the site-batched concrete mixes described in Table 9.3.1.7., the maximum ratio of water to cementing materials measured by weight shall not exceed,(a) 0.45 for garage floors, carport floors and all exterior flatwork, (b) 0.65 for interior floors other than those for garages and carports, and (c) 0.70 for all other applications.

National Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence 9.3.1.7.(1) shall not exceed 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence (1) shall not exceed,(a) 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or (b) 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.

National Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C 260/C 260M-10a Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete or ASTM C 494/C 494M-13 Chemical Admixtures for Concrete as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C260 / C260M, "Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete", or ASTM C494 / C494M, "Chemical Admixtures for Concrete", as applicable.

National Sentence Text: When the air temperature is below 5Â°C, concrete shall be kept at a temperature of not less than 10Â°C or more than 25Â°C while being mixed and placed, and maintained at a temperature of not less than 10Â°C for 72 h after placing.
P/T Sentence Text: When the air temperature is below 5ÃÂ°C , concrete shall be,(a) kept at a temperature of not less than 10ÃÂ°C or more than 25ÃÂ°C while being mixed and placed, and (b) maintained at a temperature of not less than 10ÃÂ°C for 72 h after placing.

National Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence 9.3.1.9.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Lumber for joists, rafters, trusses and beams and for the uses listed in Table 9.3.2.1. shall be identified by a grade stamp to indicate its grade as determined by NLGA 2014 Standard Grading Rules for Canadian Lumber (See Note A-9.3.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber for joists, rafters, trusses and beams and for the uses listed in Table 9.3.2.1. shall be identified by a grade stamp to indicate its grade as determined by the NLGA, "Standard Grading Rules for Canadian Lumber". (SeeÃ AppendixÃ A.)

National Sentence Text: Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in Table 9.3.2.1. (See Article 9.23.4.2. for joists, rafters and beams and Article 9.23.14.11. for trusses.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in Table 9.3.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.1.

National Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating the manufacturer of the material, the standard to which it is produced, and that the material is of an exterior type.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating,(a) the manufacturer of the material, (b) the standard to which it is produced, and (c) that the material is of an exterior type.

National Sentence Text: Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with CSA O141-05 Softwood Lumber
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with CSA O141, "Softwood Lumber".

National Sentence Text: The thicknesses specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated herein.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated in this Part.

National Sentence Text: Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the Span Tables for full size members. (See Note A-9.3.2.8.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the span tables for full size members. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.
P/T Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur,(a) clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence (2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or (b) structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.

National Sentence Text: Structural wood elements shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the vertical clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm (see also Articles 9.23.2.2 . and 9.23.2.3.), or where the wood elements are not protected from exposure toprecipitation, the configuration is conducive to moisture accumulation, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00. (See Note A-9.3.2.9.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Structural wood elements shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the vertical clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of CSA CAN/CSA-O80.1-08 Specification of Treated Wood as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, "Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures", of CAN/CSA-O80.1, "Specification of Treated Wood", as follows:(a) Use Category 1, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member remains dry, (b) Use Category 2, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, (c) Use Category 3.2, where the wood member is used in, (i) exterior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, (d) Use Category 4.1, where, (i) the wood member is used in contact with the ground, (ii) the wood member is used in contact with fresh water, or (iii) the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or (e) Use Category 4.2, where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.

National Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of ASTM A 653/A 653M-13 Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process or ASTM A 792/A 792M-10 Steel Sheet, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of,(a) ASTM A653 / A653M, "Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process", or (b) ASTM A792 / A792M, "Sheet Steel, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process".

National Sentence Text: Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 [Z275] coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 (Z275) coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, be designed according to good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction or be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in Part 9, or Part 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall,(a) conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, (b) be designed according to good engineering practice such as provided in the CWC, "Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction", or (c) be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in, (i) this Part, or (ii) Part 4.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to light-frame constructions whose wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of frames of small repetitive structural members, and where the roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the clear span of any structural member does not exceed 12.2 m, the maximum deflection of the structural roof members conforms to Article 9.4.3.1., the maximum total roof area, notwithstanding any separation of adjoining buildings by firewalls, is 4 550 m2 , and for flat roofs, there are no significant obstructions on the roof, such as parapet walls, spaced closer than the distance calculated by Do=10Ho-0.8 Ss/gwhereDo = minimum distance between obstructions, m, Ho = height of the obstruction above the roof, m, Ss = ground snow load, kPa, and  = specific weight of snow, kN/m3.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to light-frame construction whose wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of frames of small repetitive structural members, and where,(a) the roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, (b) the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 610 mm o.c., (c) the clear span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m, (d) the maximum deflection of the structural roof members conforms to Article 9.4.3.1., (e) the maximum total roof area, notwithstanding any separation of adjoining buildings by firewalls, is 4 550 m2, and (f) for flat roofs, there are no significant obstructions on the roof, such as parapet walls, spaced closer than the distance calculated by, Do = 10(Ho Ã¢â¬" 0.8 Ss / ÃÂ³) where, Do = minimum distance between obstructions, m, Ho = height of the obstruction above the roof, m, Ss = ground snow load, kPa, and ÃÂ³ = unit weight of snow, kN/m3. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.4.2.2.(2) and 9.4.2.2.(3), specified snow loads shall be not less than those calculated using the following formula: S=CbSs+SrwhereS= specified snow load, Cb = basic snow load roof factor, which is 0.45 where the entire width of the roof does not exceed 4.3 m and 0.55 for all other roofs, Ss = 1-in-50-year ground snow load in kPa, determined according to part 1., and Sr = associated 1-in-50-year rain load in kPa, determined according to part 1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), specified snow loads shall be not less than those calculated using the following formula:S = Cb Ã¢Ëâ¢ Ss + Sr where, S = specified snow load, Cb = basic snow load roof factor, which is 0.45 where the entire width of a roof does not exceed 4.3 m and 0.55 for all other roofs, Ss = 1-in-50 year ground snow load in kPa, determined according to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data", and Sr = associated 1-in-50 year rain load in kPa, determined according to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data".

National Sentence Text: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.
P/T Sentence Text: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.1.6.

National Sentence Text: The ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Note A-9.4.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence 9.4.3.1.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be determined in accordance with part 9., or designed in accordance with part 4. using the maximum allowable bearing pressures in Table 9.4.4.1., or allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.
P/T Sentence Text: Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be, (a) determined in accordance with Section 9.15., or (b) designed in accordance with 4.2. using, (i) the maximum allowable bearing pressures in Table 9.4.4.1., or (ii) allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.

National Article Title: Foundation Capacity in Weaker Soil and Rock
National Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in Sentence 9.4.4.2.(1), the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60Â° to the horizontal.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.2. Foundation Capacity in Weaker Soil and Rock
P/T Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in Sentence (1), the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60ÃÂ° to the horizontal.

National Sentence Text: Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce its effects on the building so that the buildingâs stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce the effects on the building so that the buildingÃ¢â¬â¢s stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid that has a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or in accordance with Section 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.6. Walls Supporting Drained Earth (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where constructed in accordance with Section 9.15., walls supporting drained earth shall be designed, (a) for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid with a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or (b) in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed for the pressure described in Sentence 9.4.4.6.(1) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or in accordance with part 4. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.4.4.6. Walls Supporting Drained Earth (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed, (a) for the pressure described in Clause (1)(a) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or (b) in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the area of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the ceiling heights and clear heights in rooms or spaces in residential occupancies shall conform to Table 9.5.3.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.5.3.1. Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: The ceiling heights of rooms or spaces in residential occupancies and live/work units shall conform to Table 9.5.3.1.
Variation Label: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces

National Sentence Text: The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in occupancies other than residential occupancies shall be not less than 2.1 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in all occupancies shall be not less than 2 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm where there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and a second exit is provided in the hallway near the end farthest from the living area, or in each bedroom served by the hallway.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm, where,(a) there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and (b) a second exit is provided, (i) in the hallway near the end furthest from the living area, or (ii) in each bedroom served by the hallway.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.5.5.1.(2) and Articles 9.5.5.3. , 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.3., doorway openings within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be designed to accommodate at least the door sizes given in Table 9.5.5.1. for swing-type and folding doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.5.11.3., 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.3., doorway openings within dwelling units shall be designed to accommodate at least the door sizes in Table 9.5.11.1. for swing-type doors or folding doors.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to glass in interior doors and interior windows and their sidelights, clothes closets, site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, shower or bathtub enclosures, glazed panels and partitions, and the protection of glass.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to,(a) glass in, (i) interior windows and interior doors and their sidelights, (ii) clothes closets, (iii) site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, (iv) shower or bathtub enclosures, (v) glazed panels and partitions, and (b) the protection of glass.

National Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.2-M91 Flat, Clear Sheet Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.3-M91 Flat, Clear Float Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.4-M91 Heat Absorbing Glass CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.8-97 Insulating Glass Units CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.10-M76 Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass or ASTM E 2190-10 Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation
P/T Sentence Text: Glass shall conform to,(a) CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass," (b) CAN/CGSB-12.2-M, "Flat, Clear Sheet Glass", (c) CAN/CGSB-12.3-M, "Flat, Clear Float Glass", (d) CAN/CGSB-12.4-M, "Heat Absorbing Glass," (e) CAN/CGSB-12.8, "Insulating Glass Units", (f) CAN/CGSB-12.10-M, "Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting", (g) CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass", or (h) ASTM E2190, "Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation".

National Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-82.6-M86 Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe (See Note A-9.6.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Mirrored glass doors reinforced with a film backing shall meet the impact resistance requirements specified in CAN/CGSB-12.5-M, "Mirrors, Silvered".

National Sentence Text: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows shall conform to Tables 9.6.1.3.-A to 9.6.1.3.-C, where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less, and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or Tables 9.6.1.3.-D to 9.6.1.3.-F. (See Note A-9.6.1.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows is permitted to conform to,(a) Tables 9.6.1.3.A. to 9.6.1.3.C., where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or (b) Tables 9.6.1.3.D. to 9.6.1.3.F. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a dwelling unit and in public areas shall be safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a house or an individual dwelling unit and in public areas shall be,(a) safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or (b) wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), glass in entrance doors to dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(1) where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), glass in entrance doors to houses or individual dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence (1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence (1) where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.
Variation Label: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 9.6.1.4.(2) , 9.6.1.4.(3) and 9.6.1.4.(5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences (2), (3) and (5), except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.

National Article Title: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.6.1.4.(4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.
P/T Article Title: 9.6.1.4. Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.

National Sentence Text: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or a sidelight.
P/T Sentence Text: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with,(a) a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or (b) a sidelight.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings to protect persons from falling through them shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings against persons falling through the window or door opening shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to Subsection 9.9.10.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to Subsection 9.10.12.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.2.2. Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to Subsection 9.10.20.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(1) to 9.7.3.1.(4) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in part 9. or 9., and part 9., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences (1) to (4) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in, (i) Subsection 9.7.4. or 9.7.5., and (ii) Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights and their components described in Sentence 9.7.1.1.(1) shall be designed, constructed and installed to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component (see Note A-9.7.3.2.(1)(a)), and ensure comfortable conditions for occupants.
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights described in Clause 9.7.1.1.(1)(a) and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed to,(a) minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component, and (See Appendix A.) (b) ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence 9.7.3.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence 9.7.3.3.(1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as vehicular access doors, storm windows and doors, or windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence (1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as,(a) vehicular access doors, (b) storm windows and doors, or (c) windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in buildings where the intended use of the interior space will not result in high moisture generation shall have a maximum thermal transmittance (U-value) or minimum temperature index (I) in accordance with Table 9.7.3.3.
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in buildings where the intended use of the interior space will not result in high moisture generation shall have a maximum thermal transmittance (Uvalue) or minimum temperature index (I) in accordance with Table 9.7.3.3.
Variation Label: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights

National Article Title: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights with or without storm doors or sash that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with part 5. (See Note A-9.25.5.2.)
P/T Article Title: 9.7.3.3. Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
P/T Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with Subsection 5.3.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights covered in the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, NAFS North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard).
