National Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area above or below the first storey is permitted to lead through a lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than one exit from a floor area is permitted to lead through a lobby.

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The floor of the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not more than 4.5 m above grade, and the path of travel through the lobby to the outdoors shall not exceed 15 m.

National Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5.(1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.
P/T Sentence Text: The lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.

National Sentence Text: The means of egress from a mezzanine need not conform to Sentence (1), provided the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., and the distance limits stated in Table 9.9.7.4., measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by 2 or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: One means of egress from a mezzanine is permitted, where,(a) the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), (b) the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, (c) the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(a), and (d) the distance limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(b) measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to, (i) an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or (ii) an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by two or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).

National Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), and that exceeds the limits of Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2) is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.
P/T Sentence Text: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and that exceeds the limits of Sentence (2), is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 m in height and 0.55 m in width, and located so that the sill is not more than 1 m above the floor, and 7 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window or door,(a) providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 000 mm in height and 550 mm in width, and (b) located so that the sill is not more than, (i) 1 000 mm above the floor, and (ii) 7 m above adjacent ground level.
Variation Label: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors

National Article Title: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
National Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.9.1. Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
P/T Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, a dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto an exit stairway serving more than one suite, a public corridor serving more than one suite, and served by a single exit, an exterior passageway serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or a balcony serving more than one suite, served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
P/T Sentence Text: A dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto,(a) an exit stairway serving more than one suite, (b) a public corridor, (i) serving more than one suite, and (ii) served by a single exit, (c) an exterior passageway, (i) serving more than one suite, (ii) served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and (iii) more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or (d) a balcony, (i) serving more than one suite, (ii) served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and (iii) more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Except where the suite is sprinklered, each bedroom or combination bedroom shall have at least one outside window or exterior door openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge and without the removal of sashes or hardware. (See Article 9.5.1.2. and Note A-9.9.10.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a door on the same floor level as the bedroom provides direct access to the exterior, every floor level containing a bedroom in a suite shall be provided with at least one outside window that,(a) is openable from the inside without the use of tools, (b) provides an individual, unobstructed open portion having a minimum area of 0.35 mÃÂ² with no dimension less than 380 mm, and (c) maintains the required opening described in Clause (b) without the need for additional support. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where a window required in Sentence (1) opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 760 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Note A-9.9.10.1.(3).)
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a window required in Sentence (1) opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 550 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence 9.9.10.1.(3) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence (5) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.

National Article Title: Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
National Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence (3), the enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.
P/T Article Title: 9.9.10.1. Egress Windows or Doors for Bedrooms
P/T Sentence Text: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence (5), such enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to all exits except those serving not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to all exits except those serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Exits Except those Serving a house or Individual Dwelling Unit

National Sentence Text: Every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves a building that is 3 storeys in building height, a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (7), every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves,(a) a building that is 3 storeys in building height, (b) a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or (c) a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.

National Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall serve no equipment other than emergency equipment, and be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2), (3) and (7).
P/T Sentence Text: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall, (a) serve no equipment other than emergency lighting in the area where the exit signs are installed, and (b) be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2), (3) and (7).

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the lighting of all means of egress except those within dwelling units or a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to the lighting of all means of egress except those within dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in exits, principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, corridors used by the public, underground walkways, and public corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall be provided in,(a) exits, (b) principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, (c) corridors used by the public, (d) underground walkways, and (e) public corridors.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.

National Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of at least 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.
P/T Sentence Text: Lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of not less than 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.

National Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4) shall be not less than 1 lx.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentence (4) shall be not less than 1 1x.

National Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/m2 of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence 9.9.12.3.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Where incandescent lighting is provided, lighting equal to 1 W/mÃÂ² of floor area shall be considered to meet the requirement in Sentence (4).

National Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.

National Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60Â° or more to the horizontal that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Section, roofs with slopes of 60ÃÂ° or more to the horizontal and that are adjacent to a room or space intended for occupancy shall be considered as a wall.

National Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to part 3.. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to Part 3.

National Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with part 3. (See also Sentence 9.9.4.7.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through floors that are not protected by shafts or closures shall be protected in conformance with Subsection 3.2.8.

National Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are entirely contained within a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Chutes and shafts shall conform to Subsection 3.6.3. except where they are contained entirely within a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.12. to 3.2.5.15. and 3.2.5.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinkler systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.7.(1), Articles 3.2.5.13. to 3.2.5.16. and Article 3.2.5.18. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.8. to 3.2.5.11. and 3.2.5.17.
P/T Sentence Text: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.5.18. and Subsection 3.2.9.

National Sentence Text: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Article 6.3.1.7. (See Note A-9.10.1.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Part 6. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.2.2., every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Every building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.

National Article Title: Major Occupancies above Other Major Occupancies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.2.3. Major Occupancies Above Other Major Occupancies
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than 1 major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating or a fire-protection rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in conformance with the test methods described in Part 3, the calculation method presented in , or the construction specifications presented in Tables 9.10.3.1.-A and 9.10.3.1.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating or a fire-protection rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in conformance with the test methods described in Part 3, or in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", or MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where a flame-spread rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in accordance with the test methods described in Part 3, or in accordance with Appendix D.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a flame-spread rating is required in this Section for an element of a building, such rating shall be determined in accordance with the test methods described in Part 3, or in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles which contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles that contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 9.10.4.1.(2) and 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 10% of the floor area of the building in which they are located, and the area of mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite on the storey on which it is located.
P/T Sentence Text: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where the aggregate area of mezzanine floors does not exceed 10% of,(a) the suite in which it is located, where there is more than one suite in the storey, or (b) the storey in which it is located, in all other cases.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.10.4.2.(1), the space above a mezzanine is permitted to be excluded from the calculation of building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentence (3), the space above the mezzanine floor is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where they occupy an aggregate area not exceeding 40% of the area of the room or the storey in which they are located provided the space above the mezzanine floor has no visual obstructions more than 1 070 mm above such floors.

National Article Title: More Than One Level of Mezzanine
National Sentence Text: Each level of mezzanine that is partly or wholly superimposed above the first level of mezzanine shall be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.4.2. More Than One Level of Mezzanine
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than 1 level of mezzanine is provided in a storey, each level additional to the first shall be considered as a storey.
Variation Label: More Than One Level of Mezzanine

National Sentence Text: Roof-top enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
P/T Sentence Text: Rooftop enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.5.1.(2) and 9.10.5.1.(4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (4), a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: Where boxes referred to in Sentence (2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 9.10.3.1.-B or Appendix D is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of Appendix D.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.5.1. Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
P/T Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to Sentence 9.10.13.1.4.(1) and the requirements in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".
Variation Label: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes

National Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 3.1.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs
National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to Table 9.10.8.1. (See Subsection 9.10.2. for mixed occupancies and Subsection 9.10.21. for construction camps.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.8.1. Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to TableÃ 9.10.8.1.
Variation Label: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs

National Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving a house with a secondary suite, or a single dwelling unit where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit (see also Sentence 9.9.9.3.(2)).
P/T Sentence Text: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving, (a) a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house, or (b) an individual dwelling unit in a building other than a house where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to a dwelling unit that has no other dwelling unit above or below it, houses with a secondary suite, where the floor framing is protected on the underside by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, or a dwelling unit that is not above or below another major occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to houses.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in Section 3.2.

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5., 9.10.9.6. and 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.3. Openings to be Protected With Closures
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5. to 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.9.4.(2) to 9.10.9.4.(4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9.10.8. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.

National Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Note A-9.10.9.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (4) to (12) and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment. (See Note A-3.1.9.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (4) to (12) and Article 9.10.9.7., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating such equipment.

National Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketting that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketing that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways which are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), where the concrete provides not less than 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways that are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), where the concrete provides at least 50 mm of cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab.

National Sentence Text: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.5.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

National Article Title: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (6), combustible piping shall not be used in any part of a drain, waste and vent piping system where any part of that system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (6), combustible piping shall not be used where any part of a piping system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.

National Article Title: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
National Sentence Text: The rating referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.7.(2) shall be based on ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
P/T Sentence Text: The rating referred to in Sentence (2) shall be based on CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.

National Article Title: Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams and Joists
National Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in Table D-2.1.1. in Appendix D for the required fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.9. Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams
P/T Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of solid masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in Table 2.1.1. of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", for the required fire-resistance rating.
Variation Label: Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.10.(2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.

National Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence (1) provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling may be reduced to 30 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in Sentence (1) provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling is permitted to be reduced to 30 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(2), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (4), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium-hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy, including live/work units, shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

National Sentence Text: Where not more than 2 dwelling units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Where not more than 2 dwelling units or live/work units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units or live/work units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.12.  Residential Suites, Live/Work Units and Industrial
P/T Sentence Text: Except where a Group F Division 2 major occupancy is directly related to live/work units, not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
Variation Label: Residential Suites, Live/Work Units and Industrial

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence 9.10.9.13.(2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence (2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14.(2) , 9.10.9.14.(3) and 9.10.9.14.(4) and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if,(a) the floor area is sprinklered, (b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and (c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).

National Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), and the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if,(a) the floor area is sprinklered, (b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), (c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4), and (d) the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.16.(2) and 9.10.9.16.(3), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or in which it is built, it shall be considered as part of that dwelling unit and the fire separation required in Sentence (2) need not be provided between the garage and the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the house or the individual dwelling unit it is attached to or built into, it shall be considered as part of that house or dwelling unit and the fire separation required in Sentence (2) need not be provided between the garage and the house or dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.16.(5), where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy,(a) an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and (b) every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to Article 9.10.13.15. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(1) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where the building is not more than one storey in building height, the building is operated as a single suite, and the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence (1) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where, (a) the building is not more than one storey in building height, (b) the building is operated as a single suite, and (c) the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(5), where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See Note A-9.10.9.16.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective air barrier to gas and exhaust fumes.

National Article Title: Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
National Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence 9.10.9.18.(1) shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.9.18. Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
P/T Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in Sentence (1) shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: A central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.10.18.7.(1), a central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(2) and Articles 9.10.10.5. and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Articles 9.10.10.5. and 9.10.10.6., service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.10.3.(1) shall not apply.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence (1) shall not apply.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.10.4.(2) and 9.10.10.4.(3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.10.4. Appliances and Equipment to be Located in a Service
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence (1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.

National Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".

National Sentence Text: Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to the requirements in part 9. and serving no other appliance.
P/T Sentence Text: Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to the requirements in Section 9.21. and serving no other appliance.

National Sentence Text: Except as stated in Sentence 9.10.11.2.(2), a party wall on a property line of a building of residential occupancy need not be constructed as a firewall, provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating, where the party wall separates two dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, a dwelling unit and a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, or two houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: A party wall on a property line need not be constructed as a firewall provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating if, (a) the property line is between houses, or (b) the property line is between dwelling units in a building of residential occupancy, other than a house, in which there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence (1) shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.
P/T Sentence Text: The wall described in Sentence (1) shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.

National Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence (1) and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: Any space between the top of the wall described in Sentence (1) and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and in Articles 9.10.1.3. and 9.10.9.5., the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.9.4.5., where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of 135Â° or less, the horizontal distance from an unprotected opening in one exterior wall to an unprotected opening in the other exterior wall shall be not less than 1.2 m, where these openings are in different fire compartments, or in different dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.12.3. Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.9.4.5., where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of less than 135ÃÂ°, the horizontal distance from an opening in one wall to an opening in the other wall shall be not less than 1.2 m where the openings are in different fire compartments.
Variation Label: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door.
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is,(a) less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and (b) less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), the construction described in Sentence (1) shall have no unprotected openings and shall be protected in accordance with Sentence (3), where the soffit encloses a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, a floor spacewhere an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two, or the floor separates dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite, or a floor spacewhere an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites, or a wall separating dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), the soffit described in Sentence (1) shall be protected in accordance with Sentence (3) where the soffit encloses,(a) a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, (b) a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two storeys, or (c) a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites.

National Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence (2) shall be provided by noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650°C, not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum board installed according to CSA A82.31-M, Gypsum Board Application, not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Note A-9.10.12.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Protection required by Sentence (2) shall be provided by,(a) noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650ÃÂ°C, (b) not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum wallboard installed according to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application," (c) not less than 11 mm thick plywood, (d) not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or (e) not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with Chapters 2 to 14 of NFPA 80, Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives, unless otherwise specified herein. (See also Article 9.10.3.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", unless otherwise specified in this Part.

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided that the door conforms to CAN/ULC-S113, Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies. (See Note A-9.10.13.2.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.2. Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
P/T Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided the door conforms to CAN/ULC-S113, "Wood Core Doors Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104 for Twenty Minute Fire Rated Closure Assemblies". (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence 9.10.13.2.(1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.2. Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
P/T Sentence Text: Doors described in Sentence (1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

National Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of not less than 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.
P/T Sentence Text: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of at least 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.

National Article Title: Doors as a Means of Egress
National Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to part 9. in addition to this Subsection.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.4. Doors as a Means of Egress
P/T Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to Subsection 9.9.6. in addition to this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. which has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence 9.10.13.5.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass conforming to Article 9.6.1.2. that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with Sentence (2).

National Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence (1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.
P/T Sentence Text: Wired glass described in Sentence (1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a minimum metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.

National Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S105-16 Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104
P/T Sentence Text: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S105, "Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104".

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 m2 , with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are not sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 mÃÂ², with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, if a fire compartment on either side of the fire separation is not sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2 , with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 mÃÂ², with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence 9.10.13.10.(2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as described in Sentence (2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.

National Sentence Text: Self-closing doors are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in dead-end corridors.
P/T Sentence Text: Self-closing devices are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in,(a) dead-end corridors, or (b) a corridor that serves a hotel.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.13.13.(2) to 9.10.13.13.(5) and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.10.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (5) and Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4), a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with ArticlesÃ 3.1.8.4. and 3.1.8.9.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct has a melting point not below 760Â°C, has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cm2 , and supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct,(a) has a melting point not below 760ÃÂ°C, (b) has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cmÃÂ², and (c) supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.

National Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the airflow is upward provided the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760Â°C, the branch duct is carried up inside the riser not less than 500 mm, and the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the air flow is upward provided,(a) the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760ÃÂ°C, (b) the branch duct is carried up inside the riser at least 500 mm, and (c) the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in Article 9.10.9.18.

National Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided the ducts have a melting point above 760Â°C, and each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.
P/T Sentence Text: Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided,(a) the ducts have a melting point above 760ÃÂ°C, and (b) each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.

National Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes referred to in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4) shall conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies, and activate at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes required in Sentence 9.10.5.1.(4) shall(a) conform to CAN/ULC-S112.2, "Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies", and (b) activate at a temperature approximately 30ÃÂ°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.

National Article Title: Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units
National Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall be tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.13.15. Doors Between Garages and Houses or Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall be tight-fitting and weatherstripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gases and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.
Variation Label: Doors Between Garages and Houses or Dwelling Units

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to buildings other than those to which Subsection 9.10.15.applies.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.10.15., this Subsection applies to all buildings.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be,(a) taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and (b) calculated as, (i) the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or (ii) the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4. to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings permitted in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which limiting distance is measured.
Variation Label: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.5.-A to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the value for the maximum area of unprotected openings (see second column of Table 9.10.14.5.-A) shall be determined using the limiting distance measured from the location described in Sentence 9.10.14.2.(3). (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.2. Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
P/T Sentence Text: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.5. to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, (a) the exposing building face is permitted to be divided into any number of portions and the fire-resistance rating, type of cladding and percentage of unprotected openings limitations is permitted to be determined individually for each portion based on the limiting distance for each portion so divided, (b) the exposing building face shall be taken as the projection of the exterior wall onto a vertical plane located so that no portion of the exterior wall of the building is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is established in Clause (a), and (c) for the purpose of determining the actual area of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the unprotected openings shall be projected onto the vertical plane established in Clause (b).
Variation Label: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

National Sentence Text: Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See Table 9.10.13.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the unprotected openings are glazed with wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence (1) where the unprotected openings are glazed with, (a) wired glass in steel frames as described in Article 9.10.13.5., or (b) glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.

National Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence (1) provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence (1) where, (a) all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and (b) the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1), where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is the same level as the street need not comply with Sentence (1) where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.

National Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence (10) need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
P/T Sentence Text: The limits on the area of unprotected openings need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a house, where, (a) the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house, (b) the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and (c) the house is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(3) to 9.10.14.5.(14), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5.-A. (See Note A-9.10.14.5.(1).) (See also part 9.)
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (7), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5. and Subsection 9.10.8.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title:
Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (3) to (8), cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces that enclose an attic or roof space, for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% of the exposing building face, need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.5.(1)(b) when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S134, Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5. where,(a) the exposing building face is constructed with no unprotected openings, (b) the limiting distance is not less than 0.6 m, and (c) the cladding, (i) conforms to Subsection 9.27.12., (ii) is installed without furring members over not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum sheathing or over masonry, (iii) has a flame-spread rating not more than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and (iv) is not more than 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.5.(5), where a garage or accessory building serves one dwelling unit only and is detached from any building, the exposing building face need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating stated in Table 9.10.14.5.-A, where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and need not conform to the type of cladding required by Table 9.10.14.5.-A, regardless of the limiting distance.
P/T Article Title: 9.10.14.5. Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), where a garage or accessory building serves a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house and is detached from the house and any other building, the exposing building face,(a) need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating in Table 9.10.14.5., where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, (b) shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and (c) need not conform to the type of cladding required in Table 9.10.14.5. regardless of the limiting distance.
Variation Label: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
