P/T Sentence Text: Where the supported joist span exceeds 4.9 m in buildings with light wood frame walls, floors and roofs, footing widths shall be determined according to,(a) Section 4.2., or (b) the following formula: W = w Ã¢â¬Â¢ [ Ã¢Ëâ sjs / (storeys Ã¢â¬Â¢ 4.9)] where, W = minimum footing width, w = minimum width of footings supporting joists not exceeding 4.9 m, as defined by Table 9.15.3.4., Ã¢Ëâ sjs = the sum of the supported joist spans on each storey whose load is transferred to the footing, and storeys = number of storeys supported by the footing. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Adjustments to Footing Widths for Exterior Walls
National Sentence Text: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood-frame construction supported by the foundation wall, 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.3.5. Adjustments to Footing Widths for Exterior Walls
P/T Sentence Text: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by,(a) 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood frame construction supported by the foundation wall, (b) 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and (c) 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.

National Sentence Text: Where step footings are used, the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and the horizontal distance between risers shall not be less than 600 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where step footings are used,(a) the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and (b) the horizontal distance between risers shall be not less than 600 mm.

National Sentence Text: Insulating concrete form units shall be manufactured of polystyrene conforming to the performance requirements of ULC CAN/ULC-S701.1-17 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards for Type 2, 3 or 4 polystyrene.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating concrete form units shall be manufactured of polystyrene conforming to the performance requirements of CAN/ULC-S701.1, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards", for Type 2, 3 or 4 polystyrene.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.15.4.2.(2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-A for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.A. for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be not less than the greater of 140 mm, or the thickness of the concrete in the wall above.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be not less than the greater of,(a) 140 mm, or (b) the thickness of the concrete in the wall above.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, continuous vertical reinforcement shall be provided at wall corners, wall ends, wall intersections, at changes in wall height, at the jambs of all openings and at movement joints, extend from the top of the footing to the top of the foundation wall, and where foundation walls are laterally supported at the top, have not less than 50 mm embedment into the footing, if the floor slab does not provide lateral support at the wall base.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, continuous vertical reinforcement shall,(a) be provided at wall corners, wall ends, wall intersections, at changes in wall height, at the jambs of all openings and at movement joints, (b) extend from the top of the footing to the top of the foundation wall, and (c) where foundation walls are laterally supported at the top, have not less than 50 mm embedment into the footing, if the floor slab does not provide lateral support at the wall base.

National Article Title: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
National Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing not less than one 15M bar shall be installed along the top of the wall, at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.20 m in width, and at structurally connected floors.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.2. Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
P/T Sentence Text: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing at least one 15M bar shall be installed, (a) along the top of the wall, (b) at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.2 m in width, and (c) at structurally connected floors.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
National Sentence Text: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported if the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.3. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported
P/T Sentence Text: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported, if,(a) the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or (b) the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence 9.15.4.3.(3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.3. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Sentence (3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.

National Article Title: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the Bottom
National Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, is supported at the footing by a shear key and at the top by the ground floor framing, or is doweled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.4. Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the Bottom
P/T Sentence Text: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall,(a) supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, (b) is supported at the footing by a shear key and is supported at the top by the ground floor framing, or (c) is dowelled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
National Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall consist of one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and 10M bars at 600 mm o.c., and be located in the inside half of the wall section, and with a minimum cover of 30mm from the inside face of the concrete.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.5. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall,(a) consist of, (i) one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and (ii) 10M bars spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., and (b) be located, (i) in the inside half of the wall section, and (ii) with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete.
Variation Label: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
National Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be provided in accordance with Table 9.15.4.5.-A for 140 mm walls, Table 9.15.4.5.-B for 190 mm walls, and Table 9.15.4.5.-C for 240 mm walls, located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and where interrupted by wall openings, placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.5. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical wall reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall,(a) conform to, (i) Table 9.15.4.5.A. for 140 mm walls, (ii) Table 9.15.4.5.B. for 190 mm walls, and (iii) Table 9.15.4.5.C. for 240 mm walls, (b) be located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and (c) where interrupted by wall openings, be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
National Sentence Text: Cold joints in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be reinforced with no less than one 15M bar spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c. and embedded 300 mm on both sides of the joint.
P/T Article Title: 9.15.4.5. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
P/T Sentence Text: Cold joints in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be reinforced with at least one 15M bar spaced not more than 600 mm o.c. and embedded not less than 300 mm on both sides of the joint.
Variation Label: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation

National Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be not less than 90 mm thick, and tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4.(3) spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. vertically, and 900 mm o.c. horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be,(a) not less than 90 mm thick, and (b) tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4.(3) spaced not more than, (i) 200 mm o.c. vertically, and (ii) 900 mm o.c. horizontally.

National Sentence Text: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence 9.15.4.7.(2) shall be filled with mortar.
P/T Sentence Text: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence (2) shall be filled with mortar.

National Sentence Text: Joints required in Sentence 9.15.4.9.(1) shall be designed to resist moisture penetration and shall be keyed to prevent relative displacement of the wall portions adjacent to the joint.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to resist moisture penetration and shall be keyed to prevent relative displacement of the wall portions adjacent to the joint.

National Sentence Text: Interior masonry foundation walls not subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Interior masonry foundation walls not subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Section 9.20.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.15.5.1.(2), foundation walls of hollow masonry units supporting floor joists shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of concrete, solid masonry units that are 100% solid and not less than 50 mm high, or semi-solid or hollow solid masonry units that have the top course completely filled with mortar, grout or concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), foundation walls of hollow masonry units supporting floor joists shall be capped with,(a) not less than 50 mm of concrete, (b) solid masonry units that are 100% solid and not less than 50 mm high, or (c) semi-solid or hollow solid masonry units that have the top course completely filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

National Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence 9.15.5.1.(1) need not be provided in localities where termites are not known to occur, when the joists are supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm, and when the siding overlaps the foundation wall not less than 12 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Capping required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be omitted,(a) in localities where termites are not known to occur, (b) when the joists are supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm, and (c) when the siding overlaps the foundation wall not less than 12 mm.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry shall be provided beneath beams supported on masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 190 mm depth of solid masonry shall be provided beneath beams supported on masonry.

National Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence 9.15.5.3.(1) shall be not less than 90 mm by 290 mm and shall be bonded or tied into the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 90 mm by 290 mm and shall be bonded or tied into the wall.

National Sentence Text: The top 200 mm of pilasters required in Sentence 9.15.5.3.(1) shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout or concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: The top 200 mm of pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

National Sentence Text: Concrete block foundation walls shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level as required in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete block foundation walls shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level as required in Section 9.13.

National Sentence Text: Exterior surfaces of concrete block foundation walls above ground level shall have tooled joints, or shall be parged or otherwise suitably finished.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior surfaces of concrete block foundation walls above ground level shall have tooled joints, or shall be rendered, parged or otherwise suitably finished.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to floors supported on ground or on granular fill that do not provide structural support for the superstructure.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to floors that are supported on ground or granular fill and that do not provide structural support for the superstructure.

National Sentence Text: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where access is provided to the space, and a floor supported by the structure is not provided.
P/T Sentence Text: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where,(a) access is provided to the space, and (b) a floor supported by the structure is not provided.

National Sentence Text: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to Section 9.13.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground. (See also Subsection 9.13.4. and Note A-9.13.4.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground.

National Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to variations in moisture content or chemical-microbiological oxidation shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to variations in moisture content or chemical-microbiological oxidation shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

National Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures. (See also Article 9.4.4.4. and Note A-9.4.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.16.2.2.(4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted.

National Sentence Text: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be a poured concrete slab, and designed to resist such pressures.
P/T Sentence Text: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be,(a) a cast-in-place concrete slab, and (b) designed to resist such pressures.

National Sentence Text: When a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab.

National Sentence Text: Concrete slabs shall not be less than 75 mm thick exclusive of concrete topping.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete slabs shall be not less than 75 mm thick exclusive of concrete topping. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406-16 Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406, "Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings".

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to columns used to support beams carrying loads from not more than 2 wood-frame floors where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams does not exceed 5 m, and the live load on any floor does not exceed 2.4 kPa (see Table 4.1.5.3.), beams or header joists carrying loads from not more than 2 levels of wood-frame balconies, decks or other accessible exterior platforms, or 1 level plus the roof, where the supported length of joists bearing on such beams or joists does not exceed 5 m, the sum of the specified snow and occupancy loads does not exceed 4.8 kPa (see Sentence 9.4.2.3.(1) for the determination of load on platform-type constructions), and the platform serves only a single suite of residential occupancy, or carport roofs (see part 9.).
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to columns used to support,(a) beams carrying loads from not more than 2 wood frame floors where, (i) the supported length of joists bearing on such beams does not exceed 5 m, and (ii) the live load on any floor does not exceed 2.4 kPa, (b) beams or header joists carrying loads from not more than 2 levels of wood frame balconies, decks or other accessible exterior platforms, or 1 level and the roof, where, (i) the supported length of joists bearing on such beams or joists does not exceed 5 m, (ii) the sum of the specified snow load and the load due to use and occupancy does not exceed 4.8 kPa, and (iii) the platform serves only a single suite of residential occupancy, or (c) carport roofs.

National Sentence Text: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence 9.17.1.1.(1) shall be designed in accordance with part 4..
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

National Sentence Text: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to Section 9.15.

National Sentence Text: Columns shall be securely fastened to the supported member to reduce the likelihood of lateral differential movement between the column and the supported member. (See also Article 9.23.6.2.)
P/T Sentence Text: Columns shall be securely fastened to the supported member to reduce the likelihood of lateral differential movement between the column and the supported member.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), columns shall be laterally supported to resist racking directly, or by connection to the supported members. (See Note A-9.17.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), columns shall be laterally supported,(a) directly, or (b) by connection to the supported members. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence (2), where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, and the columns support a deck with no superstructure.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence (2) where,(a) the length of the columns are not more than 600 mm measured from the finished ground to the underside of the supported member, and (b) the columns support a deck with no superstructure.

National Sentence Text: Columns of sizes other than as specified in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(1) are permitted to be used where the loadbearing capacities are shown to be adequate.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns of sizes other than as specified in Sentence (1) are permitted to be used where the loadbearing capacities are shown to be adequate.

National Sentence Text: The top plate required in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(1) need not be provided where a column supports a steel beam and provision is made for the attachment of the column to the beam.
P/T Sentence Text: The top plate required in Sentence (1) need not be provided where a column supports a steel beam and provision is made for the attachment of the column to the beam.

National Sentence Text: Exterior steel columns shall be treated on the outside surface with at least one coat of rust-inhibitive paint.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior steel columns susceptible to corrosion shall be treated on the outside surface with at least one coat of rust-inhibitive paint.

National Sentence Text: Where the imposed load does not exceed 36 kN, adjustable steel columns shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-7.2-94 Adjustable Steel Columns
P/T Article Title: 9.17.3.4. Design of Adjustable Steel Columns (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Where the imposed load does not exceed 36 kN, adjustable steel columns shall conform to CAN/CGSB-7.2, "Adjustable Steel Columns".

National Sentence Text: Wood columns shall be either solid, glued-laminated or built-up.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood columns shall be either solid, glue-laminated or built-up.

National Sentence Text: Built-up columns shall consist of not less than 38 mm thick full-length members bolted together with not less than 9.52 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 450 mm o.c., or nailed together with not less than 76 mm nails spaced not more than 300 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Built-up columns shall consist of not less than 38 mm thick full-length members,(a) bolted together with not less than 9.52 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 450 mm o.c., or (b) nailed together with not less than 76 mm nails spaced not more than 300 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence 9.3.2.9.(2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.
P/T Sentence Text: Where termites are known to exist, exterior wood columns, such as porch supports, shall be,(a) pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to such termites, in accordance with Article 9.3.2.9., or (b) supported on non-cellulosic material extending not less than 150 mm above the finished ground and shall be located not less than 50 mm from the exterior wall of an adjacent building.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to crawl spaces whose exterior walls have less than 25% of their total area above exterior ground level open to the outdoors.
P/T Sentence Text: In this Section, a crawl space refers to an enclosed space between the underside of a floor assembly and the ground cover directly below, with a clearance less than 1 800 mm in height.

National Sentence Text: Foundations enclosing crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Foundation walls enclosing crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.15.

National Sentence Text: Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space is used as a hot air plenum, contains heating ducts that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.
P/T Sentence Text: Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space,(a) is used as a warm air plenum, (b) contains heating ducts or heating pipes that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or (c) is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.

National Sentence Text: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with Section 9.25.

National Sentence Text: An access opening of not less than 500 mm by 700 mm shall be provided to each crawl space where the crawl space serves a single dwelling unit, and not less than 550 mm by 900 mm for other crawl spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: An access opening of not less than 500 mm by 700 mm shall be provided to each crawl space where the crawl space serves a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house, and not less than 550 mm by 900 mm for other crawl spaces.

National Sentence Text: Access openings shall be fitted with a door or hatch, except when the crawl space is heated and the access opening into the crawl space is from an adjacent heated space.
P/T Sentence Text: Access openings shall be fitted with a door or hatch, except when the crawl space is heated and the access opening into the crawl space is from the adjacent heated space.

National Sentence Text: Vents shall be uniformly distributed on opposite sides of the building, and designed to prevent the entry of snow, rain and insects.
P/T Sentence Text: Vents shall be, (a) uniformly distributed on opposite sides of the building, and (b) designed to prevent the entry of snow, rain and insects.

National Sentence Text: Heated crawl spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Heated crawl spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with Section 9.32.

National Sentence Text: Drainage of the ground cover or floor-on-ground in the crawl space shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage of the ground cover or floor-on-ground in the crawl space shall conform to Subsection 9.16.3.

National Sentence Text: Drains shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Drains shall conform to Section 9.14.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Unheated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than 50 mm of asphalt, 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, Type S roll roofing, or 0.10 mm polyethylene.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.1. Ground Cover in Unheated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than,(a) 50 mm of asphalt paving material, (b) 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, (c) Type S roll roofing, or (d) 0.10 mm polyethylene.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Unheated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.1.(1) shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.1. Ground Cover in Unheated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.2. Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet, for Use in Building Construction", shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with Subsection 9.25.3.

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall be sealed to the foundation wall. (See Notes A-9.13.4., A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6., and A-9.25.3.6.(2) and (3).)
P/T Article Title: 9.18.6.2. Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
P/T Sentence Text: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall be sealed to the foundation wall.

National Article Title: Crawl Spaces as Warm Air Plenums
National Sentence Text: Enclosing material in crawl spaces described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(1), including insulation, shall have a surface flame-spread rating not greater than 150.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.7.1. Crawl Spaces as Warm Air Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Enclosing material in crawl spaces described in Sentence (1), including insulation, shall have a surface flame-spread rating not greater than 150.

National Article Title: Crawl Spaces as Warm Air Plenums
National Sentence Text: Combustible ground cover in crawl spaces described in Sentence 9.18.7.1.(1) shall be protected beneath each register opening with noncombustible material.
P/T Article Title: 9.18.7.1. Crawl Spaces as Warm Air Plenums
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible ground cover used as enclosing material in Sentence (2) shall be covered with noncombustible material. (See Appendix A.)
Variation Label: Crawl Spaces as Warm Air Plenums

National Sentence Text: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, where insulation is installed between a ceiling and the underside of the roof sheathing, a space shall be provided between the insulation and the sheathing, and vents shall be installed to permit the transfer of moisture from the space to the exterior. (See Note A-9.19.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, where insulation is installed between a ceiling and the underside of the roof sheathing, a space shall be provided between the insulation and the sheathing, and vents shall be installed to permit the movement of air from the space to the exterior. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Required vents may be roof type, eave type, gable-end type or any combination thereof, and shall be distributed uniformly on opposite sides of the building, with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the top of the space, and with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the bottom of the space.
P/T Sentence Text: Required vents are permitted to be roof type, eave type, gable-end type or any combination of them, and shall be distributed, (a) uniformly on opposite sides of the building, (b) with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the top of the space, and (c) with not less than 25% of the required openings located at the bottom of the space.

National Sentence Text: Except where each joist space is separately vented, roof joist spaces shall be interconnected by installing purlins not less than 38 mm by 38 mm on the top of the roof joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where each roof joist space referred to in Sentence (2) is separately vented, roof joist spaces shall be interconnected by installing purlins not less than 38 mm by 38 mm on the top of the roof joists.

National Sentence Text: Vents shall comply with CSA CAN3-A93-M82 Natural Airflow Ventilators for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Vents shall comply with CAN3-A93-M, "Natural Airflow Ventilators for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.19.1.3.(2), not less than 63 mm of space shall be provided between the top of the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where venting is provided to a roof joist space, not less than 63 mm of space shall be provided between the top of the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: At the junction of sloped roofs and exterior walls, where preformed baffles are used to contain the insulation, the baffles shall provide an unobstructed air space, between the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing, that is not less than 25 mm in dimension, and of sufficient cross area to meet the attic or roof space venting requirements of Article 9.19.1.2., and extend vertically not less than 50 mm above the top of the insulation.
P/T Sentence Text: Where venting is provided at the junction of sloped roofs and exterior walls and where preformed baffles are used to contain the insulation, the baffles shall,(a) provide an unobstructed air space between the insulation and the underside of the roof sheathing, that is, (i) not less than 25 mm in dimension, and (ii) of sufficient cross area to meet the attic or roof space venting requirements of Article 9.19.1.2., and (b) extend vertically not less than 50 mm above the top of the insulation.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not restrict the free flow of air through roof vents or through any portion of the attic or roof space.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not restrict a free flow of air through roof vents or through any portion of the attic or roof space.

National Sentence Text: The upper portion of roofs described in Sentence 9.19.1.4.(1) shall be ventilated in conformance with Articles 9.19.1.1. to 9.19.1.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The upper portion of roofs described in Sentence (1) shall be ventilated in conformance with the requirements in Articles 9.19.1.1. to 9.19.1.3.

National Sentence Text: Every attic or roof space shall be provided with an access hatch where the open space in the attic or roof space measures 3 m2 or more in area, 1 m or more in length or width, and 600 mm or more in height over at least the area described in Clauses (a) and (b).(See Note A-9.19.2.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Every attic or roof space shall be provided with an access hatch where the attic or roof space,(a) measures not less than, (i) 10 mÃÂ² in area, (ii) 1 000 mm in length or width, and (iii) 600 mm in height over at least the area described in Subclauses (i) and (ii), or (b) contains a fuel-fired appliance.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that (see Note A-9.15.1.1.(1)(c)) have a maximum floor-to-floor height of 3 m, are erected in buildings not more than 2 storeys in building height and containing only a single dwelling unit, and are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4 (see Note A-9.20.1.2.).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to,(a) unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where, (i) the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and (ii) the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and (b) flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that, (i) have a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, (ii) are erected in houses not more than 2 storeys in building height, and (iii) are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4. (See Appendix Note A-9.15.1.1(1)(c))
Variation Label: Unreinforced Masonry and Masonry Veneer Walls not in Contact with the Ground

National Sentence Text: In locations where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings more than 1 storey in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement required by Subsection 9.20.15.
P/T Sentence Text: In locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings more than 1 storey in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement as required in Subsection 9.20.15.

National Sentence Text: In locations where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.35 but less than or equal to 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings 3 storeys in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement required by Subsection 9.20.15.
P/T Sentence Text: In locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.35, but less than or equal to 0.55, loadbearing elements of masonry buildings 3 storeys in building height shall be reinforced with not less than the minimum amount of reinforcement as required in Subsection 9.20.15.

National Sentence Text: Cementitious materials and aggregates for mortar and grout shall comply with CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Cementitious materials and aggregates for mortar and grout shall comply with CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry".

National Sentence Text: Mortar for glass block masonry shall be Type S Portland cement-lime where exposed to the exterior, or Type S or N where protected from the exterior.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar for glass block masonry shall be,(a) Type S Portland cement-lime where exposed to the exterior, or (b) Type S or N where protected from the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Mortar shall be mixed within the proportion limits provided in Table 9.20.3.2.-B, with sufficient water to bring the mixture to a consistency adequate for laying masonry units.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar mix proportions shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.B., with sufficient water to bring the mixture to a consistency adequate for laying masonry units.

National Sentence Text: Grout shall be mixed within the proportion limits provided in Table 9.20.3.2.-C, with sufficient water to provide a suitable flow to fill all voids completely, without excessive segregation or bleeding.
P/T Sentence Text: Grout mix proportions shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.C., with sufficient water to provide a suitable flow to fill all voids completely, without excessive segregation or bleeding.

National Sentence Text: Mortar and grout containing a set-control admixture shall be manufactured off-site in a batching plant and shall be used and placed in final position within a time not exceeding the useful life stipulated by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Mortar and grout containing a set-control admixture shall be manufactured off-site in a batching plant and shall be used and placed in final position within a time not exceeding the useful life as stipulated by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Grout used for reinforced masonry shall be placed in accordance with the requirements of CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Grout used for reinforced masonry shall be placed in accordance with the requirements of CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.4.1.(2), mortar joint thickness for burned clay brick and concrete masonry units shall be 10 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), mortar joint thickness for burned clay brick and concrete masonry units shall be 10 mm.

National Sentence Text: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be not more than Â± 5 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be -5 mm to +10 mm.

National Sentence Text: Vertically aligned webs of hollow masonry units shall be laid in a full bed of mortar under the starting course, in all courses of columns, and where adjacent to cells or cavities that are to be filled with grout.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertically aligned webs of hollow masonry units shall be laid in a full bed of mortar,(a) under the starting course, (b) in all courses of columns, and (c) where adjacent to cells or cavities that are to be filled with grout.

National Sentence Text: Masonry over openings shall be supported by steel, masonry or reinforced concrete lintels, or masonry arches.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry over openings shall be supported by steel, reinforced concrete lintels or masonry arches designed to support the imposed loads.

National Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2., and have a bearing length not less than 90 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (6), steel angle lintels supporting masonry above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.A.

National Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2., and have a bearing length not less than 90 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.B.

National Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and the bearing at end supports shall be not less than 89 mm long, except as stated in the notes to Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel lintels described in Sentences (2) and (3) shall,(a) have even and level bearing and shall have not less than 150 mm length of bearing at end supports, and (b) bear on masonry, concrete or steel.

National Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry shall be prime painted or otherwise protected from corrosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry shall be primed or painted or otherwise protected from corrosion.

National Sentence Text: The thickness of loadbearing interior walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and 9.20.10.1.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of loadbearing interior walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and (3).

National Sentence Text: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and 9.20.10.1.(3), and in any case, not less than 65 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be,(a) determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and (3), and (b) in any case, not less than 65 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except for masonry veneer where each masonry unit is supported individually by the structural backing, masonry veneer shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for masonry veneer where each masonry unit is supported individually by the structural backing, masonry veneer shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 70 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Veneer described in Sentence 9.20.6.4.(1) over wood-frame walls shall have not less than a 25 mm air space behind the veneer.
P/T Sentence Text: Veneer described in Sentence (1) over wood frame walls shall have not less than a 25 mm air space behind the veneer.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer shall conform to part 4., where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2. where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.

National Sentence Text: The height of parapet walls above the adjacent roof surface shall be not more than 3 times the parapet wall thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of a parapet wall above the adjacent roof surface shall be not more than three times the parapet wall thickness.

National Sentence Text: Parapet walls shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout, or concrete, and that extends from the top of the parapet to not less than 300 mm below the adjacent roof level.
P/T Sentence Text: A parapet wall shall be solid masonry that extends from the top of the parapet wall to not less than 300 mm below the adjacent roof level.

National Sentence Text: Parapet walls shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout, or concrete, and that extends from the top of the parapet to not less than 300 mm below the adjacent roof level.
P/T Sentence Text: Where semi-solid or hollow units are used in a parapet wall, the cells of those units shall be filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., no chase or recess shall be constructed in any wall 190 mm or less in thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.20.7.4., no chase or recess shall be constructed in any wall 190 mm or less in thickness.

National Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall be not less than 4 times the wall thickness apart, and 600 mm away from any pilaster, cross wall, buttress or other vertical element providing required lateral support for the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall be not less than,(a) four times the wall thickness apart, and (b) 600 mm away from any pilaster, cross wall, buttress or other vertical element providing required lateral support for the wall.

National Article Title: Chases or Recesses Cut into Walls
National Sentence Text: Chases and recesses shall not be cut into walls made with hollow units after the masonry units are in place.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.7.5. Chases or Recesses Cut into Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Chases or recesses shall not be cut into walls made with hollow units after the masonry units are in place.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.8.1.(2), loadbearing walls of hollow masonry units supporting roof or floor framing members shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of solid masonry or have the top course filled with concrete.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), loadbearing walls of hollow masonry units supporting roof or floor framing members shall be capped with not less than 50 mm of solid masonry or have the top course filled with concrete.

National Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members bearing on cavity walls shall be supported on solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high that bridge the full thickness of the wall, or a wood plate not less than 38 mm thick, bearing not less than 50 mm on each wythe.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members bearing on cavity walls shall be supported on, (a) solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high, bridging the full thickness of the wall, or (b) a wood plate not less than 38 mm thick, bearing not less than 50 mm on each wythe.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry or concrete shall be provided under the beam or column referred to in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry or concrete shall be provided under the beam or column referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be bonded or tied to masonry walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be bonded or tied to masonry walls.

National Sentence Text: Concrete pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be not less than 50 mm by 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 50 mm by 300 mm.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry pilasters required in Sentence 9.20.8.4.(1) shall be not less than 100 mm by 290 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 100 mm by 290 mm.

National Article Title: Joints to be Offset or Reinforced
National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in adjacent masonry courses shall be offset unless each wythe of masonry is reinforced with the equivalent of not less than 2 corrosion-resistant steel bars of 3.76 mm diam placed in the horizontal joints at vertical intervals not exceeding 460 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.9.1. Joints to be Offset or Reinforced
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in adjacent masonry courses shall be offset unless each wythe of masonry is reinforced with the equivalent of no fewer than two corrosion-resistant steel bars of 3.76 mm diam placed in the horizontal joints at vertical intervals not exceeding 460 mm.

National Article Title: Joints to be Offset or Reinforced
National Sentence Text: Where joints in the reinforcing referred to in Sentence 9.20.9.1.(1) occur, the bars shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.9.1. Joints to be Offset or Reinforced
P/T Sentence Text: Where joints in the reinforcing referred to in Sentence (1) occur, the bars shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.

National Article Title: Bonding or Tying of Other than Masonry Veneer
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.9.5. regarding masonry veneer, masonry walls that consist of 2 or more wythes shall have the wythes bonded or tied together with masonry bonding units as described in Article 9.20.9.3. or with metal ties as described in Article 9.20.9.4.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.9.2. Bonding or Tying of Other Than Masonry Veneer
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.20.9.5 for masonry veneer, masonry walls that consist of two or more wythes shall have the wythes bonded or tied together with masonry bonding units as described in Article 9.20.9.3. or with metal ties as described in Articles 9.20.9.4.

National Sentence Text: Where wythes are bonded together with masonry units, the bonding units shall comprise not less than 4% of the wall surface area.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wythes are bonded together with masonry units, the bonding units shall comprise not less than 4 percent of the wall surface area.

National Sentence Text: Bonding units described in Sentence 9.20.9.3.(1) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm vertically and horizontally in the case of brick masonry and 900 mm o.c. in the case of block or tile.
P/T Sentence Text: Bonding units described in Sentence (1) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm vertically and horizontally in the case of brick masonry and 900 mm o.c. in the case of block or tile.

National Sentence Text: Units described in Sentence 9.20.9.3.(1) shall extend not less than 90 mm into adjacent wythes.
P/T Sentence Text: Units described in Sentence (1) shall extend not less than 90 mm into adjacent wythes.

National Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall be corrosion-resistant, have a minimum cross-sectional area of not less than 17.8 mm2 , and have not less than a 50 mm portion bent at right angles at each end.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall, (a) be corrosion-resistant, (b) have a minimum cross-sectional area of not less than 17.8 mmÃÂ², and (c) have not less than a 50 mm portion bent at right angles at each end.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more wythes in walls other than cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the space between wythes shall be completely filled with mortar.
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more wythes in walls other than cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the space between wythes shall be completely filled with mortar.

National Sentence Text: Ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(5) shall be located within 300 mm of openings and spaced not more than 900 mm apart around openings, and spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 460 mm apart vertically at other locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Ties described in Sentence (5) shall be, (a) located within 300 mm of openings and spaced not more than 900 mm apart around openings, and (b) spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 460 mm apart vertically at other locations.

National Sentence Text: Within 300 mm of any openings, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4.(7) shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Within 300 mm of any openings, the ties described in Sentence (7) shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer 75 mm or more in thickness and resting on a bearing support shall be tied to masonry backing or to wood framing members with straps that are corrosion-resistant, not less than 0.76 mm thick, not less than 22 mm wide, shaped to provide a key with the mortar, and spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.9.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer 70 mm or more in thickness and resting on a bearing support shall be tied to masonry back-up or to wood framing members with straps that are,(a) corrosion-resistant, (b) not less than 0.76 mm thick, (c) not less than 22 mm wide, (d) shaped to provide a key with the mortar, and (e) spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.9.5.

National Sentence Text: Straps described in Sentence 9.20.9.5.(1) that are fastened to wood framing members shall be bent at a right angle within 6 mm from the fastener, and fastened with corrosion-resistant 3.18 mm diam screws or spiral nails having a wood penetration of not less than 63 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The straps described in Sentence (1) that are fastened to the wood framing members shall be,(a) bent at a right angle within 6 mm from the fastener, and (b) fastened with corrosion resistant 3.18 mm diam screws or spiral nails having a wood penetration of not less than 30Ã mm.

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer individually supported by masonry or wood-frame backing shall be secured to the backing in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer individually supported by masonry or wood frame back-up shall be secured to the back-up in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.

National Sentence Text: The spacing of supports required in Sentence 9.20.10.1.(1) shall be not more than 20 times the wall thickness for all loadbearing walls and exterior non-loadbearing walls, and 36 times the wall thickness for interior non-loadbearing walls.
P/T Sentence Text: The spacing of supports required in Sentence (1) shall be not more than,(a) 20 times the wall thickness for all loadbearing walls and exterior non-loadbearing walls, and (b) 36 times the wall thickness for interior non-loadbearing walls.

National Sentence Text: Floor and roof constructions providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence (1) shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Floor and roof structural elements providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence (1) shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.

National Article Title: Anchorage to Floor or Roof Assemblies where Masonry Walls Require
National Sentence Text: Where required to receive lateral support (see Subsection 9.20.10.), masonry walls shall be anchored to each floor or roof assembly at maximum intervals of 2 m, except that anchorage to floor joists not more than 1 m above grade may be omitted.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.1. Anchorage of Floor or Roof Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Where required to receive lateral support, masonry walls shall be anchored to each floor or roof assembly at maximum intervals of 2 m, except that anchorage of floor joists not more than 1 m above grade may be omitted.

National Article Title: Anchorage to Floor or Roof Assemblies where Masonry Walls Require
National Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.1.(1) shall be corrosion-resistant and be not less than the equivalent of 40 mm by 4.76 mm thick steel straps.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.1. Anchorage of Floor or Roof Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: Anchors required in Sentence (1) shall be corrosion-resistant and be not less than the equivalent of 40 mm by 4.76Ã mm thick steel straps.

National Article Title: Anchorage to Floor or Roof Assemblies where Masonry Walls Require
National Sentence Text: When joists are parallel to the wall, anchors required in Sentence (1) shall extend across not less than 3 joists.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.1. Anchorage of Floor or Roof Assemblies
P/T Sentence Text: When joists are parallel to the wall, anchors required in Sentence (1) shall extend across no fewer than three joists.

National Article Title: Bonding and Tying Intersecting Masonry Walls where Walls Require
National Sentence Text: Where bonding is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.20.11.2.(1), 50% of the adjacent masonry units in the intersecting wall, distributed uniformly over the height of the intersection, shall be embedded in the laterally supported wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.2. Bonding and Tying of Intersecting Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Where bonding is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1), 50% of the adjacent masonry units in the intersecting wall, distributed uniformly over the height of the intersection, shall be embedded in the laterally supported wall.

National Article Title: Bonding and Tying Intersecting Masonry Walls where Walls Require
National Sentence Text: Where tying is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 9.20.11.2.(1), the ties shall be corrosion-resistant metal, equivalent to not less than 4.76 mm by 40 mm steel strapping, spaced not more than 800 mm o.c. vertically, and shaped at both ends to provide sufficient mechanical key to develop the strength of the ties.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.11.2. Bonding and Tying of Intersecting Walls
P/T Sentence Text: Where tying is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1), the ties shall be, (a) corrosion-resistant metal, (b) equivalent to not less than 4.76 mm by 40 mm steel strapping, (c) spaced not more than 800 mm o.c. vertically, and (d) shaped at both ends to provide sufficient mechanical key to develop the strength of the ties.

National Article Title: Anchoring Wood-Frame Roof Systems to Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: The roof system described in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(1) is permitted to be anchored by nailing the wall furring strips to the side of the rafter plate.
P/T Sentence Text: The roof system described in Sentence (1) is permitted to be anchored by nailing the wall furring strips to the side of the rafter plate.

National Article Title: Anchoring Masonry Cornices, Sills and Trim to Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: Cornices, sills or other trim of masonry material which project beyond the wall face shall have not less than 65% of their mass, but not less than 90 mm, within the wall or shall be adequately anchored to the wall with corrosion-resistant anchors.
P/T Sentence Text: Cornices, sills or other trim of masonry material that project beyond the wall face shall have not less than 65% of their mass, but not less than 90 mm, within the wall or shall be adequately anchored to the wall with corrosion-resistant anchors.

National Sentence Text: Where the foundation wall referred to in Sentence (1) is unit masonry, it is permitted to be corbelled to meet flush with the inner face of a cavity wall provided the projection of each course does not exceed half the height or one third the thickness of the corbelled unit, and the total corbel does not exceed one third of the foundation wall thickness. (See Note A-9.20.12.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the foundation wall referred to in Sentence (1) is unit masonry, it is permitted to be corbelled to meet flush with the inner face of a cavity wall provided,(a) the projection of each course does not exceed half the height or one-third the width of the corbelled unit, and (b) the total corbel does not exceed one-third of the foundation wall thickness. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Masonry veneer resting on a bearing support shall not project more than 25 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is not less than 90 mm thick, and 12 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is less than 90 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Masonry veneer resting on a bearing support shall not project more than 25 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is at least 90 mm thick, and 12 mm beyond the supporting base where the veneer is less than 90 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed in masonry and masonry veneer walls beneath jointed masonry window sills, over the back and top of parapet walls, over the heads of glass block panels, beneath weep holes, and over the heads of window or door openings in exterior walls when the vertical distance between the top of a window or door frame and the bottom edge of the eave exceeds one-quarter of the horizontal eave overhang.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed in masonry and masonry veneer walls,(a) beneath jointed masonry window sills, (b) over the back and top of parapet walls, (c) over the heads of glass block panels, (d) beneath weep holes, and (e) over the heads of window and door openings in exterior walls when the vertical distance between the top of a window or door frame and the bottom edge of the eave exceeds one-quarter of the horizontal eave overhang.

National Sentence Text: When installed beneath jointed masonry window sills or over the heads of openings, flashing shall extend from the front edge of the masonry up behind the sill or lintel.
P/T Sentence Text: When installed beneath jointed masonry window sills and jointed masonry copings or over the heads of openings, flashing shall extend from the front edge of the masonry up behind the sill or lintel.

National Article Title: Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry/Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls shall be bedded not less than 25 mm in the inside wythe, extend to not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing, and be installed with a nominally horizontal slope toward the outside wythe.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.13.5. Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer/Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls shall,(a) be bedded not less than 25 mm in the inside wythe, (b) extend to not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing, and (c) be installed with a nominally horizontal slope toward the outside wythe.

National Article Title: Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer
National Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over masonry backing walls shall conform to the flashing requirements for cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry backing walls in Article 9.20.13.5.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.13.6. Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over masonry back-up walls shall conform to the flashing requirements for cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls in Article 9.20.13.5.

National Article Title: Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer
National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence 9.20.13.6.(2) is permitted to conform to the requirements for concealed flashing in Table 9.20.13.1.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.13.6. Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentence (2) is permitted to conform to the requirements for concealed flashing in TableÃ 9.20.13.1.

National Sentence Text: Weep holes spaced not more than 800 mm apart shall be provided at the bottom of cavities in cavity walls, and cavities or air spaces in masonry veneer walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Weep holes spaced not more than 800 mm apart shall be provided at the bottom of,(a) cavities in cavity walls, and (b) cavities or air spaces in masonry veneer walls.

National Sentence Text: The cavities or air spaces described in Sentence 9.20.13.8.(1) shall include those above lintels over window and door openings required to be flashed in conformance with Article 9.20.13.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The cavities or air spaces described in Sentence (1) shall include those above lintels over window and door openings required to be flashed in conformance with Article 9.20.13.3.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be covered on the interior surface with sheathing membrane conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type, lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be,(a) parged on the interior surface, and (b) covered with No. 15 breather-type asphalt-saturated paper conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type", and shall be lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.

National Sentence Text: Where insulation that effectively limits the passage of water is applied by a waterproof adhesive or mortar directly to parged masonry, the requirements for sheathing membrane in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1) do not apply. (See Note A-9.20.13.9.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the insulation effectively limits the passage of water vapour and is applied by a waterproof adhesive or by mortar directly to the masonry, the requirements for sheathing paper do not apply. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Caulking at Door and Window Frames
National Sentence Text: The junction of door and window frames with masonry shall be caulked in conformance with part 9.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.13.11. Caulking at Door and Window Frames
P/T Sentence Text: The junction of door and window frames with masonry shall be caulked in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.

National Sentence Text: Where reinforcement for masonry is required in this Section, it shall be installed in conformance with the requirements for reinforced masonry as contained in CSA A371-14 Masonry Construction for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where reinforcement for masonry is required in this Section, it shall be installed in conformance with the requirements for reinforced masonry as contained in CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

National Article Title: Thickness of Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: The thickness of the concrete in flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground shall be not less than 140 mm, and constant for the entire height of the wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.1. Thickness of Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground shall be,(a) not less than 140 mm, and (b) constant for the entire height of the wall.

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall consist of one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and 10M bars at 600 mm o.c., and be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.2. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall,(a) consist of, (i) one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and (ii) 10M bars spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., and (b) be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
Variation Label: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form

National Article Title: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall consist of 10M bars at 400 mm o.c., and be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.2. Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall,(a) consist of 10M bars spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and (b) be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
Variation Label: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form

National Article Title: Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1 200 mm of interior and exterior corners of exterior non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.3. Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1.2 m of interior and exterior corners of exterior non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.

National Article Title: Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Portions of walls above openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall have a minimum depth of concrete of no less than 200 mm across the width of the opening.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.3. Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Portions of walls over openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall have a minimum depth of concrete of not less than 200 mm over the width of the opening.

National Article Title: Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Openings that are more than 600 mm but not more than 3 000 mm in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced at the top and bottom with one 10M bar.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.3. Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Openings more than 600 mm but not more than 3 m in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced at the top and bottom with one 10M bar.

National Article Title: Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Openings more than 3 000 mm in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced on all four sides with two 10M bars.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.3. Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Openings more than 3 m in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced on all four sides with two 10M bars.

National Article Title: Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: The cumulative width of openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall not make up more than 70% of the length of any wall.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.3. Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: The cumulative width of openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be not more than 70% of the length of any wall.

National Article Title: Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1 200 mm of interior and exterior corners of exterior loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.4. Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: No openings shall occur within 1.2 m of interior and exterior corners of exterior loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.

National Article Title: Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence (2) shall be constructed in accordance with Span Table 9.20.17.4.-A, 9.20.17.4.-B or 9.20.17.4.-C.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.4. Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence (2) shall be constructed in accordance with Table A-17, A-18 or A-19.

National Article Title: Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence (2) over openings wider than 1 200 mm shall be reinforced for shear with 10M stirrups at a maximum spacing of half the distance from the bottom reinforcing bar to the top of the lintel.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.4. Openings in Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels described in Sentence (2) over openings wider than 1.2 m shall be reinforced for shear with 10M stirrups at a maximum spacing of half the distance from the bottom reinforcing bar to the top of the lintel.

National Article Title: Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: The ledger boards referred to in Sentence 9.20.17.5.(1) shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and the depth of the floor joists.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.5. Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form
P/T Sentence Text: The ledger boards described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 38 mm thick, and (b) the depth of the floor joists.

National Article Title: Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
National Sentence Text: Anchor bolts shall be used to secure ledger boards to flat insulating concrete form walls and shall be embedded in the wall to a depth not less than 100 mm, and spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.17.5.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.5. Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form
P/T Sentence Text: Anchor bolts shall be used to secure ledger boards to flat insulating concrete form walls and shall be,(a) embedded in the wall to a depth not less than 100 mm, and (b) spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.17.5.

National Article Title: Anchoring of Roof Framing to the Top of Flat Insulating Concrete
National Sentence Text: Roof framing supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be fixed to the top plates, which shall be anchored to the wall with anchor bolts not less than 12.7 mm in diameter, and spaced at not more than 1 200 mm o.c.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.6. Anchoring of Roof Framing to Top of Flat Insulating
P/T Sentence Text: Roof framing supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be fixed to the top plates, which shall be anchored to the wall with anchor bolts,(a) not less than 12.7 mm in diameter, and (b) spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.

National Article Title: Anchoring of Roof Framing to the Top of Flat Insulating Concrete
National Sentence Text: The anchor bolts described in Sentence 9.20.17.6.(1) shall be placed in the centre of the flat insulating concrete form wall and shall be embedded no less than 100 mm into the concrete.
P/T Article Title: 9.20.17.6. Anchoring of Roof Framing to Top of Flat Insulating
P/T Sentence Text: The anchor bolts described in Sentence (1) shall be placed in the centre of the flat insulating concrete form wall and shall be embedded not less than 100 mm into the concrete.

National Sentence Text: Above-ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Above ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with Section 9.27.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and flue pipes connected to such chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to,(a) rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and (b) flue pipes serving solid fuel-burning appliances.
Variation Label: Rectangular Masonry or Concrete Chimneys and Flue Pipes

National Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid-fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629, 650°C Factory-Built Chimneys. (See Note A-9.33.10.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-built chimneys serving solid fuel-burning appliances, and their installation, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S629-M, "650ÃÂ°C Factory-Built Chimneys". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The walls of any chimney or flue pipe shall be constructed so as to be smoke- and flame-tight.
P/T Sentence Text: The walls of any chimney or flue pipe shall be constructed to be smoke- and flame-tight.

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
