National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 9.21.2.1., where two or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the connections shall be made as described in Sentences (2) to (4) and an adequate draft shall be provided for the connected appliances in conformance with the requirements of applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with the requirements of the relevant standards listed in Subsection 9.33.10.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.2.2. Connections of More Than One Appliance
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Article 9.21.2.1., two or more fuel-burning appliances are permitted to be connected to the same chimney flue provided adequate draft is maintained for the connected appliances and the connections are made as described in Sentences (2) and (3).

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances shall be located on the same storey.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.2.2. Connections of More Than One Appliance
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more solid fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances must be located on the same storey.

National Sentence Text: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 9.33.5.2.(1) and 9.33.5.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the solid fuel-burning appliance installation standard referenced in Sentence 6.2.1.4.(1) and Article 9.33.1.2.

National Sentence Text: Where a chimney flue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a chimney flue serves only one solid fuel-burning appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.

National Sentence Text: The size of a chimney flue serving a masonry fireplace shall conform to Table 9.21.2.5.-A or 9.21.2.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: The size of a chimney flue serving a masonry fireplace shall be within the allowable range specified in Table 9.21.2.5.A. or Table 9.21.2.5.B.

National Sentence Text: Liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.3.(1) shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick and shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1 100Â°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Liners referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 15.9 mm thick and shall be capable of resisting, without softening or cracking, a temperature of 1100ÃÂ°C.

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C 27-98 Fireclay and High-Alumina Refractory Brick
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C27, "Fireclay and High Alumina Refractory Brick".

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar".

National Sentence Text: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4 of CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4. of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces".

National Sentence Text: Metal liners shall be constructed of not less than 0.3 mm thick stainless steel.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal liners shall be constructed of at least 0.3 mm thick stainless steel.

National Article Title: Spaces between Liners and Surrounding Masonry
National Sentence Text: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and surrounding masonry.
P/T Article Title: 9.21.3.8. Spaces Between Liners and Surrounding Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and the surrounding masonry.

National Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of one part Portland cement to three parts sand by volume.

National Sentence Text: Unit masonry shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.

National Sentence Text: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.15.
P/T Sentence Text: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.15.

National Sentence Text: A chimney flue shall extend not less than 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof, and 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney. (See Note A-9.21.4.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A chimney flue shall extend not less than,(a) 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof, and (b) 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide lateral stability under wind loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), chimneys shall be braced in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. to provide stability under wind loads.

National Sentence Text: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm, and the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part. (See Note A-9.21.4.5.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided,(a) no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm, and (b) the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The cap required in Sentence 9.21.4.6.(1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall.
P/T Sentence Text: The cap required in Sentence (1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall.

National Sentence Text: A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a chimney flue constructed to serve a masonry fireplace, a cleanout opening with a metal frame and tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.

National Sentence Text: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 75 mm of masonry or concrete exclusive of liners where clay liners are used, or 90 mm of firebrick where firebrick liners are used.
P/T Sentence Text: Flue liners in the same chimney shall be separated by not less than 70 mm of masonry or concrete exclusive of liners where clay liners are used, or 90 mm of firebrick where firebrick liners are used.

National Sentence Text: Flue liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.4.9.(1) shall be installed to prevent significant lateral movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Flue liners referred to in Sentence (1) shall be installed to prevent significant lateral movement.

National Sentence Text: All spaces between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be sealed top or bottom with noncombustible material.
P/T Sentence Text: All spaces between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible material shall be sealed top or bottom with noncombustible material.

National Sentence Text: Except when otherwise specifically stated herein, this Section applies to masonry fireplaces constructed on-site.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise specifically stated in this Part, this Section applies to masonry fireplaces constructed on site.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, unit masonry shall conform to part 9. and concrete to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20. and concrete to Section 9.3.

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be not less than 50 mm thick for the sides and back, and 25 mm thick for the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Fireplace liners shall be not less than,(a) 50 mm thick for the sides and back, and (b) 25 mm thick for the floor.

National Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar
P/T Sentence Text: Firebrick liners shall be laid with high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar".

National Sentence Text: Joints between a firebrick liner and the adjacent backing masonry shall be offset.
P/T Sentence Text: Joints between a firebrick liner and the adjacent back-up masonry shall be offset.

National Sentence Text: Steel liners for fireplaces shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S639-M87 Steel Liner Assemblies for Solid-Fuel Burning Masonry Fireplaces and shall be installed in accordance with the installation instructions in that standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Steel liners for fireplaces shall conform to CAN/ULC-S639M, "Steel Liner Assemblies for Solid-Fuel Burning Masonry Fireplaces", and shall be installed in accordance with the installation instructions in that standard.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.22.3.1.(2), the thickness of the back and sides of a fireplace, including the thickness of any firebrick liner, shall be not less than 190 mm where a metal liner or a firebrick liner less than 51 mm thick is used.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the thickness of the back and sides of a fireplace, including the thickness of any firebrick liner, shall be not less than 190 mm where a metal liner or a firebrick liner less than 51 mm thick is used.

National Sentence Text: When a steel fireplace liner is used with an air circulating chamber surrounding the firebox, the back and sides of the fireplace shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 90 mm thick, or hollow masonry units not less than 190 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: When a steel fireplace liner is used with an air circulating chamber surrounding the firebox, the back and sides of the fireplace shall consist of,(a) solid masonry units not less than 90 mm thick, or (b) hollow masonry units not less than 190 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening measured from the facing, and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.22.5.2.(2), the fire chamber floor and hearth shall be supported on a reinforced concrete slab not less than 100 mm thick at its supports and, if cantilevered, not less than 50 mm thick at its unsupported edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the fire chamber floor and hearth shall be supported on a reinforced concrete slab not less than a 100 mm thick at its supports and, if cantilevered, not less than 50 mm thick at its unsupported edge.

National Sentence Text: A hearth for a fireplace with an opening raised not less than 200 mm from a combustible floor is permitted to be supported on that floor provided the requirements of Clauses 5.3.6.5. to 5.3.6.7. of CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces are followed.
P/T Sentence Text: A hearth for a fireplace with an opening raised not less than 200 mm from a combustible floor is permitted to be supported on that floor provided the requirements of Clauses 5.3.6.5. to 5.3.6.7. of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces", are followed.

National Sentence Text: Factory-built fireplaces and their installation shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S610-M87 Factory-Built Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-built fireplaces and their installation shall conform to CAN/ULC-S610-M, "Factory-Built Fireplaces".

National Sentence Text: Metal exposed to the interior of a fireplace such as the damper control mechanism shall have not less than a 50 mm clearance from any combustible material on the face of the fireplace where such metal penetrates through the face of the fireplace.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal exposed to the interior of a fireplace such as the damper control mechanism shall have at least a 50 mm clearance from any combustible material on the face of the fireplace where such metal penetrates through the face of the fireplace.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 100 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of a fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 50 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 100 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of a solid fuel-burning fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 50 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 50 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of the smoke chamber of a fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 25 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 50 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of the smoke chamber of a solid fuel-burning fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 25 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: The clearance of combustible material above heat-circulating duct outlets from those outlets shall be not less than 300 mm where the combustible material projects not less than 38 mm from the face, and 150 mm where the projection is less than 38 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance of combustible material above heat circulating duct openings from those openings shall be not less than,(a) 300 mm where the combustible material projects not less than 38 mm from the face, and (b) 150 mm where the projection is less than 38 mm.

National Sentence Text: The installation of fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The installation of fireplace inserts and hearth mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to CSA B365, "Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment".

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to constructions where wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of lumber frames of small repetitive structural members, or engineered components, and where roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the constructions do not serve as foundations, the specified live load on supported subfloors and floor framing does not exceed 2.4 kPa, and the span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m. (See Note A-9.23.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies where wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of lumber frames of small repetitive structural members, or engineered components, and where,(a) roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, (b) the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 610 mm o.c., (c) the walls do not serve as foundations, (d) the specified live load on supported subfloors and floor framing does not exceed 2.4 kPa, and (e) the span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the conditions in Sentence (1) are exceeded for wood constructions, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the conditions in Sentence (1) are exceeded for wood construction, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Air spaces required in Sentence 9.23.2.2.(1) shall not be blocked by insulation, vapour barriers or airtight materials.
P/T Sentence Text: Air spaces required in Sentence (1) shall not be blocked by insulation, vapour barriers or air tight materials.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.2.3.(2), wood framing members that are not pressure-treated with a wood preservative and that are supported on concrete in contact with the ground or fill shall be separated from the concrete by not less than 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), wood framing members that are not pressure-treated with a wood preservative and that are supported on concrete in contact with the ground or fill shall be separated from the concrete by not less than 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.

National Sentence Text: Dampproofing material referred to in Sentence 9.23.2.3.(1) is not required where the wood member is at least 150 mm above the ground.
P/T Sentence Text: Dampproofing material referred to in Sentence (1) is not required where the wood member is at least 150 mm above the ground.

National Sentence Text: Escalators and moving walkways shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Lumber shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.3.2.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and unless otherwise indicated, nails specified in this Section shall be common steel wire nails or common spiral nails conforming to ASTM F 1667, Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples, or CSA B111, Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and elsewhere in this Part, nails specified in this Section shall be common steel wire nails or common spiral nails, conforming to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Nails used to comply with Table 9.23.3.4. shall have a diameter not less than that stated in Table 9.23.3.1. (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used to comply with Table 9.23.3.4. shall have a diameter not less than that required by Table 9.23.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ASME B18.6.1, Wood Screws (Inch Series). (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ANSI/ASME B18.6.1., "Wood Screws (Inch Series)". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Note A-9.23.3.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to floor joists, rim joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall is permitted to be fastened to the floor framing by having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or tying thewall framing to the floor framing by galvanized-metal strips 50 mm wide, not less than 0.41 mm thick, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall may be fastened to the floor framing by,(a) having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or (b) tying the wall framing to the floor framing by 50 mm wide galvanized-metal strips, (i) not less than 0.41 mm in thickness, (ii) spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and (iii) fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.3.5.(2) to 9.23.3.5.(4) , fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence (5), fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.

National Sentence Text: Spans provided in this Subsection for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall apply only where the floors serve residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3., or the uniformly distributed live load on the floors does not exceed that specified for residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Spans provided in this Subsection for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall apply only where,(a) the floors serve residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3., or (b) the uniformly distributed live load on the floors does not exceed that specified for residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3.

National Sentence Text: Spans for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall be determined according to part 4. where the supported floors serve other than residential areas, or support a uniform live load in excess of that specified for residential areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall be determined according to Subsection 4.1.3. where the supported floors,(a) serve other than residential areas, or (b) support a uniform live load in excess of that specified for residential areas.

National Article Title: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2) and Article 9.23.14.10., spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A to 9.23.4.2.-G for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.4.2. Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2) and Article 9.23.13.10., the spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-1 to A-7 for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables.
Variation Label: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams

National Article Title: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
National Sentence Text: Spans for floor joists that are not selected from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A and 9.23.4.2.-B and that are required to be designed for the same loading conditions, shall not exceed the design requirements for uniform loading and vibration criteria. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.4.2. Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for floor joists that are not selected from Tables A-1 and A-2 and that are required to be designed for the same loading conditions, shall not exceed the design requirements for uniform loading and vibration criteria. (See AppendixÃ A.)

National Article Title: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
National Sentence Text: Spans for roof ridge beams shall conform to the spans in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-L for the uniform snow load shown. (See Articles 9.4.2.2. and 9.23.14.8.)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.4.2. Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for roof ridge beams shall conform to the spans in Table A-12 for the uniform snow load shown.
Variation Label: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams

National Sentence Text: The spans for steel floor beams with laterally supported top flanges shall conform to Table 9.23.4.3. (See Note A-9.23.4.3.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The spans for steel beams with laterally supported top flanges shall conform to Table 9.23.4.3. for floors and TablesÃ A-20 to A-29 for roofs and floors. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Beams described in Sentence 9.23.4.3.(1) shall at least meet the requirements for Grade 350 W steel contained in CSA G40.21-13 Structural Quality Steel
P/T Sentence Text: Beams described in Sentence (1) shall at least meet the requirements for Grade 350 W steel in CSA G40.21, "Structural Quality Steel".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.4.4.(2), where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, the joist spans shown in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A or the spacing of the members shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, the joist spans shown in Table A-1 or the spacing of the members shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.

National Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, joist spans are permitted to be selected from Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B provided the concrete is 38 to 51 mm thick, is normal weight, is placed directly on the subflooring, and has not less than 20 MPa compressive strength after 28 days.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, joist spans are permitted to be selected from Table A-2 provided the concrete,(a) is 38 to 51 mm thick, (b) is normal weight, (c) is placed directly on the subflooring, and (d) has not less than 20 MPa compressive strength after 28 days.

National Sentence Text: Where a roof is required to support an additional uniform dead load from roofing materials such as concrete roofing tile, or materials other than as specified in part 9., such as clay roofing tiles, the additional load shall be allowed for by reducing the spans for roof joists and rafters in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-D to 9.23.4.2.-G, or the spacing of the members, and the spans for ridge beams and lintels in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-L and 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roof is required to support an additional uniform dead load from roofing materials such as concrete roofing tile, or materials other than as specified in Section 9.26., such as clay roofing tiles, the additional load shall be allowed for by reducing,(a) the spans for roof joists and rafters in Tables A-4 to A-7, or the spacing of the members, and (b) the spans for ridge beams and lintels in Tables A-12 to A-16.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.23.6.3.(1), building frames shall be anchored to the foundation unless a structural analysis of wind and earthquake pressures shows anchorage is not required.
P/T Sentence Text: Building frames shall be anchored to the foundation unless a structural analysis of wind and earth pressures shows anchorage is not required.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (3) to (6), anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, or fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.23.6.3., anchorage shall be provided by embedding the ends of the first floor joists in concrete, or fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts spaced not more than 2.4 m o.c.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.23.6.2.(2) and 9.23.6.2.(3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where columns or posts support balconies, decks, verandas or other exterior platforms, and the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, the columns or posts shall be anchored to the foundation to resist uplift and lateral movement, or the supported joists or beams shall be directly anchored to the ground to resist uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where columns or posts support balconies, decks, verandas and other exterior platforms, and the columns or posts extend not more than 600 mm above finished ground level, the supported joists or beams shall be,(a) anchored to a foundation to resist uplift and lateral movement, or (b) directly anchored to the ground to resist uplift.

National Sentence Text: Anchorage is not required for platforms described in Sentence (2) that are not more than 1 storey in height, are not more than 55 m2 in area, do not support a roof, and are not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of the structure to which the platform is attached.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchorage is not required for platforms described in Sentence (2) that,(a) are not more than 1 storey, (b) are not more than 55 mÃÂ² in area, (c) do not support a roof, and (d) are not attached to another structure, unless it can be demonstrated that differential movement will not adversely affect the performance of that structure.

National Sentence Text: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height that are not anchored in accordance with Sentence 9.23.6.1.(1) shall be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1, Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height are permitted to be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1, "Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings".

National Article Title: Levelling and Sealing of Sill Plates
National Sentence Text: The joint between the sill plate for exterior walls and the foundation shall be sealed in accordance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: The joint between the sill plate for exterior walls and the foundation shall be sealed in accordance with SubsectionÃ 9.25.3.

National Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and the bearing at end supports shall be not less than 89 mm long, except as stated in the notes to Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K.
P/T Sentence Text: Beams shall have even and level bearing and shall have not less than 89 mm length of bearing at end supports, except as required in notes to Tables A-8 to A-11.

National Sentence Text: Exterior steel beams shall be shop primed.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior steel beams susceptible to corrosion shall be shop primed with rust-inhibitive paint.

National Sentence Text: Members joined at quarter points shall be continuous over adjacent supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Members joined at quarter points shall be continuous over adjacent supports.

National Sentence Text: Where 38 mm members in built-up wood beams are not nailed together as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(7), they shall be bolted together with not less than 12.7 mm diam bolts equipped with washers and spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c., with the end bolts located not more than 600 mm from the ends of the members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where 38 mm members in built-up wood beams are not nailed together as provided in Sentence (7), they shall be bolted together with not less than 12.7 mm diam bolts equipped with washers and spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c., with the end bolts located not more than 600 mm from the ends of the members.

National Sentence Text: Ribbon boards referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.1.(1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber let into the studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Ribbon boards referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber let into the studs.

National Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a steel beam, joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(1) shall be supported on the bottom flange of the beam or on not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber bolted to the web with not less than 6.3 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 600 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a steel beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on the bottom flange of the beam or on not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber bolted to the web with not less than 6.3 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 600 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Joists referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(3) shall be spliced above the beam with not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber at least 600 mm long to support the flooring.
P/T Sentence Text: Joists referred to in Sentence (3) shall be spliced above the beam with not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber at least 600 mm long to support the flooring.

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), where strapping is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of strapping, and fastened at each end to a sill or header
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Where bridging is specified in Table A-1, it shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 64 mm or 38 mm by 38 mm cross bridging located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging.

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Where bridging is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, it shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 64 mm or 38 mm by 38 mm cross bridging located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Table A-1, (a) bridging shall, (i) comply with Sentence (2), or (ii) consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and (b) except as provided in Sentence (5), strapping shall comply with Sentence (1) and be installed under the bridging.

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-A, bridging shall comply with Sentence (2), or consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2 100 mm from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and except as provided in Sentence (5), strapping shall comply with Sentence (1) and be installed under the bridging.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Bridging specified in Table A-2 shall consist of,(a) bridging as described in Sentence (2), or (b) 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists.

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Where a ceiling attached to wood furring is specified in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-B, the ceiling finish shall consist of gypsum board, plywood or OSB not less than 12.7 mm thick, and the furring shall be 19 mm by 89 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 600 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 64 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Where a ceiling attached to wood furring is specified in Table A-2,(a) the ceiling finish shall consist of gypsum board, plywood or OSB not less than 12.7 mm thick, and (b) the furring shall be, (i) 19 mm by 89 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 610 mm o.c., or (ii) 19 mm by 64 mm wood furring spaced at not more than 406 mm o.c.
Variation Label: Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2

National Sentence Text: Blocking referred to in Sentence (1) for the support of non-loadbearing walls shall be not less than 38 mm by 89 mm lumber, and except as required for the fastening of walls constructed with required braced wall panels, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Blocking referred to in Sentence (1) for the support of non-loadbearing walls shall be not less than 38 mm by 89Ã mm lumber, spaced not more than 1.2 m apart.

National Sentence Text: Loadbearing interior walls parallel to floor joists shall be supported by beams or walls of sufficient strength to safely transfer the specified live loads to the vertical supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Loadbearing interior walls parallel to floor joists shall be supported by beams or walls of sufficient strength to transfer safely the design loads to vertical supports.

National Sentence Text: Unless the joist size is designed to support such loads, loadbearing interior walls at right angles to floor joists shall be located not more than 900 mm from the joist support where the wall does not support a floor, and not more than 600 mm from the joist support where the wall supports one or more floors.
P/T Sentence Text: Loadbearing interior walls at right angles to floor joists shall be located not more than 900 mm from the joist support when the wall does not support a floor, and not more than 600 mm from the joist support when the wall supports one or more floors, unless the joist size is designed to support such loads.

National Sentence Text: The cantilevered portions referred to in Sentence 9.23.9.9.(1) shall not support floor loads from other storeys unless calculations are provided to show that the design resistances of the cantilevered joists are not exceeded.
P/T Sentence Text: The cantilevered portions referred to in Sentence (1) shall not support floor loads from other storeys unless calculations are provided to show that the design resistances of the cantilevered joists are not exceeded.

National Sentence Text: Where cantilevered floor joists described in Sentences (1) and (2) are at right angles to the main floor joists, the tail joists in the cantilevered portion shall extend inward away from the cantilever support a distance equal to not less than 6 times the length of the cantilever, and shall be end nailed to an interior doubled header joist in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cantilevered floor joists described in Sentences (1) and (2) are at right angles to the main floor joists, the tail joists in the cantilevered portion shall, (a) extend inward away from the cantilever support a distance equal to not less than six times the length of the cantilever, and (b) shall be end nailed to an interior doubled header joist in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Sentence Text: The size and spacing of studs shall conform to Table 9.23.10.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the size and spacing of studs shall conform to Table 9.23.10.1.

National Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where bracing is required, it shall,(a) consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm wood members, (b) be applied to the studs at an angle of approximately 45ÃÂ° to the horizontal, and (c) extend the full height of the wall on each storey.

National Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing described in Sentence (3) shall be nailed to each stud and wall plate by at least two 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: Where loadbearing interior walls are not finished in accordance with Section 9.29., blocking or strapping shall be fastened to the studs at mid-height to prevent sideways buckling.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.10.2. Bracing and Lateral Support (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where loadbearing interior walls are not finished in accordance with Sentence (2), blocking or strapping shall be fastened to the studs at mid-height to prevent sideways buckling.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.23.10.3.(2) and 9.23.10.3.(3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.

National Sentence Text: Wall studs shall be continuous for the full storey height except at openings and shall not be spliced except by fingerjoining with a structural adhesive. (See Note A-9.23.10.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Wall studs shall be continuous for the full storey height except at openings and shall not be spliced except by finger-jointing with a structural adhesive. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Support for Cladding, Sheathing and Finishing Materials
National Sentence Text: Corners and intersections shall be designed to provide adequate support for the vertical edges of interior finishes, sheathing and cladding materials, and in no instance shall exterior corners be framed with less than the equivalent of 2 studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Corners and intersections shall be designed to provide adequate support for the vertical edges of interior finishes, sheathing and cladding materials, and in no instance shall exterior corners be framed with less than the equivalent of two studs.

National Article Title: Support for Cladding, Sheathing and Finishing Materials
National Sentence Text: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in Section 9.29.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the lintel spanning the opening is not more than 3 m long, studs shall be doubled on each side of the opening so that the inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), studs shall be doubled on each side of openings so that the inner studs extend from the lintel to the bottom wall plate and the outer studs extend from the top wall plates to the bottom wall plate.

National Sentence Text: Single studs are permitted to be used on either side of openings in non-loadbearing interior walls not required to have fire-resistance ratings, provided the studs extend from the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate, or in loadbearing or non-loadbearing interior or exterior walls, provided the opening is less than and within the required stud spacing, and no 2 such openings of full stud-space width are located in adjacent stud spaces. (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Single studs are permitted to be used on either side of openings,(a) in non-loadbearing interior walls not required to have fire-resistance ratings, provided the studs extend from the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate, or (b) in loadbearing or non-loadbearing interior or exterior walls, provided, (i) the opening is less than and within the required stud spacing, and (ii) no two such openings of full stud space width are located in adjacent stud spaces. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: In non-loadbearing walls and in loadbearing walls where the studs are located directly over framing members, the bottom wall plate is permitted to be 19 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: In non-loadbearing walls and in loadbearing walls where the studs are located directly over framing members, the bottom wall plate may be 19 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: The top plates need not be provided in a section of loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the lintel is tied to the adjacent wall section with not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel, or 19 mm by 89 mm by 300 mm wood splice nailed to each wall section with at least three 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: The top plates need not be provided in a section of loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the lintel is tied to the adjacent wall section with,(a) not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel, or (b) 19 mm by 89 mm by 300 mm wood splice nailed to each wall section with at least three 63 mm nails.

National Sentence Text: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence (4).
P/T Sentence Text: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise suitably tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence (4).

National Sentence Text: Joints in single top plates used with loadbearing walls shall be tied in accordance with Sentence 9.23.11.4.(4).
P/T Sentence Text: Joints in single top plates used with loadbearing walls shall be tied in accordance with Sentence (4).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.1.(2), openings in non-loadbearing walls shall be framed with not less than 38 mm material the same width as the studs, securely nailed to adjacent studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), openings in non-loadbearing walls shall be framed with not less than 38 mm material the same width as the studs securely nailed to adjacent studs.

National Sentence Text: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs. (See Note A-9.23.10.6.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2), where 2 or more members are used in lintels, they shall be fastened together with not less than 82 mm nails in a double row, with nails not more than 450 mm apart in each row.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2), where two or more members are used in lintels, they shall be fastened together with not less than 82 mm nails in a double row, with nails not more than 450 mm apart in each row.

National Sentence Text: Lintel members are permitted to be separated by filler pieces.
P/T Sentence Text: Lintel members may be separated by filler pieces.

National Sentence Text: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-L and 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D for buildings of residential occupancy, where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-12 to A-16,(a) for buildings of residential occupancy, (b) where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, (c) where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and (d) where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.

National Sentence Text: In loadbearing exterior and interior walls of 38 mm by 64 mm framing members, lintels shall consist of 64 mm thick members on edge, or 38 mm thick and 19 mm thick members fastened together with a double row of nails not less than 63 mm long and spaced not more than 450 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: In loadbearing exterior and interior walls of 38 mm by 64 mm framing members, lintels shall consist of,(a) solid 64 mm thick members on edge, or (b) 38 mm thick and 19 mm thick members fastened together with a double row of nails not less than 63 mm long and spaced not more than 450 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Lintels referred to in Sentence (2) shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than those shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-L and 9.23.12.3.-A to 9.23.12.3.-D for the maximum spans shown, and shall not exceed 2.24 m in length.
P/T Sentence Text: Lintels referred to in Sentence (2),(a) shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than those shown in Tables A-12 to A-16 for the maximum spans shown, and (b) shall not exceed 2.24 m in length.

National Article Title: Requirements for Low to Moderate Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: This Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.70 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 0.80 kPa.
Variation Label: Requirements for Low to Moderate Wind and Seismic Forces

National Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members shall be doubled on each side of openings greater than 2 rafter or joist spacings wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof and ceiling framing members shall be doubled on each side of openings greater than two rafter or joist spacings wide.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.14.4.(3), framing members shall be connected by gusset plates or nailing at the peak in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), framing members shall be connected by gusset plates or nailing at the peak in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4.

National Article Title: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
National Sentence Text: Collar ties referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7.(1) more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.13.7. Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
P/T Sentence Text: Collar ties referred to in Sentence (1) more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.

National Article Title: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
National Sentence Text: When dwarf walls are used for rafter support, they shall be framed in the same manner as loadbearing walls and securely fastened top and bottom to the roof and ceiling framing to prevent over-all movement.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.13.7. Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
P/T Sentence Text: When dwarf walls are used for rafter support, they shall be framed in the same manner as loadbearing walls and securely fastened top and bottom to the roof and ceiling framing to prevent overall movement.

National Article Title: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
National Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be installed between floor joists beneath dwarf walls referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7.(5) that enclose finished rooms.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.13.7. Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
P/T Sentence Text: Solid blocking shall be installed between floor joists beneath dwarf walls referred to in Sentence (5) that enclose finished rooms.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(4), roof rafters and joists shall be supported at the ridge of the roof by a loadbearing wall extending from the ridge to suitable bearing, or a ridge beam supported by not less than 89 mm length of bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), roof rafters and joists shall be supported at the ridge of the roof by,(a) a loadbearing wall extending from the ridge to suitable bearing, or (b) a ridge beam supported by not less than 89 mm length of bearing.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(3), the ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(1) shall conform to the sizes and spans shown in Span Table 9.23.4.2.-L, provided the supported rafter or joist length does not exceed 4.9 m, and the roof does not support any concentrated loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the ridge beam referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform to the sizes and spans shown in Table A-12, provided,(a) the supported rafter or joist length does not exceed 4.9 m, and (b) the roof does not support any concentrated loads.

National Sentence Text: Ties required in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(4) are permitted to consist of tie rods or ceiling joists forming a continuous tie for opposing rafters and nailed in accordance with Table 9.23.14.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Ties required in Sentence (4) are permitted to consist of tie rods or ceiling joists forming a continuous tie for opposing rafters and nailed in accordance with Table 9.23.13.8.

National Sentence Text: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence (5) shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.14.8.
P/T Sentence Text: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence (5) shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.13.8.

National Sentence Text: Members referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(6) are permitted to be fastened together either directly or through a gusset plate.
P/T Sentence Text: Members referred to in Sentence (6) are permitted to be fastened together either directly or through a gusset plate.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), ceiling joists supporting part of the roof load from the rafters shall be not less than 25 mm greater in depth than required for ceiling joists not supporting part of the roof load.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), ceiling joists supporting part of the roof load from the rafters shall be not less than 25 mm greater in depth than required for ceiling joists not supporting part of the roof load.

National Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence (1) shall be determined from Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-C to 9.23.4.2.-F and 9.23.4.2.-L for roof joists.
P/T Sentence Text: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence (1) shall be determined from the span tables for roof joists.

National Sentence Text: Roof trusses which are not designed in accordance with Part 4 shall be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live load ) of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.14.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Roof trusses that are not designed in accordance with Part 4 shall,(a) be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and (b) not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.13.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The joint connections used in trusses described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 4.3.1. (See Note A-9.23.14.11.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The joint connections used in trusses described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 4.3.1. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the length of compression web members in roof trusses described in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(1) exceeds 1.83 m, such web members shall be provided with continuous bracing to prevent buckling.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the length of compression web members in roof trusses described in Sentence (1) exceeds 1.83 m, such web members shall be provided with continuous bracing to prevent buckling.

National Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence 9.23.14.11.(3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
P/T Sentence Text: Bracing required in Sentence (3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.

National Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M, Load Test Procedure for Wood Roof Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M, "Load Test Procedure for Wood Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as that described in TPIC 2014, Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses (Limit States Design).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as described in TPIC, "Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2), wood-based panels for subfloors shall conform to CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wood-based panels for subfloors shall conform to,(a) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (b) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (c) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", (d) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (e) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence 9.23.15.2.(2) shall conform to grade D-2 or D-3 in ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
P/T Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence (2) shall conform to grade D-2 or D-3 in ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard".

National Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence (2) shall have its upper surface and all edges treated to restrict water absorption, where the subfloor is used in bathrooms, kitchens, laundry rooms or other areas subject to periodic wetting. (See Note A-9.23.15.2.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Subflooring described in Sentence (2) shall have its upper surface and all edges treated to restrict water absorption where the subfloor is used in bathrooms, kitchens, laundry rooms or other areas subject to periodic wetting. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the edges of panel-type subflooring are required to be supported (see Sentence 9.30.2.1.(2)), such support shall consist of tongue-and-groove panel edges or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the edges of panel-type subflooring are required to be supported, such support shall consist of tongue-and-groove panel edges or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.

National Sentence Text: OSB subflooring conforming to CSA O325, Construction Sheathing, or to O-1 and O-2 grades in CSA O437.0, OSB and Waferboard, and waferboard subflooring conforming to R-1 grade in CSA O437.0 shall be installed so that the direction of face orientation is at right angles to the joists and the joints parallel to the floor joists are staggered. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: OSB subflooring conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or to O-1 and O-2 grades in CSAÃ O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard", and waferboard subflooring conforming to R-1 grade in CSA O437.0 shall be installed so that the direction of face orientation is at right angles to the joists and the joints parallel to the floor joists are staggered. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), subfloors shall conform to either Table 9.23.15.5.-A or 9.23.15.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), subfloors shall conform to Table 9.23.14.5.A. or 9.23.14.5.B.

National Sentence Text: Where the finished flooring consists of not less than 19 mm matched wood strip flooring laid at right angles to joists spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., subflooring shall be permitted to consist of not less than 12.5 mm thick plywood, 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or OSB conforming to 2R32/2F16 grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the finished flooring consists of not less than 19 mm matched wood strip flooring laid at right angles to joists, spaced not more than 610 mm o.c., subflooring shall be permitted to consist of not less than,(a) 12.5 mm thick plywood, (b) 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, (c) 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, (d) 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or (e) OSB conforming to 2R32 / 2F16 grade.

National Sentence Text: Except where the flooring consists of ceramic tiles applied with adhesive, where a separate panel-type underlay or concrete topping is applied to a subfloor on joists spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., the subfloor is permitted to consist of not less than 12.5 mm thick plywood, 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or OSB conforming to 2R32/2F16 grade.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the flooring consists of ceramic tiles applied with adhesive, where a separate panel-type underlay or concrete topping is applied to a subfloor on joists spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., the subfloor may consist of not less than,(a) 12.5 mm thick plywood, (b) 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, (c) 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, (d) 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or (e) OSB conforming to 2R32 / 2F16 grade.

National Sentence Text: Except where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 0.8 kPa and the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is less than or equal to 0.70, continuous lumber or panel-type roof sheathing shall be installed to support the roofing.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Section 9.26., continuous lumber or panel-type roof sheathing shall be installed to support the roofing.

National Sentence Text: Wood-based panels used for roof sheathing shall conform to the requirements of CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Wood-based panels used for roof sheathing shall conform to the requirements of,(a) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (b) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (c) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", (d) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (e) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Panel-type sheathing board shall be applied so that joints perpendicular to the roof ridge are staggered where the sheathing is applied with the surface grain parallel to the roof ridge, and the thickness of the sheathing is such that the edges are required to be supported.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type sheathing board shall be applied so that joints perpendicular to the roof ridge are staggered where,(a) the sheathing is applied with the surface grain parallel to the roof ridge, and (b) the thickness of the sheathing is such that the edges are required to be supported.

National Sentence Text: Where panel-type roof sheathing requires edge support, the support shall consist of metal H clips or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), where panel-type roof sheathing requires edge support, the support shall consist of,(a) metal H clips, or (b) not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.

National Sentence Text: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a flat roof used as a walking deck shall conform to either Table 9.23.15.5.-A or Table 9.23.15.5.-B for subfloors.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a flat roof used as a walking deck shall conform to either Table 9.23.14.5.A. or Table 9.23.14.5.B. for subfloors.

National Sentence Text: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a roof not used as a walking deck shall conform to either Table 9.23.16.7.-A or Table 9.23.16.7.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a roof not used as a walking deck shall conform to either TableÃ 9.23.15.7.A. or Table 9.23.15.7.B.

National Sentence Text: Asphalt-coated or asphalt-impregnated fibreboard not less than 11.1 mm thick conforming to CAN/ULC-S706.1, Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings, is permitted to be used as a roof sheathing over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c. provided the roofing consists of a continuous sheet of galvanized steel not less than 0.33 mm in thickness, or a continuous sheet of aluminum not less than 0.61 mm in thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Asphalt-coated or asphalt-impregnated fibreboard not less than 11.1 mm thick conforming to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings", is permitted to be used as a roof sheathing over supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., provided the roofing consists of,(a) a continuous sheet of galvanized steel not less than 0.33 mm in thickness, or (b) a continuous sheet of aluminum not less than 0.61 mm in thickness.

National Sentence Text: All edges of sheathing described in Sentence 9.23.16.7.(3) shall be supported by blocking or framing.
P/T Sentence Text: All edges of sheathing described in Sentence (3) shall be supported by blocking or framing.

National Sentence Text: Where wall sheathing is required for the purpose of complying with this Section, it shall conform to either Table 9.23.17.2.-A or 9.23.17.2.-B. (See also Article 9.25.5.1.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where wall sheathing is required for the purpose of complying with this Section, it shall conform to TableÃ 9.23.16.2.A. or Table 9.23.16.2.B.

National Sentence Text: Where the bottom portions of mansard style roofs are vented, the vertical framing members behind the sloping portions shall be considered on the same basis as exterior wall studs and shall conform to Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the bottom portions of mansard style roofs are vented, the vertical framing members behind the sloping portions shall be considered on the same basis as exterior wall studs and shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6.

National Sentence Text: Steel studs and runners shall conform to AISI S201-12 North American Standard for Cold-Formed Steel Framing - Product Data
P/T Sentence Text: Steel studs and runners shall conform to AISI S201, "North American Standard for Cold Formed Steel Framing Ã¢â¬" Product Data".

National Sentence Text: Screws for the application of cladding, sheathing or interior finish materials to steel studs, runners and furring channels shall conform to ASTM C 954-11 Steel Drill Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Steel Studs from 0.033 in. (0.84 to 0.112 in. (2.84 in Thickness or ASTM C 1002-07 Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs
P/T Sentence Text: Screws for the application of cladding, sheathing or interior finish materials to steel studs, runners and furring channels shall conform to,(a) ASTM C954, "Steel Drill Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Steel Studs from 0.033 in. (0.84 to 0.112 in. (2.84 in Thickness", or (b) ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".

National Article Title: Cladding, Sheathing and Interior Finish Required
National Sentence Text: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws spaced at the appropriate spacing described in part 9., and penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.
P/T Article Title: 9.24.1.5. Cladding, Sheathing and Interior Finish Required
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws,(a) spaced at the appropriate spacing described in Section 9.29., and (b) penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.

National Sentence Text: Runners for interior and exterior non-loadbearing walls shall have a thickness not less than the thickness of the corresponding studs and shall have not less than 30 mm flanges.
P/T Sentence Text: Runners for interior and exterior non-loadbearing walls shall have a thickness of not less than the thickness of the corresponding studs and shall have not less than 30 mm flanges.

National Sentence Text: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1 200 mm in width, the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1.2 m in width,(a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and (b) the steel thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where openings described in Sentence (1) exceed 1 200 mm in width, the width of steel studs shall be not less than 91 mm, and the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.85 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where openings described in Sentence (1) exceed 1.2 m in width,(a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 91 mm, and (b) the metal thickness shall be not less than 0.85 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence 9.24.2.4.(3) and the top runner exceeds 400 mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence (3) and the top runner exceeds 400Ã mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.

National Sentence Text: Runners required in Sentence 9.24.3.1.(1) shall be securely attached to the building at approximately 50 mm from the ends, and at intervals of not more than 600 mm o.c. for interior walls and 300 mm o.c. for exterior walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Runners required in Sentence (1) shall be securely attached to the building at approximately 50 mm from the ends, and at intervals of not more than 610 mm o.c. for interior walls and 305 mm o.c. for exterior walls.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence 9.24.3.1.(2) shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence (2) shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.

National Sentence Text: Studs at openings and which are not full wall height shall be supported by a runner at the ends of the studs, securely fastened to the full length studs at the sides of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs at openings and that are not full wall height shall be supported by a runner at the ends of the studs, securely fastened to the full length studs at the sides of the opening.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.24.3.6., studs in walls referred to in Sentence 9.24.3.2.(1) shall not be attached to the runners in a manner that will prevent such expansion.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.24.3.6., studs in walls referred to in Sentence (1) shall not be attached to the runners in a manner that will prevent such expansion.

National Sentence Text: Framing above doors with steel door frames in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating shall consist of 2 runners on the flat fastened back to back. (See Note A-9.24.3.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Framing above doors with steel door frames in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating shall consist of two runners on the flat fastened back to back. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The upper runner required in Sentence 9.24.3.2.(3) shall be bent at each end to extend upwards not less than 150 mm and fastened to the adjacent studs.
P/T Sentence Text: The lower runner required in Sentence (3) shall be cut through the flanges and be bent at each end to extend upwards at least 150 mm and fastened to the adjacent studs.

National Sentence Text: Studs described in Sentence 9.24.3.5.(1) shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Studs described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.

National Sentence Text: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence 9.24.3.6.(1) shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.
P/T Sentence Text: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence (1) shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.

National Sentence Text: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7.(1) shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.
P/T Sentence Text: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence (1) shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.

National Sentence Text: This Section is concerned with heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.

National Sentence Text: Insulation and sealing of heating and ventilating ducts shall conform to Sections 9.32., 9.33. and 9.36.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation and sealing of heating and ventilating ducts shall conform to Sections 9.32. and 9.33.

National Sentence Text: All walls, ceilings and floors separating heated space from unheated space, the exterior air or the exterior soil shall be provided with sufficient thermal insulation to prevent moisture condensation on their room side during the winter and to ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants. (See Note A-9.1.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: All walls, ceilings and floors separating heated space from unheated space, the exterior air or the exterior soil shall be provided with thermal insulation in conformance with Section 12.2. to prevent moisture condensation on their room side during the winter and to ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants.

National Sentence Text: The flame-spread ratings requirements contained in the standards listed in Sentence 9.25.2.2.(1) shall not apply. (See Note A-9.25.2.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The flame-spread rating requirements contained in the standards listed in Sentence (1) shall not apply. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Insulation in contact with the ground shall be inert to the action of soil and water and shall be such that its insulative properties are not significantly reduced by moisture.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulation in contact with the ground shall be inert to the action of soil and water and be such that its insulative properties are not significantly reduced by moisture.

National Sentence Text: Except where the insulation provides the principal resistance to air leakage, thermal insulation shall be installed so that at least one face is in full and continuous contact with an element with low air permeance. (See Note A-9.25.2.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the insulation provides the principal resistance to air leakage, thermal insulation shall be installed so that at least one face is in full and continuous contact with an element with low air permeance. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than,(a) reserved, (b) 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or (c) 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: In unfinished basements, the protection required in Sentence (7) need not be provided for mineral fibre insulation, provided it is covered with polyethylene vapour barrier of at least 0.15 mm in thickness.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.2.4.(2) to 9.25.2.4.(6), loose-fill insulation shall be used on horizontal surfaces only.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (6), loose-fill insulation shall be used on horizontal surfaces only.

National Sentence Text: Where loose-fill insulation is installed in an unconfined sloped space, such as an attic space over a sloped ceiling, the supporting slope shall not be more than 4.5 in 12 for mineral fibre or cellulose fibre insulation, and 2.5 in 12 for other types of insulation.
