P/T Sentence Text: Where loose-fill insulation is installed in an unconfined sloped space, such as an attic space over a sloped ceiling, the supporting slope shall not be more than,(a) 4.5 in 12 for mineral fibre or cellulose fibre insulation, and (b) 2.5 in 12 for other types of insulation.

National Sentence Text: Loose-fill insulation is permitted to be used in wood-frame walls of existing buildings. (See Note A-9.25.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Loose-fill insulation may be used in wood frame walls of existing buildings. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where blown-in insulation is installed in above-ground or below-ground wood-frame walls of new buildings, the density of the installed insulation shall be sufficient to preclude settlement, the insulation shall be installed behind a membrane that will permit visual inspection prior to the installation of the interior finish, the insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not interfere with the installation of the interior finish, and no water shall be added to the insulation, unless it can be shown that the added water will not adversely affect other materials in the assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Where blown-in insulation is installed in above-ground or below-ground wood frame walls of new buildings, (a) the density of the installed insulation shall be sufficient to preclude settlement, (b) the insulation shall be installed behind a membrane that will permit visual inspection prior to installation of the interior finish, (c) the insulation shall be installed in a manner that will not interfere with the installation of the interior finish, and (d) no water shall be added to the insulation, unless it can be shown that the added water will not adversely affect other materials in the assembly.

National Sentence Text: Water repellent loose-fill insulation is permitted to be used between the outer and inner wythes of masonry cavity walls. (See Note A-9.25.2.4.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Water repellent loose-fill insulation may be used between the outer and inner wythes of masonry cavity walls. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and to minimize airflow into the insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material. (See Article 9.19.1.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken, (a) to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and (b) to minimize air flow into the loose-fill insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material.

National Sentence Text: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces, sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the winter, and from the exterior or the ground inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during winter, ensure comfortable conditions for the occupants, and minimize the ingress of soil gas.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies that separate conditioned spaces from unconditioned spaces or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage,(a) from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the heating season, and (b) from the exterior inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during the heating season. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.
P/T Sentence Text: The continuity of the air barrier system shall extend throughout the basement.

National Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide airtightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.34-M86 Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Where polyethylene sheet is used to provide the air-tightness in the air barrier system, it shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to prevent air leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where the air barrier system consists of an air-impermeable panel-type material, all joints shall be sealed to minimize air leakage.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior wall meets an exterior wall, ceiling, floor or roof required to be provided with an air barrier protection, the air barrier system shall extend across the intersection and shall be sealed in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling by,(a) sealing each air barrier to the blocking, or (b) wrapping each air barrier around the transition and sealing in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed with compatible material such as tape or caulking to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows and other fenestration shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior air barrier is penetrated by doors, windows and other fenestration, the air barrier shall be sealed to the door frame or window frame with,(a) compatible tape, or (b) spray foam insulation.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows, electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exterior air barrier is penetrated by doors, windows and other fenestration, the air barrier shall be sealed to the door frame or window frame with,(a) compatible flexible flashing material, (b) caulking, or (c) spray foam insulation.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Where access hatches and sump pit covers are installed through assemblies constructed with an air barrier system, they shall be weatherstripped around their perimeters to prevent air leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: An access hatch installed through an assembly constructed with an air barrier system shall be weatherstripped around the perimeter to minimize air leakage.

National Article Title: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
National Sentence Text: Clearances between chimneys or gas vents and the surrounding construction that would permit air leakage from within the building into a wall or attic or roof space shall be sealed by noncombustible material to prevent such leakage.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.3.3. Continuity of the Air Barrier System
P/T Sentence Text: Clearances between chimneys or gas vents and the surrounding construction that would permit air leakage from within the building into a wall or attic or roof space shall be sealed by noncombustible material to prevent such leakage and shall be sealed to the air barrier with tape or another compatible material, and to the vent with high temperature caulking in accordance with the manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s installation instructions.
Variation Label: Continuity of the Air Barrier System

National Sentence Text: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier so as to provide a barrier to diffusion of water vapour from the interior into wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier sufficient to prevent condensation in the wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.
Variation Label: Vapour Barriers Used as Air Barriers

National Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to the requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.33-M89 Vapour Barrier Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction
P/T Sentence Text: Membrane-type vapour barriers other than polyethylene shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.33-M, "Vapour Barrier, Sheet, Excluding Polyethylene, for Use in Building Construction".

National Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-1.501-M89 Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard
P/T Sentence Text: Where a coating is applied to gypsum board to function as the vapour barrier, the permeance of the coating shall be determined in accordance with CAN/CGSB-1.501-M, "Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard".

National Sentence Text: Where foamed plastic insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence 9.25.4.2.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Note A-9.25.4.3.(2) and Note A-9.25.5.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Appendix A and Appendix Note A-9.25.5.1.(1))

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.25.5.1.(2) to 9.25.5.1.(4), sheet and panel-type materials incorporated into assemblies described in Article 9.25.1.1. shall conform to Article 9.25.5.2., where the material has an air leakage characteristic less than 0.1 L/(sÂ·m2) at 75 Pa, and a water vapour permeance less than 60 ng/(PaÂ·sÂ·m2) when measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry (see Note A-9.25.5.1.(1)(a)(ii)), and the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation.

(b) the intended use of the interior space where the materials are installed will not result in high moisture generation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Wood-based sheathing materials not more than 12.5 mm thick and complying with Article 9.23.17.2. need not comply with Sentence 9.25.5.1.(1). (See Note A-9.25.5.1.(3).)

National Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials described in Article 9.25.5.1. shall be installed on the warm face of the assembly (see also Article 9.25.4.2.), at a location where the ratio between the total thermal resistance of all materials outboard of its innermost impermeable surface and the total thermal resistance of all materials inboard of that surface is not less than that required by Table 9.25.5.2., or outboard of an air space that is vented to the outdoors.
P/T Article Title: 9.25.5.2. Position of Low Permeance Materials (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet and panel-type materials described in Article 9.25.5.1. shall be installed,(a) on the warm face of the assembly, (b) at a location where the ratio between the total thermal resistance of all materials outboard of its innermost impermeable surface and the total thermal resistance of all materials inboard of that surface is not less than that required by Table 9.25.5.2., or (c) outboard of an air space that is vented to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: For walls, the air space described in Clause (1)(c) shall comply with Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a).
P/T Article Title: 9.25.5.2. Position of Low Permeance Materials (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: For walls, the air space described in Clause (1)(c) shall be drained and ventilated and shall be not less than 10 mm deep behind the cladding, over the full height and width of the wall.

National Sentence Text: For the purpose of this Section, the term "roof" shall mean sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them, including platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation. (See Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In this Section,(a) "roof" means sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them and includes platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation, and (b) "roofing" means the primary covering for roofs. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to effectively shed water, prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.
P/T Sentence Text: Roofs shall be protected with roofing, including flashing, installed so as to,(a) effectively shed water, (b) prevent the ingress of water and moisture into building assemblies and occupied space, and (c) minimize the ingress of water due to ice damming into building assemblies.

National Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence 9.26.1.2.(1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to the remainder of this Section, or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Compliance with Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to, (a) this Section, or (b) Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Methods described in CSA CAN3-A123.51-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper or in CSA CAN3-A123.52-M85 Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less Than 1:3 are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: Methods described in CAN3-A123.51-M, "Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:3 and Steeper", or CAN3-A123.52-M, "Asphalt Shingle Application on Roof Slopes 1:6 to Less than 1:3", are permitted to be used for asphalt shingle applications not described in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Nails used with wood shingles or shakes shall have a head diameter of not less than 4.8 mm and a shank thickness of not less than 2.0 mm and shall be stainless steel, aluminum or hot-dipped galvanized. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum. (See Note A-9.26.2.3.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1.(2) and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.

National Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence (1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.

National Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required by Sentence 9.26.3.1.(1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturerâs written recommendations.
P/T Sentence Text: Profiled metal roof cladding systems specifically designed for low-slope applications are permitted to be installed with lower slopes than required in Sentence (1), provided they are installed in conformance with the manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s written recommendations.

National Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions due to water ingress, roofs and constructions that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from exterior walls, and guards that are connected to the roof, or to a construction that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts. (See Notes A-9.26.1.1.(1), A-9.26.4.1. and A-9.27.3.8.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements due to water ingress, roofs and elements that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from,(a) exterior walls, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof, or to an element that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: Except where the omission of flashing will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting constructions, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and walls that rise above the roof, and guards that are connected to the roof by more than pickets or posts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except where the omission will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and,(a) walls that rise above the roof, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof by other than pickets or posts.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.33 mm thick copper, 0.35 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal flashing shall consist of not less than,(a) 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, (b) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (c) 0.33 mm thick copper, (d) 0.35 mm thick zinc, or (e) 0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3.(4) shall consist of at least Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence (4) shall consist of not less than Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Counter flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.4. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Counter flashing required in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry and shall extend not less than 150 mm down the masonry and lap the lower flashing not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.4. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing along the slopes of a roof described in Sentence (1) shall be stepped so that there is not less than a 75 mm head lap in both the lower flashing and counter flashing.

National Article Title: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Where the roof described in Sentence 9.26.4.4.(1) slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.4. Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Where the roof described in Sentence (1) slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.

National Article Title: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Masonry
National Sentence Text: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.6.(1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.
P/T Article Title: 9.26.4.6. Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Masonry
P/T Sentence Text: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
National Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1) behind the sheathing paper.

P/T Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence (1) behind the sheathing paper.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence 9.26.4.8.(5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence (5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: The intersection of the saddle and the chimney shall be flashed and counterflashed as described in Article 9.26.4.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The intersection of the saddle and the chimney shall be flashed and counterflashed as required in Article 9.26.4.4.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.5.1.(2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/m2, or No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), when underlay is used beneath shingles, it shall be,(a) asphalt-saturated sheathing paper weighing not less than 0.195 kg/mÃÂ², or (b) No. 15 plain or perforated asphalt-saturated felt. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The top edge of each strip of underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2.(1) shall be fastened with sufficient roofing nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The top edge of each strip referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened with sufficient roofing nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

National Sentence Text: The underlay referred to in Sentence 9.26.6.2.(1) shall overlap the eave protection by not less than 100 mm. (See Article 9.26.10.2. for underlay beneath wood shakes.)
P/T Sentence Text: The underlay referred to in Sentence (1) shall overlap the eave protection by not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide, shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips shall be,(a) at least Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing not less than 300 mm wide, (b) shingles of the same weight and quality as those used as a roof covering with tabs facing up the roof slope, or (c) pre-manufactured starter strips installed with sealant at the eaves.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of polyethylene and bituminous material is provided.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2), shingles shall be fastened with at least 4 nails or staples for 1 m wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), shingles shall be fastened with at least four nails or staples for 1 000 mm wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.

National Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least 6 staples.
P/T Sentence Text: Where staples with an 11 mm crown are used, shingles shall be fastened with at least six staples.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1) and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be located 25 mm to 40 mm from each end of each strip shingle with other fasteners equally spaced between them.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences 9.26.7.4.(1) and 9.26.7.4.(2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.7.6.(1) shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened with nails or staples on each side located not more than 25 mm from the edge and 25 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.

National Sentence Text: Except for the first 2 courses, coverage shall be not less than 3 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the first two courses, coverage shall be not less than three thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.

National Sentence Text: Starter strips required in Sentence 9.26.8.2.(1) shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Starter strips required in Sentence (1) shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/m2 of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/m2 of cemented area.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/mÃÂ² of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/mÃÂ² of cemented area.

National Sentence Text: The band required in Sentence 9.26.8.4.(2) shall be located not more than 50 mm above the butt of the overlying course of shingles.
P/T Sentence Text: The band required in Sentence (2) shall be located not more than 50 mm above the butt of the overlying course of shingles.

National Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence 9.26.8.5.(1) shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles referred to in Sentence (1) shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.

National Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened with 2 nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shingle and 40 mm above the exposure line.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles shall be fastened with two nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from the sides of the shingle and 40Ã mm above the exposure line.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.

National Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlaid between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.
P/T Sentence Text: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence (1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlayed between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.

National Sentence Text: Interlaid strips referred to in Sentence 9.26.10.2.(2) shall be lapped not less than 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.
P/T Sentence Text: Interlayed strips in Sentence (2) shall be lapped at least 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.

National Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in any one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.
P/T Sentence Text: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.

National Sentence Text: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and 250 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.
P/T Sentence Text: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed,(a) 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and (b) 240 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.

National Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be at least No. 15 felt.
P/T Sentence Text: Bitumen roofing felts shall be not less than No.15 felt.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.

National Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of not less than 3 mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.
P/T Sentence Text: Built-up roofing shall consist of at least three mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.

National Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.7.(1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.
P/T Sentence Text: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence (1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with not less than a 50 mm headlap and a 50 mm sidelap between each sheet.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with at least a 50 mm headlap and a 50Ã mm sidelap between each sheet.

National Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence 9.26.11.8.(1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence (1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.

National Sentence Text: At least 2 plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.
P/T Sentence Text: No fewer than two plies of the roofing membrane shall be carried over the top of the cant strip.

National Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(1) need not be provided where a gravel stop is installed at the edge of roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: The cant strip required in Sentence (1) may be omitted where a gravel stop is provided at the edge of roofs.

National Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) is fastened and 2 plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.
P/T Sentence Text: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) is fastened and two plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.

National Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence 9.26.11.10.(4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.
P/T Sentence Text: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.

National Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, or 0.48 mm thick aluminum.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheet metal roofing shall be not less than,(a) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (b) 0.46 mm thick copper, (c) 0.46 mm thick zinc, or (d) 0.48 mm thick aluminum.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), where glass-reinforced polyester roofing panels are not supported by roof decking but span between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live roof loads.
P/T Sentence Text: Where glass reinforced polyester roofing panels are not supported by roof decking but span between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified roof loads.

National Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-37.51-M90 Application for Hot-Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing
P/T Sentence Text: Hot applied rubberized asphalt roofing shall be installed in accordance with CAN/CGSB-37.51-M, "Application for Hot Applied Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), concrete roof tiles shall be installed according to CSA CAN/CSA-A220 Series-06 Concrete Roof Tiles (See Note A-9.26.17.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete roof tiles shall be installed according to CAN/CSA-A220.1-M, "Installation of Concrete Roof Tiles". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner which will prevent soil erosion.
P/T Sentence Text: Where downspouts are provided and are not connected to a sewer, extensions shall be provided to carry rainwater away from the building in a manner that will prevent soil erosion.

National Sentence Text: Where stucco is installed as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. to 9., and part 9., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where stucco is installed as cladding on wood frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.27.2. to 9.27.4., and Section 9.28., or (b) Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Where asphalt shingles are installed as cladding on wood-frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. and 9. to 9., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where asphalt shingles are installed as cladding on wood frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.26.7. and 9.27.2. to 9.27.4., or (b) Part 5.

National Sentence Text: Where cladding materials other than those described in Sentences (1) to (5) are installed, or where the cladding materials described in Sentences (1) to (5) are installed on substrates other than those identified in Sentences (1) to (5), the materials and installation shall comply with Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cladding materials or systems other than those described in Sentences (1) to (5) are installed, or where these are installed on substrates other than those identified in Sentences (1) to (5), the cladding materials or systems and their installation shall comply with Part 5.

National Article Title: Minimizing and Preventing Ingress and Damage
National Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that precipitation ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and prevent the ingress of precipitation into interior space. (See Note A-9.27.2.1.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.2.1. Minimizing and Preventing Ingress and Damage
P/T Sentence Text: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to,(a) minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and (b) prevent ingress into interior space. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: First and Second Planes of Protection
National Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise cladding assemblies with first and second planes of protection, the first plane of protection shall consist of cladding with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by the kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences (see Subsection 9.27.4.), the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to (see Subsection 9.27.3.) intercept all rain and snow that gets past the first plane of protection, and effectively dissipate any rain or snow to the exterior, and the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.2.3. First and Second Planes of Protection
P/T Sentence Text: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise assemblies with first and second planes of protection,(a) the first plane of protection shall, (i) consist of cladding, with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and (ii) be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences, (b) the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to, (i) intercept all precipitation that gets past the first plane of protection, and (ii) effectively dissipate any precipitation to the exterior, and (c) the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at, (i) wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (ii) the interface with other wall assemblies.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane having an appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See
P/T Sentence Text: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane with appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: Except for cladding systems conforming to Subsection 9.27.13., the inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See
P/T Sentence Text: The inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with,(a) Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6., or (b) Subsection 9.27.13.

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: Flashing material and its installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7. and 9.27.3.8.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing material and installation shall comply with Articles 9.27.3.7. and 9.27.3.8.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.27.3.4. to 9.27.3.6., at least one layer of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath cladding.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.27.3.4. to 9.27.3.6., at least one layer of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath siding, stucco or masonry veneer.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3.(1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.
P/T Sentence Text: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least 2 layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Article 9.23.17.1. and Note A-9.27.3.5.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least two layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Appendix A.)

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.5.(1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing membrane.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing paper.

National Article Title: Sheathing Membranes in lieu of Sheathing
National Sentence Text: Wall sheathing is permitted to be used in lieu of one layer of sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1), and its thickness need not conform to Table 9.23.17.2.-A.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.5. Sheathing Membranes in Lieu of Sheathing
P/T Sentence Text: Wall sheathing is permitted to be used in lieu of one layer of sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1), and the thickness need not conform to Table 9.23.16.2.A.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentences 9.27.3.6.(2) or 9.27.3.6.(3), as applicable.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentence (2) or (3), as applicable.

National Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1), provided the cladding is applied so that all edges are directly supported by framing, the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and covered with battens, shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and shiplapped, or otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.
P/T Sentence Text: Cladding consisting of sheets of plywood, hardboard, OSB, waferboard or fibre cement is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence (1), provided the cladding is applied so that,(a) all edges are directly supported by framing, (b) the vertical joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and, (i) covered with battens, (ii) shiplapped, or (iii) otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints, and (c) the horizontal joints between adjacent sheets are sealed and, (i) shiplapped, or (ii) otherwise matched to provide weathertight joints.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, 0.46 mm thick copper, 0.46 mm thick zinc, 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or 1.02 mm thick vinyl.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall consist of not less than,(a) 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, (b) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (c) 0.46 mm thick copper, (d) 0.46 mm thick zinc, (e) 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or (f) 1.02 mm thick vinyl.

National Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence (1) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, where the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)), and the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the air space, or at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Clause 9.27.2.2.(1)(a)).
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence (1),(a) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, (b) where, (i) the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space, and (ii) the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize ingress of precipitation into the air space, or (c) at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where, (i) the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and (ii) the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space.

National Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing shall be installed over exterior wall openings where the vertical distance from the bottom of the eave to the top of the trim is more than one-quarter of the horizontal overhang of the eave. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall be a non-hardening type suitable for exterior use, selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and compatible with and adhere to the substrate to which they are applied. (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall be,(a) non-hardening types suitable for exterior use, (b) selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and (c) compatible with, and adhere to, the substrate to which they are applied. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to ASTM C 834-10 Latex Sealants ASTM C 920-14 Elastomeric Joint Sealants ASTM C 1184-13 Structural Silicone Sealants or ASTM C 1311-10 Solvent Release Sealants
P/T Sentence Text: Sealants shall conform to,(a) ASTM C834, "Latex Sealants", (b) ASTM C920, "Elastomeric Joint Sealants", (c) ASTM C1184, "Structural Silicone Sealants", or (d) ASTM C1311, "Solvent Release Sealants".

National Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C 1330, Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants. (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C1330, "Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2), (3) and (4), cladding shall be fastened to the framing members or furring members, or to blocking between the framing members.

National Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 12.5 mm plywood, or 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than,(a) 14.3 mm lumber, (b) 12.5 mm plywood, or (c) 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Vertically applied metal siding and wood shingles and shakes are permitted to be attached to the sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than 14.3 mm lumber, 7.5 mm plywood, or 7.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertically applied metal siding and wood shingles and shakes are permitted to be attached to the sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than,(a) 14.3 mm lumber, (b) 7.5 mm plywood, or (c) 7.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

National Sentence Text: Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., or 19 mm by 89 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., or (b) 19 mm by 89 mm on supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be securely fastened to the framing, and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be,(a) securely fastened to the framing, and (b) spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence 9.27.5.7.(1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence (1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.

National Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and not less than 12 mm thick at the butt for siding 184 mm or less in width, and 14.3 mm thick at the butt for siding wider than 184 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Bevel siding shall be,(a) not less than 5 mm thick at the top, and (b) not less than, (i) 12 mm thick at the butt for sidings 184 mm or less in width, and (ii) 14.3 mm thick at the butt for sidings wider than 184 mm.

National Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than 9.5 mm for matched siding, 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or 12 mm for vertical battens.
P/T Sentence Text: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than,(a) 9.5 mm for matched siding, (b) 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or (c) 12 mm for vertical battens.

National Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shingles shall be at least B (clear) grade, except that C grade may be used for the lower course of double course applications.
P/T Sentence Text: Eastern white cedar shakes shall be at least B (clear) grade, except that C grade may be used for undercoursing.

National Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset not less than 40 mm so that joints in any 2 of 3 consecutive courses are staggered.
P/T Sentence Text: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset at least 40 mm so that joints in any two of three consecutive courses are staggered.

National Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.

National Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.
P/T Sentence Text: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.

National Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.
P/T Sentence Text: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.

National Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood or CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood
P/T Sentence Text: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to,(a) ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood", (b) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (c) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", or (d) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood".

National Sentence Text: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood cladding shall be measured at the point of least thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood shall be measured at the point of least thickness.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 2 mm gap shall be provided between panels referred to in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the plywood joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the plywood joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence 9.27.8.4.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.8.5.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.5-M87 Hardboard, Precoated, Factory Finished, for Exterior Cladding
P/T Sentence Text: Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.5M, "Hardboard, Precoated, Factory-Finished, for Exterior Cladding".

National Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard cladding that is not factory finished shall conform to Types 1, 2 or 5 in CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard".

National Sentence Text: Type 5 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 9 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support or over furring or framing members spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Type 5 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 9.0 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support or over furring or framing members spaced not more than 406 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Note A-9.27.9.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be sealed or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be caulked or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence 9.27.9.4.(1) shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of siding board but not less than 9.5 mm for matched joint siding or 25 mm for lapped siding.
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence (1) shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of siding board but not less than 9.5 mm for matched joint siding or 25 mm for lapped siding.

National Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard cladding and door or window frames.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard siding and door or window frames.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade applied directly to framing or over furring strips shall conform to the thickness shown for plywood in Table 9.27.8.2. (See Note A-9.27.10.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-2 grade applied directly to framing or over furring strips shall conform to the thickness shown for plywood in Table 9.27.8.2. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where applied directly to framing or over furring strips, OSB conforming to O-1 grade and waferboard conforming to R-1 grade shall be not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Where applied directly to framing or over furring strips, OSB conforming to O-1 grade and waferboard conforming to R-1 grade shall be not less than,(a) 9.5 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., and (b) 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm gap shall be provided between sheets in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.10.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm gap shall be provided between sheets in cladding described in Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or sealant when the OSB and waferboard joints are not matched.
P/T Sentence Text: Vertical joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be protected with batten strips or caulking when the OSB and waferboard joints are not matched.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence 9.27.9.3.(1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal joints in cladding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 3 mm clearance shall be provided between OSB and waferboard cladding and door or window frames.
P/T Sentence Text: At least a 3 mm clearance shall be provided between OSB and waferboard cladding and door or window frames.

National Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical strip steel siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.4-92 Galvanized Steel and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Coated Steel Siding, Soffits and Fascia, Prefinished, Residential
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical strip steel siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.4, "Galvanized Steel and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Coated Steel Siding, Soffits and Fascia, Prefinished, Residential".

National Sentence Text: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.3-M91 Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use
P/T Sentence Text: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M, "Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use".

National Sentence Text: Aluminum sheet cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.1-M, Sheet, Aluminum Alloy, Prefinished, Residential, and shall have a thickness of not less than 0.58 mm, except that siding supported by backing or sheathing shall have a thickness of not less than 0.46 mm. (See Note A-9.27.11.1.(3) and (4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Aluminum sheet cladding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.1-M, "Sheet, Aluminum Alloy, Prefinished, Residential" and shall have a thickness of not less than 0.58 mm, except that siding supported by backing or sheathing shall have a thickness of not less than 0.46 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Vinyl siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-41.24-95 Rigid Vinyl Siding, Soffits and Fascia
P/T Sentence Text: Vinyl siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-41.24, "Rigid Vinyl Siding, Soffits and Fascia".

National Sentence Text: The attachment of vinyl siding shall conform to the requirements in part 9. for metal siding.
P/T Sentence Text: The attachment of vinyl siding shall conform to the requirements in Subsection 9.27.5. for metal siding.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to exterior insulation finish systems (EIFS) that are covered in the scope of CAN/ULC-S716.1, Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) - Materials and Systems, and have a geometrically defined drainage cavity with a minimum cavity depth of 10mm and an open area equal to not less than 13% of the area of a full-size EIFS panel. (See Note A-9.27.13.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to exterior insulation finish systems that,(a) are covered in the scope of CAN/ULC-S716.1, "Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) Ã¢â¬" Materials and Systems", and (b) have a geometrically defined drainage cavity with a minimum cavity depth of 6 mm and an open area equal to not less than 13% of the area of a full-size exterior insulation finish systems panel. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The substrate on which the EIFS is installed shall be compatible with that particular system (see Note A-9.27.13.2.(2)(a)), and comply with the structural requirements for sheathing materials stated in Section 9.23.
P/T Sentence Text: The substrate on which an exterior insulation finish system is installed shall,(a) be compatible with that particular system, and (See Appendix A.) (b) comply with the structural requirements for sheathing materials set out in Section 9.23.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of EIFS on the substrate described in Sentence 9.27.13.2.(2) shall comply with CAN/ULC-S716.2, Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) - Installation of EIFS Components and Water Resistive Barrier, and CAN/ULC-S716.3, Exterior Insulation and Finish System (EIFS) - Design Application.
P/T Sentence Text: The design of an exterior insulation finish system shall comply with CAN/ULC-S716.3, "Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) Ã¢â¬" Design Application".

National Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Where applied beneath stucco, sheathing shall conform to Subsection 9.23.16.

National Sentence Text: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001-13 Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete
P/T Sentence Text: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

National Sentence Text: Staples for stucco lath or reinforcing shall be not less than 1.98 mm diam or thickness.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for stucco lath reinforcing shall be not less than 1.98 mm diam or thickness.

National Sentence Text: Rib lath or expanded metal stucco mesh shall be copper-alloy steel coated with rust-inhibitive paint after fabrication, or galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Rib lath or expanded metal stucco mesh shall be,(a) copper-alloy steel coated with rust-inhibitive paint after fabrication, or (b) galvanized.

National Sentence Text: Sheathing need not be provided beneath stucco where not less than 1.19 mm diam galvanized wire is applied horizontally to the framing at vertical intervals of not more than 150 mm, or where paper-backed welded wire metal lath is used.
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing need not be provided beneath stucco where not less than 1.19 mm diam galvanized wire is applied horizontally to the framing at vertical intervals not exceeding 150 mm, or where paper-backed welded wire metal lath is used.

National Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence (2) are permitted to be used provided there are at least 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.
P/T Sentence Text: Nailing patterns other than those required in Sentence (2) are permitted to be used provided there are not fewer than 20 fasteners per square metre of wall surface.

National Sentence Text: Fasteners on horizontal surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along the framing members when members are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 100 mm o.c. along members when members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners on horizontal surfaces shall be spaced not more than, (a) 150 mm o.c. along the framing members when members are spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., and (b) 100 mm o.c. along members when members are spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

National Article Title: Number of Coats and Total Thickness
National Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied with at least 2 base coats and one finish coat, providing a total thickness of not less than 15 mm, measured from the face of the lath or the face of the masonry where no lath is used.
P/T Article Title: 9.28.6.2. Number of Coats and Total Thickness
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco shall be applied with at least two base coats and one finish coat, providing a total thickness of not less than 15Ã mm, measured from the face of the lath or face of the masonry where no lath is used.

National Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling finish shall also conform to the appropriate requirements in Sections 9. and part 9., in addition to the requirements in this Section.
P/T Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling finish shall also conform to the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.10. and 9.11. in addition to the requirements in this Section.

National Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than 1.8 m above the floor in shower stalls, 1.2 m above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.
P/T Sentence Text: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than,(a) 1 800 mm above the floor in shower stalls, (b) 1 200 mm above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and (c) 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.

National Sentence Text: Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSA A82.30-M1980 Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering
P/T Sentence Text: Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSAÃ A82.30-M, "Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering".

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board supporting insulation shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board supporting insulation shall be at least 12.7 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

National Sentence Text: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C 1002-07 Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs
P/T Sentence Text: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".

National Sentence Text: For single-layer application on a ceiling, nails shall be spaced not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: For single-layer application on ceilings, nails shall be spaced,(a) not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or (b) every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 9.29.5.8.(4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence (4), for single-layer application on walls, nails shall be spaced, (a) not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, or (b) every 300 mm o.c. along vertical wall supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

National Sentence Text: For single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates.
P/T Sentence Text: For single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board is required to provide bracing, lateral support or fire protection, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on,(a) vertical wall supports, and (b) top and bottom plates.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence (4), for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 400 mm o.c., or not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence (4), for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced, (a) not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 406 mm o.c., or (b) not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 406 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 9.10.3.1.-A, Sentence 9.29.5.9.(4) need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 1 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", Sentence (4) need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.
