National Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the edge of the board.
P/T Sentence Text: Screws shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.

National Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature not below 10Â°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h thereafter.
P/T Sentence Text: In cold weather, heat shall be provided to maintain a temperature of not below 10ÃÂ°C for 48 h prior to taping and finishing and maintained for not less than 48 h after that.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.6.1.(2) and 9.29.6.1.(3), the minimum thickness of plywood interior finish shall conform to Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the minimum thickness of plywood interior finish shall conform to TableÃ 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.29.6.2.(2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.

National Sentence Text: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.
P/T Sentence Text: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into the plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.

National Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard".

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 11.1 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard sheets shall be not less than 11.1 mm thick on supports not more than 406 mm o.c.

National Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
P/T Sentence Text: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard".

National Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: OSB or waferboard finish shall conform to,(a) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (b) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.29.9.2.(2) and 9.29.9.2.(3), the minimum thickness of O-2 grade OSB used as an interior finish shall conform to that shown for plywood in Table 9.29.6.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the minimum thickness of O-2 grade OSB used as an interior finish shall conform to that shown for plywood in Table 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: Thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Thickness listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm.

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be,(a) not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 406 mm o.c., (b) not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and (c) not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.9.3.(2), nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

National Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence 9.29.10.2.(1) shall be mixed with not less than 3 nor more than 5 parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: The cementitious material described in Sentence (1) shall be mixed with no fewer than three nor more than five parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.

National Sentence Text: The joints between wall tiles and a bathtub shall be suitably caulked with material conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-19.22-M89 Mildew-Resistant Sealing Compound for Tubs and Tiles
P/T Sentence Text: The joints between wall tiles and a bathtub or shower shall be suitably caulked with material conforming to CAN/CGSB-19.22-M, "Mildew Resistant Sealing Compound for Tubs and Tile".

National Sentence Text: Where water permeable finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls and laundry areas is supported by a subfloor of a type that would be damaged by water, such flooring shall be installed over a membrane with a water permeance not exceeding 18 ng/(Pa·s·m2) when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M, Water Vapor Transmission of Materials. (See Note A-9.30.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Finished flooring in bathrooms, kitchens, public entrance halls, laundry and general storage areas shall consist of resilient flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings, concrete, terrazzo, ceramic tile, mastic or other types of flooring providing similar degrees of water resistance. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring. (See Sentence 9.30.3.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported. (See Article 9.23.15.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting on panel-type subflooring whose edges are unsupported.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.3-M87 Hardboard HPVA ANSI/HPVA HP-1-2009 Hardwood and Decorative Plywood CSA O121-08 Douglas Fir Plywood CSA O151-09 Canadian Softwood Plywood CSA O153-13 Poplar Plywood or CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type underlay shall be not less than 6 mm thick and shall conform to,(a) ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard", (b) CAN/CGSB-11.3-M, "Hardboard", (c) ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood", (d) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (e) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (f) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", or (g) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

National Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and be not less than 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples for panel-type underlay shall, (a) have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and (b) be not less than, (i) 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and (ii) 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.

National Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset not less than 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, or OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset at least 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.

National Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no 2 adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than 2 supports.
P/T Sentence Text: If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no two adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than two supports.

National Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with not less than one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips more than 25 mm in width shall have at least 2 nails per strip.
P/T Sentence Text: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with at least one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips of more than 25 mm in width shall have at least two nails per strip.

National Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence 9.30.5.1.(1) shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.
P/T Sentence Text: Flooring described in Sentence (1) shall be attached to the base with a suitable waterproof and alkali-resistant adhesive.

National Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.15.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Panel-type subfloor to which ceramic tile is to be applied with adhesive shall have its edges supported according to Article 9.23.14.3.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to the plumbing facilities and plumbing systems within dwelling units.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Section applies to plumbing facilities and plumbing systems serving dwelling units.

National Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to part 3.
P/T Sentence Text: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to Subsection 3.7.5.

National Sentence Text: The construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems and sewage disposal systems shall conform to Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: The construction of plumbing systems shall conform to Part 7.

National Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with potablewater.
P/T Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with a water distribution system where a drinking water system is available.

National Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.
P/T Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit with a water distribution system, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.

National Sentence Text: A kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub or shower, and water closet shall be provided for every dwelling unit where a piped water supply is available.
P/T Sentence Text: A dwelling unit with a water distribution system shall contain,(a) a kitchen sink, (b) a lavatory, (c) a bathtub or shower stall, and (d) a water closet or a drainless composting toilet.

National Sentence Text: Where gravity drainage to a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Where hot water is required to be supplied in accordance with Article 9.31.4.2., equipment shall provide an adequate supply of hot water, and be installed in conformance with Part 7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a hot water supply is required by Article 9.31.4.3., equipment shall be installed to provide to every dwelling unit an adequate supply of service hot water with a temperature range from 45ÃÂ°C to 60ÃÂ°C.

National Sentence Text: Service water heaters shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the NPC.
P/T Sentence Text: Every service water heater and its installation shall conform to Part 7.

National Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are of steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Where storage tanks for service water heaters are steel, they shall be coated with zinc, vitreous enamel (glass lined), hydraulic cement or other corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Fuel-burning service water heaters shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to Section 9.21.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation of all other occupancies shall comply with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation of rooms and spaces in other than residential occupancies shall conform to Part 6.

National Sentence Text: A storage garage for up to 4 motor vehicles that serves a residential occupancy may be considered to be part of that occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: A storage garage for more than five cars shall be ventilated in accordance with Part 6.

National Sentence Text: Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with Subsection 9.32.2., and except as required by Sentences (2) and (3), if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: Every dwelling unit that is supplied with electrical power shall be provided with a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Subsection 9.32.3.

National Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Sentence (1), mechanical ventilation shall be provided to exhaust inside air from or to introduce outside air to that room or space at the rate of one-half air change per hour if the room or space is mechanically cooled in summer, and one air change per hour if it is not.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) accessible for cleaning, and (c) constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.

National Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.
P/T Sentence Text: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall,(a) be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, (b) include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and (c) where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.

National Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in residential buildings ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.2.
P/T Sentence Text: The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in a residential occupancy ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.1.

National Sentence Text: Screening shall be of corrosion-resistant material.
P/T Sentence Text: Screening shall be of rust-proof material.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to dwelling units that contain a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types, and ancillary spaces that contain an exhaust device, where the space is not within a dwelling unit in a house with a secondary suite and where the house with a secondary suite contains a fuel-fired space-heating appliance or fuel-fired water-heating appliance of other than direct-vented or mechanically vented types.
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of this Subsection, a dwelling unit shall be categorized as,(a) Type I when, (i) all fuel-fired combustion appliances serving the dwelling unit are direct vented or, except for fireplaces, are mechanically vented induced draft, and (ii) the dwelling unit is not served by a solid fuel-fired combustion appliance, (b) Type II when a solid fuel-fired combustion appliance serves a Type I dwelling unit, (c) Type III when a mechanically vented induced draft non-solid fuel-fired fireplace or a natural draft appliance is present, or (d) Type IV when electric space heating is present.

National Sentence Text: Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with Subsection 9.32.2., and except as required by Sentences (2) and (3), if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with Part 6.
P/T Sentence Text: The mechanical ventilation system required in Article 9.32.1.2. shall comply with,(a) Part 6, or (b) this Subsection for a mechanical ventilation system in a Type I, Type II or Type IV dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is mechanically cooled, its non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust air from inside the room or space, or to introduce outdoor air into that room or space, at a rate conforming with Table 9.32.2.3., or comply with Subsection 9.32.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum total ventilation capacity of the ventilation system required in Clause 9.32.3.2.(1)(b) shall be the sum of the individual room capacities given in Table 9.32.3.3.

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be capable of operating at an exhaust capacity complying with Table 9.32.3.3., referred to hereinafter as the normal operating exhaust capacity. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A principal exhaust fan shall be installed and shall be rated to provide not less than the capacity given in TableÃ 9.32.3.4.A.

National Sentence Text: Where the principal ventilation fan is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence (5), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
P/T Sentence Text: A principal exhaust fan required under this Article may be controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device where the manual switch required in Sentence (2) is capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is connected directly to the return side of the duct system of a forced air heating system or other forced air distribution system, it shall be connected, where applicable, not less than 1 m upstream from the connection of the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal exhaust fan is connected directly to the duct system of a forced air heating system or other central air circulating system, it shall,(a) be connected to the return air side of the system, and (b) be connected not less than 1 000 mm upstream from any outdoor air supply duct.

National Sentence Text: Exhaust air intakes for principal ventilation fans located in kitchens, bathrooms and water-closet rooms shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall not less than 2 m above the floor. (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(10).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal exhaust fan is located in the kitchen, it shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall within 300 mm of the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Where the intake for a supplemental exhaust fan other than a cooking appliance exhaust fan serving a cooktop is installed in a kitchen, it shall be installed in the ceiling or on the wall at not less than 2 m above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the intake for a supplemental exhaust fan, other than a cooking appliance exhaust fan serving a cooktop, is installed in a kitchen, it shall be installed in the ceiling or on the wall within 300 mm of the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the fan.
P/T Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the exhaust fan.

National Sentence Text: Where a kitchen or bathroom is exempted from the requirement to install a supplemental exhaust fan by virtue of Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2) or 9.32.3.7.(3), the principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the kitchen or bathroom and wired in parallel with the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by an exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence (2), the exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel.

National Sentence Text: Where a kitchen or bathroom is exempted from the requirement to install a supplemental exhaust fan by virtue of Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2) or 9.32.3.7.(3), the principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the kitchen or bathroom and wired in parallel with the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by a principal exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence (2), the principal exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel with the manual switch required in Sentence 9.32.3.4.(4).

National Sentence Text: Where a supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supplemental fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device in addition to the manual switch required by Sentences (5) to (7), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

National Article Title: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.6. Ventilation Systems Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to a mechanical ventilation system serving a house or an individual dwelling unit that contains a forced air heating system which is used for delivery of ventilation air.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Coupled With Forced Air Heating

National Article Title:
Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
Systems
National Sentence Text: Where outdoor air is to be introduced to the dwelling unit through means other than a forced air heating system, the provision of outdoor air shall comply with this Article.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: This Article applies to a mechanical ventilation system in a dwelling unit that,(a) does not contain a forced air heating system, or (b) contains a forced air heating system which is not used for circulation of the ventilation air.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.5.(11), outdoor air shall be distributed by a system of trunk and branch supply ducts, from the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2) to each bedroom, any storey, including basements and heated crawl spaces, without a bedroom, and if there is no storey without a bedroom, to the principal living area.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: Outdoor air shall be distributed by a ductwork system from the heat recovery ventilator required in Sentence (3) to each bedroom, to any storey without a bedroom and, if there is no storey without a bedroom, to the principal living area.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with balancing dampers that can be fixed in their adjusted positions, and include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with accessible dampers that can be adjusted and fixed in their adjusted positions and that include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to or from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.
P/T Article Title: 9.32.3.7. Ventilation Systems Not Coupled With Forced Air Heating
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.10.(4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C260-M90 Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment or HVI HVI Publication 916-2013 Airflow Test Procedure
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (4), capacity ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with,(a) CAN/CSA-C260-M, "Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment", or (b) HVI 916, "Airflow Test Procedure".

National Sentence Text: Sound ratings for fans shall be determined in accordance with CAN/CSA-C260-M, Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment, or HVI Publication 915, Loudness Testing and Rating Procedure.
P/T Sentence Text: Sound ratings for required fans shall be determined in accordance with,(a) CAN/CSA-C260-M, "Rating the Performance of Residential Mechanical Ventilating Equipment", or (b) HVI 915, "Loudness Testing and Rating Procedure".

National Sentence Text: Capacity ratings for fans shall be measured at the external static pressure differentials shown in Table 9.32.3.10.-A.
P/T Sentence Text: Capacity ratings for required fans shall be based on a static pressure differential of 50 Pa, 25 Pa or 7.5 Pa depending on whether the fan is installed with ductwork connected on both sides, one side or neither side, respectively.

National Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113, "Fans and Ventilators".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.11.(6), ventilation ducts and their fittings shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.33.6.2., except that exhaust ducts serving only a bathroom or water-closet room are permitted to be of combustible material, provided they are reasonably airtight and constructed of a material impervious to water.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation ducts shall conform to the requirements of Part 6 for supply ducts, except that exhaust ducts that serve only a bathroom or water closet room may be of combustible material provided the duct is reasonably airtight and constructed of a material impervious to water.

National Sentence Text: Where a duct carrying outdoor air that is not tempered and not mixed with indoor air passes through heated space, it shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5, and provided with a vapour barrier.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a duct carrying outdoor air that is not tempered or not mixed with indoor air passes through heated space, it shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5 except that, where such a duct is exposed in the heated space for more than 3 m of length in the heated space, it shall be,(a) insulated to not less than the values listed in Table 9.32.3.10.A., and (b) provided with a vapour barrier.

National Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, lead directly to the outdoors with no connections to other exhaust fans or ducts, and be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall, (a) be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, and (b) lead directly to the outdoors without connection to other exhaust fans or ducts.

National Sentence Text: All exhaust intakes located within 3 m horizontally of a cooktop shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake end.
P/T Sentence Text: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake.

National Sentence Text: All ductwork shall be installed to avoid crushing and shall be permanently supported to prevent sagging.
P/T Sentence Text: All ductwork shall be permanently supported or clipped to prevent sagging, excessive movement and vibration.

National Sentence Text: Joints in all ventilation system ducting shall be sealed with mastic, metal foil duct tape or the manufacturers specified sealants.
P/T Sentence Text: All ducting connected to supply and exhaust fans shall be constructed so as to inhibit air leakage at joints.

National Sentence Text: Where rectangular duct is used in place of round duct, it shall be selected according to Table 9.32.3.11.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Where rectangular duct is used in place of round duct, it shall be selected according to Table 9.32.3.10.B.

National Sentence Text: This Article shall apply to heat recovery ventilators installed to provide one or more of the fans required by this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a heat recovery ventilator is installed to provide all or part of the requirements of this Subsection, this Article shall apply.

National Sentence Text: Where a heat recovery ventilator is used to provide one or more required fans, it shall have a low-temperature ventilation reduction factor of not less than 50% when tested in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators at an outdoor temperature at least as low as the outdoor design temperature for the location where the ventilation system is to be installed, but the outdoor design temperature need not be lower than -25Â°C.
P/T Sentence Text: Heat recovery ventilators shall be designed to provide a minimum 55% sensible heat recovery efficiency when tested to the low temperature thermal and ventilation performance test method set out in CAN/CSA-C439, "Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators", at a Station 1 test temperature of Ã¢â¬"25ÃÂ°C at an air flow not less than 30 L/s.

National Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel airflow to a common air supply duct, unless specifically permitted by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel air flow to a common air supply duct unless specifically recommended by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors, in accordance with the manufacturersâ instructions.
P/T Sentence Text: Heat recovery ventilators installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors in exhaust air, in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.

National Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer, including air balancing and airflow determination, shall be followed.
P/T Sentence Text: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer including air balancing and air-flow determination shall be followed.

National Sentence Text: A means for the free flow of condensate shall be provided in accordance with the manufacturerâs recommendations or, in their absence, a condensate drain of at least 1/2 inch nominal pipe size pitched in the direction of flow and complete with a trap or condensate pump of sufficient capacity shall be installed and connected to the dwelling unitâs drain, waste and vent system.
P/T Sentence Text: Free flow of condensate shall be provided in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations or, in their absence, a condensate drain of minimum ÃÂ½ inch nominal pipe size pitched in the direction of flow and complete with a trap or condensate pump with sufficient capacity shall be installed.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
National Sentence Text: With the principal ventilation fan operating at its normal operating exhaust capacity, the airflow in the outdoor air supply duct shall be measured and the flow-regulating damper required by Sentence (6) shall be adjusted and permanently fixed so that the airflow in the outdo r air supply duct is within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan.
P/T Sentence Text: When operating at the rate required in Article 9.32.3.4., the supply and exhaust airflow rates of the heat recovery ventilator shall be balanced so that the value of the lesser flow shall be at least 90% of the value of the greater flow, unless otherwise recommended by the manufacturer.

National Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labeled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: Air intakes shall be clearly labelled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Screens, grilles and filters installed in air intake and exhaust openings shall be easily removable for cleaning purposes, without the need for special tools.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a screen or grille required by Sentences (8) and (10) has a screen mesh less than 6 mm, the screen or grille shall be removable for cleaning.

National Sentence Text: Where screens or grilles are installed in air intake and exhaust openings, the net free area of the air intake or exhaust opening shall be equal to or greater than the required cross-sectional area of the duct served or such openings shall comply with Table 9.32.3.13.
P/T Sentence Text: The net free area of an air intake or exhaust outlet shall be equal to or greater than the cross-sectional area of the duct served.

National Sentence Text: Except where mounted on concrete foundations, fans and heat recovery ventilators shall be isolated from structural components by resilient mountings to minimize the transmission of noise and vibration to occupied spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Installation of fans and heat recovery ventilators shall be in accordance with manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s instructions for minimizing noise and vibration transmission and achieving the required sound rating.
Variation Label: Installation - Fans and Heat Recovery Ventilators

National Sentence Text: Where flow-regulating dampers are required, they shall be adjustable and accessible without requiring the removal of fans, motors or insulating materials, or the use of specialized tools, and a device on the outside of the duct or device in which they are installed shall indicate the position of the damper.
P/T Sentence Text: Where flow-regulating dampers are required, they shall be adjustable and accessible without requiring the removal of fans, motors, or insulating materials and without the need for specialized tools.

National Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors, in accordance with the manufacturersâ instructions.
P/T Sentence Text: Ventilation equipment installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors in accordance with the manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s instructions.

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems other than those described in Sentence (1) shall conform to Part 6. (See Note A-9.33.1.1.(2) and Subsection 9.10.10.)
P/T Sentence Text: The design and installation of central heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, shall conform to Part 6 and this Section.

National Article Title: Design, Construction and Installation Standard for Solid-Fuel-Burning
National Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel-burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops, ovens and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment
P/T Sentence Text: The design, construction and installation, including the provision of combustion air, of solid-fuel burning appliances and equipment, including stoves, cooktops and space heaters, shall conform to CSA B365, "Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, heating and air-conditioning equipment with fuel or power connections shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement.

National Sentence Text: The required capacity of heating appliances located in a dwelling unit and serving only that dwelling unit, shall be determined in accordance with CSA F280, Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances, except that the design temperatures shall conform to Subsection 9.33.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The heating and cooling equipment capacities shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA F280, "Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances".

National Sentence Text: At the outside winter design temperature, required heating facilities shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of not less than 22Â°C in all living spaces, 18Â°C in unfinished basements, 18Â°C in common service rooms, ancillary spaces and exits in houses with a secondary suite, and 15Â°C in heated crawl spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: At the outside design temperature, required heating facilities shall be capable of maintaining an indoor air temperature of not less than,(a) 22ÃÂ°C in all living spaces, (b) 22ÃÂ°C in unfinished basements, and (c) 15ÃÂ°C in heated crawl spaces.

National Sentence Text: This Article applies to every building that contains a residential occupancy and that also contains a fuel-burning appliance, or a storage garage.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to every building that,(a) contains a residential occupancy, and (b) contains a fuel-burning appliance or a storage garage.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.

National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed,(a) adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the service room, and (b) in the service room.

National Sentence Text: For each suite of residential occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or built in, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide (CO) alarms required by this Article shall conform to CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the dwelling unit s electrical system, and be mechanically fixed at a height recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: A carbon monoxide alarm shall be mechanically fixed,(a) at the manufacturerÃ¢â¬â¢s recommended height, or (b) in the absence of specific instructions, on or near the ceiling.

National Sentence Text: Carbon monoxide (CO) alarms required by this Article shall conform to CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of CAN/CSA-6.19, Residential Carbon Monoxide Alarming Devices, have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the dwelling unit s electrical system, and be mechanically fixed at a height recommended by the manufacturer.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is not supplied with electrical power, carbon monoxide alarms are permitted to be battery operated.

National Sentence Text: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(2), a lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch shall be provided in kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, utility rooms, laundry rooms, dining rooms, bathrooms, water-closet rooms, vestibules and hallways in dwelling units.
P/T Article Title: 9.34.2.2. Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch shall be provided in kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, utility rooms, laundry rooms, dining rooms, bathrooms, water closet rooms, vestibules and hallways in a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units

National Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements in Sentence 9.34.2.2.(1).
P/T Article Title: 9.34.2.2. Lighting Outlets in Houses and Dwelling Units
P/T Sentence Text: Where a receptacle controlled by a wall switch is provided in bedrooms or living rooms, such rooms need not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.3.(3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with 4 or more risers in dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with four or more risers in a house or an individual dwelling unit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(3), outlets required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), lighting outlets required in Sentence (1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.

National Sentence Text: Where the outlet and fixture required in Sentence 9.34.2.6.(1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch accessible to an adult of average height is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the lighting outlet and fixture required in Sentence (1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch is permitted to be used.

National Sentence Text: Every public or service area in buildings shall be provided with lighting outlets with fixtures controlled by a wall switch or panel to illuminate every portion of such areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Every public or service area in buildings, including a recreational camp and a camp for housing of workers, shall have lighting outlets with fixtures controlled by a wall switch or panel to illuminate such areas.

National Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Emergency lighting shall conform to Subsection 9.9.12.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to garages and carports serving not more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to garages and carports serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
Variation Label: Garages and Carports serving house or individual dwelling unit

National Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60% of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a roofed enclosure used for the storage or parking of motor vehicles has more than 60 percent of the total perimeter enclosed by walls, doors or windows, the enclosure shall be considered a garage.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9. and 9. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9.12. and 9.15. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.

National Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on wood mud sills, or a 100 mm thick concrete floor slab.
P/T Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on,(a) wood mud sills, or (b) a concrete floor slab having a minimum thickness of not less than 100 mm.

National Article Title: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
National Sentence Text: In clay-type soils subject to significant movement with a change in soil moisture content, the foundation depth of carports or garages connected to a dwelling unit directly or by a breezeway shall be approximately the same depth as the main building foundation.
P/T Article Title: 9.35.3.2. Protection from Damage Due to Soil Movement
P/T Sentence Text: In clay-type soils subject to significant movement with a change in soil moisture content, the foundation depth of carports or garages connected to a house or an individual dwelling unit directly or by a breezeway shall be approximately the same depth as the foundation of the main building.
Variation Label: Protection from Damage Due to Soil Movement

National Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence 9.35.3.4.(1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Piers referred to in Sentence (1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.

National Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to part 9., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to Section 9.17., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.

National Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with part 9., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.
P/T Sentence Text: Garage or carport walls and columns shall be anchored to the foundation to resist wind uplift in conformance with Subsection 9.23.6., except that where a garage is supported on the surface of the ground, ground anchors shall be provided to resist wind uplift.

National Article Title: Requirements for Low to Moderate Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed as follows: exterior walls shall be clad with panel-type cladding in accordance with Section 9.27., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, fibreboard, gypsum board or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with Subsection 9.23.17. and fastened in accordance with Table 9.23.3.5.-A, or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of Section 9.29., or in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4. to 9.23.13.7., Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014, Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction.
Variation Label: Requirements for Low to Moderate Wind and Seismic Forces

National Article Title: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 9.23.13.1., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8 and the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction (see Note A-9.23.13.2.(1)(a)(i)), or the lowest exterior frame wall supports not more than 2 floors in other types of construction, and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is less than 1.20 kPa.
Variation Label: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces

National Article Title: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces
National Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles 9.23.13.4. to 9.23.13.7., Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014, Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction.
Variation Label: Requirements for High Wind and Seismic Forces

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Articles 9.23.13.1. and 9.23.13.2., this Article applies in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8, greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior framewall supports more than 2 floors in buildings of light construction, or greater than 0.70 and the lowest exterior framewall supports more than 1 floor in buildings of heavy construction, or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.20 kPa.

Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Part 4, or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014, Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction.

Braced wall bands shall be full storey height, be not more than 1.2 m wide, lap at both ends with another braced wall band, be aligned with braced wall bands on storeys above and below, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.
The perimeter of the building shall be located within braced wall bands.
For split-level buildings, a braced wall band shall be located where there is a change in floor level greater than the depth of one floor joist.

National Article Title: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (5) and Article 9.23.13.7., braced wall panels shall be located within braced wall bands, extend, as applicable, from the top of the supporting footing, slab or subfloor to the underside of the floor, ceiling or roof framing above, and conform to the spacing and dimensions given in Table 9.23.13.5.
Variation Label: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

National Article Title: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
National Sentence Text: Walls in detached garages and in accessory buildings serving a single dwelling unit, and the front wall of attached garages serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence (1) where these walls do not support a floor
Variation Label: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

National Article Title: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
National Sentence Text: Braced wall panels in the braced wall band at the front of an attached garage serving a single dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence (1), provided the maximum spacing between the front of the garage and the back wall of the garage does not exceed 7.6 m, there is not more than one floor above the garage, not less than 50% of the length of the back wall of the garage is constructed of braced wall panels, and not less than 25% of the length of the side walls is constructed of braced wall panels.
Variation Label: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board interior finish shall not be considered as an acceptable sheathing material to provide the required bracing in exterior walls. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5) and (6).)
At braced wall band spacing intervals of not more than 15 m, braced wall panels shall be constructed with OSB, plywood or diagonal lumber. (See Note A-9.23.13.6.(5) and (6).)

Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), one exterior wall of the uppermost storey in each orthogonal direction may be set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, provided the adjacent interior braced wall band of the storey below the setback is spaced not more than 10.6 m from the exterior wall of the storey below the setback wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2), extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals of not more than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6)

Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the roof and floor space supporting the setback wall shall be sheathed with a wood-based material between the exterior wall of the storey below the setback and the adjacent interior braced wall bands of the storey below the setback.

Where the exterior wall of the uppermost storey is set back from the exterior wall of the storey below, the exterior walls perpendicular to the setback wall shall have their top plate connected with nails that are spaced at no greater than half the spacing required in Table 9.23.3.4., and have their top plate splices fastened with twice the number of nails specified in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(4) and (5).

The maximum distance between adjacent required braced wall panels in a braced wall band, measured from the edge of the panels, may be increased to 7.3 m provided that, throughout the height of the building, the length of any braced wall panel within the braced wall band is not less than 1.2 m.

The maximum distance between adjacent required braced wall panels in a braced wall band, measured from the edge of the panels, may be increased to 7.3 m provided that, throughout the height of the building, the length of any braced wall panel within the braced wall band is not less than 1.2 m.

For each orthogonal direction of the building, the length of required braced wall panels of one exterior wall given in Table 9.23.13.5. may be reduced from 40% to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, provided an additional parallel and adjacent interior braced wall band is constructed that is spaced not more than 10.6mfromthe exterior wall, consists of braced wall panels that are constructed of a wood-based material in conformance with Sentence 9.23.13.6.(2) and whose lengths sum to no less than 25% of the length of the braced wall band, extends to the foundation, and is not taken into consideration when providing braced wall panels constructed of a wood-based material at spacing intervals no greater than 15 m as per Sentence 9.23.13.6.(6).

Where the length of required braced wall panels of an exterior wall is reduced as described in Sentence (6), the ratio of the length of braced wall panels in the respective upper braced wall bands to the length of braced wall panels in the reduced exterior braced wall band shall not exceed 2.

National Article Title: Design of Guards to Not Facilitate Climbing
National Sentence Text: Except for guards in industrial occupancies, guards required by Article 9.8.8.1. that protect a level located more than 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm abovethe level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)
P/T Article Title:
9.8.8.6.
Guards Designed Not to Facilitate Climbing
P/T Sentence Text: Guards required by Article 9.8.8.1., except those in industrial occupancies and where it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not represent a hazard, shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the floor or walking surface protected by the guard will facilitate climbing.
Variation Label: Design of Guards to Not Facilitate Climbing

National Article Title: Floor Area Limits for Secondary Suites
National Sentence Text: The total floor area of all storeys of a secondary suite shall be not more than the lesser of 80% of the total floor area of all storeys of the other dwelling unit, excluding the garage floor area and common spaces serving both dwelling units, and 80 m2.
Variation Label: Floor Area Limits for Secondary Suites

National Sentence Text: Walls shall be designed to resist the lateral pressure of the retained material.

The barrier-free path of travel on the entrance level described in Sentence (1) need not be provided where the difference in floor elevation between the entrance level and every dwelling unit exceeds 600 mm.

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Ceiling heights in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.95 m.
Variation Label: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces

National Sentence Text: Doorway openings within secondary suites shall be designed to accommodate swing-type and folding doors not less than 1 890 mm high where the ceiling height complies with Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2).

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.
Variation Label: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights

National Sentence Text: Only one set of winders described in Article 9.8.4.6. shall be permitted between floor levels.
P/T Sentence Text: Where more than one set of winders described in Sentence (1) is provided in a single stairway between adjacent floor levels, such winders shall be separated in plan by at least 1 200 mm.

National Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum extension of the rounded or beveled edge required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: If resilient material is used to cover the nosing of a stair tread, the minimum radius or bevel required by Sentence (8) is permitted to be reduced to 3 mm.

National Sentence Text: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
The occupant load for dwelling units shall be based on 2 persons per bedroom or sleeping area.
P/T Sentence Text: (1) The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area, or of a building or part of a building not having a floor area, shall be based on, (a)	two persons per sleeping room or sleeping area in a dwelling unit or suite, and(b) for occupancies other than as described in Clause (a), the number of persons, (i) for which the area is designed, or (ii) determined from Table 3.1.17.1.

National Sentence Text: Where a dwelling unit is located above another dwelling unit or common space in a house with a secondary suite, the upper dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from that dwelling unit opens onto an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, is served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and is located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

Children s custodial homes and convalescent homes for ambulatory occupants living as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling unit with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies (Group C).

The space above a mezzanine conforming to Sentence (2) is permitted to include an enclosed space whose area does not exceed 10% of the open area of the room in which the mezzanine is located, provided the enclosed space does not obstruct visual communication between the open space above the mezzanine and the room in which it is located.

For the purpose of determining occupant load, the areas of mezzanines that are not considered as storeys shall be added to the floor area of the storey on which they are located. (See Note A-9.10.4.1.(4).)

Platforms and catwalks intended solely for periodic inspection and maintenance need not be considered as floor assemblies or mezzanines for the purpose of calculating building height, provided they are not used for storage, and they are constructed with noncombustible materials, unless the building is permitted to be of combustible construction.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches
National Sentence Text: Light-frame walls, columns, arches and beams as well as loadbearing steel elements that support floors between dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board. (See Note A-9.10.8.3.(2).)
Variation Label: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a smoke-tight barrier shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of smoke.

All gypsum board joints in the assemblies described in Sentences (1) and (2) shall conform to CSA A82.31-M, Gypsum Board Application, and penetrations in these assemblies shall be sealed using flexible sealant or tape to maintain the integrity of the smoke-tight barrier over the entire surface.

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Doors in smoke-tight barriers shall be solid-core, wood doors at least 45 mm thick, and have a self-closing device. (See Note A-9.10.9.3.(2).)
Variation Label: Openings to be Protected with Closures

National Sentence Text: Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3.(2) for closures.)

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Where interior walls between dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite are not constructed as fire separations, the exteriorwall of each dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space referred to in Sentence (1) within the 1.2 m distance shall be finished on the interior with not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
Variation Label: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle

National Sentence Text: Smoke alarms in a house with a secondary suite shall be wirelessly interconnected or interconnected by hard-wiring so that the activation of any one smoke alarm causes all smoke alarms within the house with a secondary suite to sound. (See Note A-9.10.19.5.(2).)

Where decks or other accessible exterior platforms are supported on surface foundations supported on other than coarse-grained soil with good drainage or rock, access to the foundation positions to permit re-levelling of the platform shall be provided by passageways with a clear height under the platform of not less than 600 mm and a width of not less than 600 mm, or by installing the decking in a manner that allows easy removal.

This Subsection applies to wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground, and the rough-in to allow the future protection of conditioned space that is separated from the ground by a wall, roof or floor assembly.
This Subsection addresses the leakage of soil gas from the ground into the building.

National Article Title: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization
National Sentence Text: Floors-on-ground shall be provided with a rough-in for subfloor depressurization consisting of a gas-permeable layer, an inlet and an outlet as described in Sentence (2), or clean granular material and a pipe as described in Sentence (3).
Variation Label: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization

National Article Title: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization
National Sentence Text: The rough-in referred to in Clause (1)(b) shall include clean granular material installed below the floor-on-ground in accordance with Sentence 9.16.2.1.(1), and a pipe not less than 100 mm in diameter installed through the floor, such that its bottom end opens into the granular layer required Clause (a) at or near the centre of the floor and not less than 100 mm of granular material projects beyond the terminus of the pipe measured along its axis (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2)(b) and (3)(b)(i)), its top end permits connection to depressurization equipment and is provided with an airtight cap, and the pipe is clearly labeled near the cap and, if applicable, every 1.8 m and at every change in direction to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.
Variation Label: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization

National Article Title: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
National Sentence Text: All penetrations of the ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall be sealed against air leakage. (See Subsection 9.25.3.)
Variation Label: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces

National Sentence Text: Chimneys and flue pipes other than those described in Sentences (1) and (2) shall conform to Section 6.3.

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance
National Sentence Text: The connection referred to in Sentence (2) for a liquid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below any connections for appliances burning natural gas or propane.
Variation Label: Connections of More Than One Appliance

National Sentence Text: Where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa, roof rafters, joists or trusses shall be tied to the wall framing with connectors that will resist a factored uplift load of 3 kN.

Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-B, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 0.90, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 and not more than 0.90.

Fastening of roof sheathing and sheathing in required braced wall panels shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.-C, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa and less than 1.2 kPa and the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not more than 1.8, or the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.90 and not more than 1.8.

Fastening of sheathing shall conform to Part 4, where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 1.2 kPa, or for required braced wall panels, where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 1.8.

For buildings supported by frame walls that are in areas where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not greater than 1.8 and the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure (HWP) is not greater than 1.20 kPa, anchorage shall be provided by fastening the sill plate to the foundation with not less than two anchor bolts per braced wall panel located within 0.5 m of the end of the foundation and spaced in accordance with Table 9.23.6.1.

Anchor bolts referred to in Sentences (2) to (4) shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers, embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation, and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.
P/T Sentence Text: Anchor bolts referred to in Sentence (2) shall be fastened to the sill plate with nuts and washers and shall be embedded not less than 100 mm in the foundation and so designed that they may be tightened without withdrawing them from the foundation.

National Sentence Text: Loadbearing and non-loadbearing walls constructed with required braced wall panels shall be continuously supported by floor joists, blocking or rim joists to allow for the required fastening (see Table 9.23.3.4.).

Where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not more than 1.8, doubled top plates in braced wall bands shall be fastened on each side of a splice with 76 mm long common steel wire nails or spiral nails in accordance with Table 9.23.11.4.

National Article Title: Air Leakage Control in Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: The masonry course or flashing described in Sentence (1) shall be located at the level of the adjoining floor and be sealed to it in accordance with Article 9.25.3.6., or in the absence of a floor, be located at the level of the ground cover required by Article 9.18.6.1. and be sealed to it.
Variation Label: Air Leakage Control in Masonry Walls

National Sentence Text: Where plywood finish provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the plywood shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).

Where OSB or waferboard provides required bracing in braced wall panels, the OSB or waferboard shall be fastened in accordance with the fastening requirements for sheathing stated in Sentence 9.23.3.5.(2).

Panel-type underlay under ceramic tile applied with adhesive shall be not less than 6 mm thick where the supports are spaced up to 300 mm o.c., and 11 mm thick where the supports are spaced wider than 300 mm o.c.
Systems used for service water heating shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.

Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.

A non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall be designed and installed in conformance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.

Aspects of mechanical ventilation systems not specifically described in this Subsection shall be designed, constructed and installed in accordance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the HRAI Residential Mechanical Ventilation Manual, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.

Ventilation system equipment installed to meet the requirements of this Section shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturers instructions and recommendations except that, where such instructions and recommendations are in conflict with the requirements of this Subsection, the requirements of this Subsection shall govern.
Ventilation equipment shall be accessible for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning.

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply fan shall be installed with a rated capacity within ±10% of the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the exhaust fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: The outdoor air supply fan shall be connected to the outdoors through an outdoor air supply duct.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: Any tempering device installed to comply with Sentence (8) shall be installed in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1. and 9.33.5.2.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit in which there is no storey without a bedroom, if an exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in the principal living area and the principal ventilation fan has no more than 2 exhaust air intakes located in other rooms, distribution of outdoor air to the principal living area is not required.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Article Title: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
National Sentence Text: The air supply outlets through which outdoor air is delivered to the rooms shall be located in the ceiling or in a wall at not less than 2 m above the floor and shall be designed and installed to promote diffusion across the ceiling.
Variation Label: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air

National Sentence Text: The outdoor makeup air required by Sentence (2) shall be introduced to a normally unoccupied area in the dwelling unit, or tempered to at least 12°C before being introduced to occupied areas or to a supply duct system.

If the outdoor makeup air required by Sentence (2) is not tempered upstream of the supply fan, the supply fan required by Sentence (2) shall be approved by the manufacturer for the handling of untempered outdoor air.

The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence (2) is not required in a dwelling unit with solid-fuel-burning appliances, where all other fuel-fired appliances are direct-vented or mechanically vented.
