The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence (2) is not required if it can be shown using the test procedures in CAN/CGSB-51.71, Depressurization Test, that the maximum depressurization levels to which fuel-fired space- or water-heating appliances and their venting systems will be exposed will not exceed the limits set out in CAN/CGSB-51.71 for the categories of fuel-fired appliances and venting systems installed in the dwelling unit.
A storage garage for up to 4 motor vehicles that serves a residential occupancy may be considered to be part of that occupancy.
Systems used for ventilation shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in Section 9.36.

Wires or cableswithin plenum spaces that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm, security, radio, and television broadcasting, closed circuit television or community television systems need not meet the requirements of Sentence (2).

This Section is concerned with the energy used by buildings as a result of the design and construction of the building envelope, and the design and construction or specification of systems and equipment for heating, ventilating or air-conditioning, and service water heating. (See Note A-9.36.1.1.(1).)
The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to Table 9.4.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to Table 9.4.3.1

National Sentence Text: The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to Table 9.6.1.3.-G.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to Table 9.6.1.3.G

National Sentence Text: Materials used for flashing shall conform to Table 9.20.13.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Materials used for flashing shall conform to Table 9.20.13.1.

National Sentence Text: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.

National Sentence Text: When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2.
P/T Sentence Text: When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.

National Sentence Text: Wood furring for the attachment of wall and ceiling finishes shall conform to Table 9.29.3.1.
P/T Sentence Text: Wood furring for the attachment of wall and ceiling finishes shall conform to Table 9.29.3.1.

National Sentence Text: A manufacturing tolerance of  0.4 mm may be applied to the thicknesses
P/T Sentence Text: A manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm may be applied to the thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1.

National Sentence Text: When other types of lighting are used, illumination equivalent to that shown in Table 9.34.2.7. shall be provided.
P/T Sentence Text: When other types of lighting are used, illumination equivalent to that shown in Table 9.34.2.7. shall be provided.

National Sentence Text: Except for buildings that are sprinklered and for openable windows having an unobstructed opening equal to 0.35 m2 installed in accordance with Sentences 9.9.10.1.(1) and (2), where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual unprotected openings shall be no greater than the area stated in Table 9.10.14.4.-B, or where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 1.2 m, the area calculated by where Area = area of the unprotected opening, and LD = limiting distance.

National Article Title:
Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
Systems
National Sentence Text: Where the actual normal operating exhaust capacity of the fan installed to satisfy the requirement for a principal ventilation fan exceeds the maximum outdoor airflow permitted by Table 9.32.3.4. for a mixed air temperature of 15°C or exceeds the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, then either the system shall incorporate a means for tempering outdoor air introduced to the heating system ducts so that a mixed air temperature of 15°C or the minimum acceptable return air temperature specified by the manufacturer of the furnace, whichever is less, is achieved when the outdoor air is at the January 2.5% temperature and the indoor air temperature is 22°C, or this Article shall be considered to be no longer applicable and the mechanical ventilation system shall comply with either Clause 9.32.3.1.(1)(a) or with Article 9.32.3.5.
Variation Label:
Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
Systems

National Sentence Text: except where the size of a duct can be determined using Table 9.32.3.11.-A or Table 9.32.3.11.-B, duct sizes shall be determined according to Subsection 9.33.4.

National Article Title: Galvanized Steel or Aluminum Supply Ducts
National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel or aluminum supply ducts shall conform to Table 9.33.6.5.
Variation Label: Galvanized Steel or Aluminum Supply Ducts

National Sentence Text: Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to Table 9.33.8.3.
Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.
P/T Sentence Text: Every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.

National Sentence Text: A combined building drain shall not be installed. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: A combined building drain or a combined building sewer shall not be installed.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewer, a public combined sewer or a designated storm water disposal location.
P/T Sentence Text: Every storm drainage system shall be connected to a public storm sewage works, a public combined sewage works or a designated storm water disposal location but shall not be connected to a sanitary sewage works.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 2.7.4., every water distribution system shall be connected to a public water main or a potable private water supply system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every water distribution system shall be connected,(a) to a watermain that is part of a municipal drinking water system, or (b) to a drinking water system, if a watermain described in Clause (a) is not available.

National Sentence Text: Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), piping in any building shall be connected to the public services separately from piping of any other building. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Piping in any building connected to the public services shall be connected separately from piping of any other building, except that an ancillary building on the same property may be served by the same service. (See Note A-2.1.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: An ancillary building on the same property as the main building may be served by the same service.

National Sentence Text: Every fixture, appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be located so that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.
P/T Sentence Text: Every fixture, plumbing appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be so located that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.

National Sentence Text: Where unusual conditions exist, such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where unusual conditions exist such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.

National Sentence Text: (1) Every length of pipe and every fitting shall have cast, stamped or indelibly marked on it the maker's name or mark and the weight or class or quality of the product, or be marked in accordance with the relevant standard. (2) Markings required in Sentence 2.2.1.3.(1) shall be visible after installation.
P/T Sentence Text: Every length of pipe and every fitting shall have cast, stamped or indelibly marked on it the maker s name or mark and the weight or class or quality of the product, or it shall be marked in accordance with the relevant standard, and such markings shall be visible after installation.

National Article Title: Working Pressure of a Water Service Pipe
National Sentence Text: The working pressure rating of a water service pipe shall not be less than the maximum water main pressure at their point of connection as established by the water supply authority.

Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.2 / CSA B45.1, "Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Enamelled cast iron fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.1 / CSA B45.2, "Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Porcelain enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.1 / CSA B45.2, "Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.3 / CSA B45.4, "Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

P/T Sentence Text: Plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5 / IAPMO Z124, "Plastic Plumbing Fixtures".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME A112.19.7 / CSA B45.10, "Hydromassage Bathtub Systems".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.2.2.3., fixtures shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B45 Series-02 Plumbing Fixtures vitreous china fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.2-2013/CSA B45.1-13 Ceramic Plumbing Fixtures enamelled cast-iron fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures porcelain-enamelled steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.1-2013/CSA B45.2-13 Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.3-2017/CSA B45.4-17 Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5-11/IAPMO Z124-2011 Plastic Plumbing Fixtures hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.19.7-2012/CSA B45.10-12 Hydromassage Bathtub Systemsand macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.3.4-2013/CSA B45.9-13 Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME A112.3.4 / CSA B45.9, "Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems".

National Sentence Text: Shower receptors shall be constructed and arranged so that water cannot leak through the walls or floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Shower receptors shall be constructed and arranged so that water cannot leak through the walls or floor.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 or more shower heads are served by a shower drain, the floor shall be sloped and the drain located so that water from one head cannot flow over the area that serves another head. (See Note A-2.2.2.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where two or more shower heads are served by a shower drain, the floor shall be sloped and the drain located so that water from one head cannot flow over the area that serves another head.

National Sentence Text: Except for column showers, when a battery of shower heads is installed, the horizontal distance between 2 adjacent shower heads shall be not less than 750 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for column showers, when a battery of shower heads is installed, the horizontal distance between two adjacent shower heads shall be at least 750 mm.

National Sentence Text: A dishwashing sink and a food preparation sink shall not have concealed overflows. (See Note A-2.2.2.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A dishwashing sink and a food preparation sink shall not have concealed overflows.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided for in Sentence 2.2.3.1.(2), traps shall have a trap seal depth of not less than 38 mm, be so designed that failure of the seal walls will cause exterior leakage, and have a water seal that does not depend on the action of moving parts.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided for in Sentence (2), every trap shall,(a) have a trap seal depth of at least 38 mm, (b) be so designed that failure of the seal walls will cause exterior leakage, and (c) have a water seal that does not depend on the action of moving parts.

National Sentence Text: A bell trap shall not be installed in a drainage system. (See Note A-2.2.3.1.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: A bell trap or an S-trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: A drum trap shall not be used as a fixture trap unless required to serve as an interceptor and access for servicing is provided.
P/T Sentence Text: A drum trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be designed so that they do not become air bound, and not have a water jacket.
P/T Sentence Text: Every grease interceptor shall be designed so that it does not become air bound.

National Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be selected and installed in conformance with CSA B481.0 Material, Design, and Construction Requirements for Grease Interceptors and CSA B481.3 Sizing, Selection, Location, and Installation of Grease Interceptors
P/T Sentence Text: Grease interceptors shall be selected and installed in conformance with,(a) CSA B481.0, "Material, Design, and Construction Requirements for Grease Interceptors", and (b) CSA B481.3, "Sizing, Selection, Location, and Installation of Grease Interceptors".

National Sentence Text: A T fitting shall not be used in a drainage system, except to connect a vent pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: A T fitting shall not be used in a drainage system except to connect a vent pipe.

National Sentence Text: A single or double sanitary T fitting shall not be used in a nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe, except that a single sanitary T fitting may be used to connect a vent pipe.
A double sanitary T fitting shall not be used to connect the trap arms of back outlet water closets installed back-to-back, or 2 urinals where no cleanout fitting is provided above the connection.
P/T Sentence Text: A double sanitary T fitting shall not be used to connect the fixture drains of two urinals where no cleanout fitting is provided above the connection.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 2.2.4.3.(2), 90° elbows of 4 inch size or less whose centre-line radius is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join 2 soil-or-waste pipes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less that have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join two soil or waste pipes.

National Sentence Text: For sanitary drainage systems of 4 inch size or less, 90° elbows described in Sentence 2.2.4.3.(1) shall only be permitted to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, where a trap arm enters a wall, or to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 2.5.6.3.(2).
P/T Sentence Text: ° elbows of 4 in. size or less in sanitary drainage systems may be used,(a) to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, (b) where a trap arm enters a wall, or (c) to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 7.5.6.3.(2).

National Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall conform to CSA A257.1 Non-Reinforced Circular Concrete Culvert, Storm Drain, Sewer Pipe, and Fittings or CSA A257.2 Reinforced Circular Concrete Culvert, Storm Drain, Sewer Pipe, and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall conform to CSA A257 Series, "Standards for Concrete Pipe and Manhole Sections".

National Sentence Text: Joints with internal elastomeric gaskets shall conform to CSA A257.3-14 Joints for Circular Concrete Sewer and Culvert Pipe, Manhole Sections, and Fittings Using Rubber Gaskets
Concrete fittings fabricated on the site from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Note A-2.2.5.1.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete fittings field fabricated from lengths of pipe shall not be used. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Concrete pipe shall not be used above ground inside a building.

National Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall conform to CSA A60.1-M Vitrified Clay Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall be certified to CSA A60.1-M, "Vitrified Clay Pipe".

National Sentence Text: Couplings and joints for vitrified clay pipe shall conform to CSA A60.3-M Vitrified Clay Pipe Joints
P/T Sentence Text: Couplings and joints for vitrified clay pipe shall be certified to CSA A60.3-M, "Vitrified Clay Pipe Joints".

National Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe, tubing and fittings shall conform to Series 160 of CSA B137.1 Polyethylene (PE) Pipe, Tubing, and Fittings for Cold-Water Pressure Services
P/T Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe, tubing and fittings shall be certified to, and have a pressure rating meeting the requirements of, Series 160 or a higher series of CSA B137.1, "Polyethylene (PE) Pipe, Tubing and Fittings for Cold Water Pressure Services".

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.2.5.7.(1), polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.

National Sentence Text: Butt fusion fittings for polyethylene pipe shall conform to ASTM D 3261 Butt Heat Fusion Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Fittings for Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe and Tubing
P/T Sentence Text: Butt fusion fittings for polyethylene pipe shall conform to ASTM D3261, "Butt Heat Fusion Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Fittings for Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe and Tubing".

National Sentence Text: Crosslinked polyethylene pipe and its associated fittings used in hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.5, Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX) Tubing Systems for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Crosslinked polyethylene pipe and its associated fittings used in hot and cold potable water systems shall be certified to CSA B137.5, "Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX) Tubing Systems for Pressure Applications"..

National Sentence Text: PVC water pipe, fittings and solvent cement shall conform to CSA B137.3 Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications and have a pressure rating of not less than 1 100 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: PVC water pipe, fittings and solvent cement shall be certified to CSA B137.3, "Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications" or CSA B137.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications", and have a minimum pressure rating of 1 100 kPa.

National Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings referred to in Sentences 2.2.5.6.(1), 2.2.5.6.(2) and 2.2.5.6.(3) shall not be used in a hot water system.
P/T Sentence Text: PVC water pipe and fittings in Sentence (1) shall not be used in a hot water system.

National Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
National Sentence Text: CPVC hot and cold water pipe, fittings and solvent cements shall conform to CSA B137.6 Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Pipe, Tubing, and Fittings for Hot- and Cold-Water Distribution Systems
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.9. CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
P/T Sentence Text: CPVC hot and cold water pipe, fittings and solvent cements shall be certified to CSA B137.6, "Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Pipe, Tubing and Fittings for Hot and Cold Water Distribution Systems".

National Article Title: CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
National Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 2.2.5.7.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.9. CPVC Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cements
P/T Sentence Text: The design temperature and design pressure of a CPVC piping system shall conform to Table 7.2.5.9.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside or under a building in a drainage or venting system shall conform to ASTM F 628 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside or under a building in a sanitary drainage system or venting system shall be certified to,(a) ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core", (b) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.19.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(3) to (11), and Articles 3.1.9.5. and 9.10.9.7. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.16.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(2) to (8) and Articles 3.1.9.4. and 9.10.9.7.

National Article Title: Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
National Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire stop, the requirements of fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. of Division B of the NBC shall apply.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.12. Plastic Pipe, Fittings and Solvent Cement Used in Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire block, the requirements for fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. shall apply.

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE composite pipe and fittings shall conform to CSA B137.9 Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene (PE-AL-PE) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems (See Note A-2.2.5.11.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE composite pipe and fittings used for potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.9, "Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene (PE-AL-PE) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82°C shall be permitted for hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be permitted in a hot water system.

National Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82°C shall be used with fittings that conform to CSA B137.10 Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems in hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be used with fittings that conform to CSA B137.10, "Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems", in a hot water system.

National Sentence Text: PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe and fittings used in hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.10, Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems (See Note A-2.2.5.12.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 7.2.5.14. Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene Composite Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe and fittings used for potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.10, "Crosslinked Polyethylene/Aluminum/Crosslinked Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) Composite Pressure-Pipe Systems".

National Article Title: Cast-Iron Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Drainage piping, vent piping and fittings made of cast iron shall conform to CSA B70, Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.1. Cast Iron Frames, Covers, Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Drainage piping, vent piping and fittings made of cast iron shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings and Means of Joining".

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron frames and covers for maintenance holes and catch basins shall conform to CSA B70.1, Frames and Covers for Maintenance Holes and Catchbasins
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.1. Cast Iron Frames, Covers, Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron frames and covers for maintenance holes and catch basins shall conform to CAN/CSA-B70.1, "Frames and Covers for Maintenance Holes and Catchbasins".

National Sentence Text: Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall conform to ASME B16.12, Cast Iron Threaded Drainage Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded cast iron drainage fittings shall conform to ASME B16.12, "Cast Iron Threaded Drainage Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Cement mortar lining for cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C104/A21.4, Cement-Mortar Lining for Ductile-Iron Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cement-mortar lining for cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C104 / A21.4, "Cement-Mortar Lining for Ductile-Iron Pipe and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron fittings for cast-iron or ductile-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C110/A21.10, Ductile-Iron and Gray-Iron Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron fittings for cast iron or ductile-iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C110 / A21.10, "Ductile-Iron and Gray-Iron Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Rubber gasket joints for cast-iron and ductile-iron pressure pipe for water shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C111/A21.11, Rubber-Gasket Joints for Ductile-Iron Pressure Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Rubber gasket joints for cast iron and ductile-iron pressure pipe for water piping shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C111 / A21.11, "Rubber-Gasket Joints for Ductile-Iron Pressure Pipe and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.4, Gray Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.4, "Gray Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.3, Malleable Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 150 and 300
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.3, "Malleable Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 150 and 300".

National Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.6.7.(2) and 2.2.6.7.(3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe is permitted to be used in a drainage system or a venting system above ground inside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe may be used in a drainage system or a venting system above ground inside a building.

National Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe and couplings shall conform to CSA G401 Corrugated Steel Pipe Products
P/T Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe and couplings shall be certified to CAN/CSA-G401, "Corrugated Steel Pipe Products".

National Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe shall only be used underground outside a building in a storm drainage system
P/T Sentence Text: Corrugated steel pipe shall only be used underground outside a building in a storm drainage system

National Sentence Text: Couplings for corrugated steel pipe shall be constructed so that when installed they shall maintain the pipe alignment, resist the separation of adjoining lengths of pipe, prevent root penetration, and prevent the infiltration of surrounding material.
P/T Sentence Text: Couplings for corrugated steel pipe shall be constructed so that when installed they shall, (a) maintain the pipe alignment, (b) resist the separation of adjoining lengths of pipe, (c) prevent root penetration, and (d) prevent the infiltration of surrounding material.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe shall conform to ASME B36.19M-2004 Stainless Steel Pipe and ASTM A 312/A 312M, Seamless, Welded, and Heavily Cold Worked Stainless Steel Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe shall conform to,(a) ASME B36.19M, "Stainless Steel Pipe", and (b) ASTM A312 / A312M, "Seamless, Welded, and Heavily Cold Worked Stainless Steel Pipes".

National Article Title: Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
National Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall conform to ASME B16.9, Factory Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings and ASTM A 403/A 403M-16 Wrought Austenitic Stainless Steel Piping Fittings
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.11. Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A403 / A403M, "Wrought Austenitic Stainless Steel Piping Fittings".

National Article Title: Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
National Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.11. Stainless Steel Butt Weld Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be schedule 40s or greater conforming to ASTM A 182/A 182M-16a Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or ASTM A 351/A 351M-16 Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be Schedule 40 or greater and shall conform to,(a) ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or (b) ASTM A351 / A351M, "Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts".

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel tube shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A269, "Seamless and Welded Austenitic Stainless Steel Tubing for General Service".

National Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 2.2.6.15.
P/T Sentence Text: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 7.2.6.15.

National Sentence Text: Copper pipe shall conform to ASTM B 42, Seamless Copper Pipe, Standard Sizes
P/T Sentence Text: Copper pipe shall conform to ASTM B42, "Seamless Copper Pipe, Standard Sizes".

National Sentence Text: Brass pipe shall conform to ASTM B 43, Seamless Red Brass Pipe, Standard Sizes
P/T Sentence Text: Brass pipe shall conform to ASTM B43, "Seamless Red Brass Pipe, Standard Sizes".

National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze pipe flanges and flanged fittings shall conform to ASME B16.24, Cast Copper Alloy Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: Classes 150, 300, 600, 900, 1500, and 2500
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.2. Brass or Bronze Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass or bronze pipe flanges and flanged fittings shall conform to ASME B16.24, "Cast Copper Alloy Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: Classes 150, 300, 600, 900, 1500 and 2500".

National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.15, Cast Copper Alloy Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.3. Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.15, "Cast Copper Alloy Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".

National Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.3. Brass or Bronze Threaded Water Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

National Sentence Text: Copper tube shall conform to ASTM B 88 Seamless Copper Water Tube or ASTM B 306, Copper Drainage Tube (DWV)
P/T Sentence Text: Copper tube in a plumbing system shall,(a) be certified to ASTM B88, "Seamless Copper Water Tube", or (b) comply with ASTM B306, "Copper Drainage Tube (DWV)".

National Sentence Text: Copper tube shall not be used for the fixture drain or the portion of the vent pipe below the flood level rim of manually flushing or waterless urinals.
P/T Sentence Text: Copper tube shall not be used for the fixture drain or the portion of the vent pipe below the flood level rim of manually flushing or waterless urinals.

National Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for drainage systems shall conform to ASME B16.23, Cast Copper Alloy Solder Joint Drainage Fittings: DWV or ASME B16.29, Wrought Copper and Wrought Copper Alloy Solder-Joint Drainage Fittings DWV
P/T Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for drainage systems shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.23, "Cast Copper Alloy Solder Joint Drainage Fittings: DWV", or (b) ASME B16.29, "Wrought Copper and Wrought Copper Alloy Solder Joint Drainage Fittings DWV".

National Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for drainage systems shall not be used in a water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for drainage systems shall not be used in a water system.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.2.7.6.(2), solder-joint fittings for water systems shall conform to ASME B16.18 Cast Copper Alloy Solder-Joint Pressure Fittings or ASME B16.22 Wrought Copper and Copper Alloy Solder Joint Pressure Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), solder-joint fittings for water systems shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.18, "Cast Copper Alloy Solder Joint Pressure Fittings", or (b) ASME B16.22, "Wrought Copper and Copper Alloy Solder Joint Pressure Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for water systems not made by casting or the wrought process shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.18 Cast Copper Alloy Solder-Joint Pressure Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Solder-joint fittings for water systems not made by casting or the wrought process shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.18, "Cast Copper Alloy Solder Joint Pressure Fittings".

National Article Title: Flared-Joint Fittings for Copper Water Systems
National Sentence Text: Flared-joint fittings for copper tube water systems shall conform to ASME B16.26 Cast Copper Alloy Fittings for Flared Copper Tubes
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.7. Flared-Joint Fittings for Copper Tube Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Flared-joint fittings for copper tube water systems shall conform to ASME B16.26, "Cast Copper Alloy Fittings for Flared Copper Tubes".

National Article Title: Flared-Joint Fittings for Copper Water Systems
National Sentence Text: Flared-joint fittings for copper tube water systems not made by casting shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.26 Cast Copper Alloy Fittings for Flared Copper Tubes
P/T Article Title: 7.2.7.7. Flared-Joint Fittings for Copper Tube Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Flared-joint fittings for copper tube water systems not made by casting shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.26, "Cast Copper Alloy Fittings for Flared Copper Tubes".

National Sentence Text: Lead waste pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system or as a building sewer.
P/T Sentence Text: Lead waste pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system or for a building sewer.

National Sentence Text: When there is a change in size of a lead closet bend, the change shall be in the vertical section of the bend or made in a manner that prevents the retention of liquid in the bend.
P/T Sentence Text: When there is a change in size of a lead closet bend, the change shall be in the vertical section of the bend or made in such a manner that there shall be no retention of liquid in the bend.

National Sentence Text: Pipes and fittings to be used for drainage and venting of acid and corrosive wastes shall conform to ASTM A 518/A 518M, Corrosion-Resistant High-Silicon Iron Castings ASTM C 1053, Borosilicate Glass Pipe and Fittings for Drain, Waste, and Vent (DWV) Applications or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.3, Polyolefin and Polyvinylidene Fluoride (PVDF) Laboratory Drainage Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Pipes and fittings to be used for drainage and venting of acid and corrosive wastes shall conform to,(a) ASTM A518 / A518M, "Corrosion-Resistant High-Silicon Iron Castings", (b) ASTM C1053, "Borosilicate Glass Pipe and Fittings for Drain, Waste, and Vent (DWV) Applications", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.3, "Polyolefin and Polyvinylidene Fluoride (PVDF) Laboratory Drainage Systems".

National Sentence Text: Cement mortar shall not be used for jointing.
P/T Sentence Text: Cement-mortar shall not be used for jointing.

National Sentence Text: Solders for solder joint fittings shall conform to ASTM B 32 Solder Metal
P/T Sentence Text: Solders for solder joint fittings shall conform to ASTM B32, "Solder Metal" in accordance with the recommended use.

National Sentence Text: Solders and fluxes having a lead content in excess of 0.2% shall not be used in a potable water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Solders and fluxes having a lead content in excess of 0.2 percent shall not be used in a potable water system.

National Sentence Text: Fluxes for soldered joints shall conform to ASTM B 813 Liquid and Paste Fluxes for Soldering of Copper and Copper Alloy Tube
P/T Sentence Text: Fluxes for soldered joints shall conform to ASTM B813, "Liquid and Paste Fluxes for Soldering of Copper and Copper Alloy Tube".

National Sentence Text: Brass floor flanges shall conform to CSA B158.1 Cast Brass Solder Joint Drainage, Waste and Vent Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Brass floor flanges shall be certified to CSA B158.1, "Cast Brass Solder Joint Drainage, Waste and Vent Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Every screw, bolt, nut and washer shall be of corrosion-resistant materials when used to connect a water closet to a floor flange, to anchor the floor flange to the floor, or to anchor the water closet to the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Every screw, bolt, nut and washer shall be of materials that are resistant to corrosion, when used,(a) to connect a water closet to a floor flange, (b) to anchor the floor flange to the floor, (c) to anchor the water closet to the floor, or (d) to hold cleanout covers or floor drain grates.

National Sentence Text: A cleanout fitting that, as a result of normal maintenance operations, cannot withstand the physical stresses of removal and reinstallation or cannot ensure a gas-tight seal shall not be installed.
P/T Sentence Text: A cleanout fitting that as a result of normal maintenance operations cannot withstand the physical stresses of removal and reinstallation or cannot ensure a gas-tight seal shall not be installed.

National Sentence Text: Groove- and shoulder-type mechanical couplings for pressure applications shall conform to CSA B242 Groove- and Shoulder-Type Mechanical Pipe Couplings
P/T Sentence Text: Groove and shoulder type mechanical pipe couplings shall conform to CSA B242, "Groove and Shoulder Type Mechanical Pipe Couplings".

National Sentence Text: A saddle hub or fitting shall not be installed in drainage, venting or water systems. (See Note A-2.2.10.5.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a saddle hub or fitting shall not be installed in drainage systems, venting systems or water systems.

National Sentence Text: Supply fittings shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.1/CSA B125.1, Plumbing Supply Fittings or CSA B125.3 Plumbing Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Supply fittings shall conform to ASME A112.18.1 / CSA B125.1, "Plumbing Supply Fittings" or CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Except for lavatories in health care facilities, emergency eye washes, and emergency showers, supply fittings and individual shower heads shall have an integral means of limiting the maximum water flow rate to that specified in Table 2.2.10.6. (See Note A-2.2.10.6.(2).)

An automatic compensating valve serving an individual shower head addressed in Sentence 2.2.10.6.(1) shall have a water flow rate equal to or less than the shower head it serves. (See Note A-2.2.10.6.(3).)
Waste fittings shall conform to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.2/CSA B125.2, Plumbing Waste Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Waste fittings shall conform to ASME A112.18.2 / CSA B125.2, "Plumbing Waste Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.2.10.7.(2), valves supplying fixed-location shower heads shall be individual pressure-balanced or thermostatic-mixing valves conforming to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.1-2012/CSA B125.1-12 Plumbing Supply Fittings

Individual pressure-balanced or thermostatic-mixing valves shall not be required for shower heads having a single tempered water supply that is controlled by an automatic compensating valve conforming to CSA B125.3-12 Plumbing Fittings

Mixing valves that supply shower heads shall be of the pressure-balanced, thermostatic, or combination pressure-balanced/thermostatic type capable of maintaining a water outlet temperature that does not exceed 49°C, and limiting thermal shock.
The temperature of water discharging into a bathtub shall not exceed 49°C.
The orifice of drinking fountain bubblers shall be of the shielded type, and direct the water upward at an angle of approximately 45°.
P/T Sentence Text: The orifice of every drinking fountain bubbler shall,(a) be of the shielded type, and (b) direct the water upward to an angle of approximately 45°.

National Sentence Text: Drinking fountain bubblers shall include a means of regulating the flow to the orifice.
P/T Sentence Text: Every drinking fountain bubbler shall include a means of regulating the flow to the orifice.

National Sentence Text: Bubblers shall be installed only on drinking fountains. (See Note A-2.2.10.9.(3).)

Except as provided in Sentence 2.2.10.10.(2), back-siphonage preventers and backflow preventers shall conform to CSA B64.0 Definitions, General Requirements, and Test Methods for Vacuum Breakers and Backflow Preventers CSA B64.1.1 Atmospheric Vacuum Breakers (AVB) CSA B64.1.2 Pressure Vacuum Breakers (PVB) CSA B64.1.3 Spill-Resistant Pressure Vacuum Breakers (SRPVB) CSA B64.2 Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) CSA B64.2.1 Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Manual Draining Feature CSA B64.2.2 Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Automatic Draining Feature CSA B64.3 Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP) CSA B64.4 Reduced Pressure Principle (RP) Backflow Preventers CSA B64.5 Double Check Valve (DCVA) Backflow Preventers CSA B64.6 Dual Check Valve (DuC) Backflow Preventers CSA B64.7 Laboratory Faucet Vacuum Breakers (LFVB) or CSA B64.8 Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Intermediate Vent (DuCV)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), back-siphonage preventers and backflow preventers shall be certified to,(a) CSA B64.0, "Definitions, General Requirements and Test Methods for Vacuum Breakers and Backflow Preventers", (b) CSA B64.1.1, "Atmospheric Vacuum Breakers (AVB)", (c) CSA B64.1.2, "Pressure Vacuum Breakers (PVB)", (d) CSA B64.1.3, "Spill-resistant Pressure Vacuum Breakers (SRPVB)", (e) CSA B64.1.4, "Vacuum Breaker, Air Space Type (ASVB)", (f) CSA B64.2, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB)", (g) CSA B64.2.1, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Manual Draining Feature", (h) CSA B64.2.1.1, "Hose Connection Dual Check Vacuum Breakers (HCDVB)", (i) CSA B64.2.2, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Automatic Draining Feature", (j) CSA B64.3, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP)", (k) CSA B64.3.1, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port for Carbonators (DCAPC)", (l) CSA B64.4, "Reduced Pressure Principle (RP) Backflow Preventers", (m) CSA B64.5, "Double Check Valve (DCVA) Backflow Preventers", (n) CSA B64.6, "Dual Check Valve (DuC) Backflow Preventers", (o) CSA B64.7, "Laboratory Faucet Vacuum Breakers (LFVB)", (p) CSA B64.8, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Intermediate Vent (DuCV)", or (q) CSA B64.10, "Selection and Installation of Backflow Preventers".

National Sentence Text: Back-siphonage preventers for tank-type water closets (anti-siphon fill shall conform to CSA B125.3 Plumbing Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Back-siphonage preventers (anti-siphon fill for tank type water closets shall be certified to CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Temperature-relief, pressure-relief, combined temperature- and pressure-relief, and vacuum-relief valves shall conform to ANSI/CSA ANSI Z21.22/CSA 4.4 Relief Valves for Hot Water Supply Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Temperature relief, pressure relief, combined temperature and pressure relief and vacuum relief valves shall conform to ANSI Z21.22 / CSA 4.4, "Relief Valves for Hot Water Supply Systems".

National Sentence Text: Direct-acting water-pressure-reducing valves for domestic water supply systems shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B356 Water Pressure Reducing Valves for Domestic Water Supply Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Direct acting water pressure reducing valves for domestic water supply systems shall conform to CAN/CSA-B356, "Water Pressure Reducing Valves for Domestic Water Supply Systems".

National Sentence Text: Equipment for solar heating of potable water shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-F379 SERIES (excluding Supplement F379S1-11) Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat Transfer)
P/T Sentence Text: Equipment forming part of a packaged system for solar heating of potable water, shall conform to CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use".

National Sentence Text: Flashing fabricated on-site for vent pipes shall be fabricated from copper sheet not less than 0.33 mm thick, aluminum sheet not less than 0.48 mm thick, alloyed zinc sheet not less than 0.35 mm thick, lead sheet not less than 1.73 mm thick, galvanized steel sheet not less than 0.33 mm thick, or polychloroprene (neoprene) not less than 2.89 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing fabricated on site for vent pipes shall be fabricated from,(a) copper sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, (b) aluminum sheet at least 0.48 mm thick, (c) alloyed zinc sheet at least 0.35 mm thick, (d) lead sheet at least 1.73 mm thick, (e) galvanized steel sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, or (f) polychloroprene (neoprene) at least 2.89 mm thick.

National Sentence Text: Prefabricated flashing for vent pipes shall conform to CSA B272, Prefabricated Self-Sealing Roof Vent Flashings (See Article 2.5.6.5. for location of vent pipe terminals.)
P/T Sentence Text: Prefabricated flashing for vent pipes shall be certified to CSA B272, "Prefabricated Self-Sealing Roof Vent Flashings".

National Sentence Text: Air admittance valves shall conform to ASSE 1051-2009G Individual and Branch Type Air Admittance Valves (AAVs) for Sanitary Drainage Systems (See Note A-2.2.10.16.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Air admittance valves shall conform to ASSE 1051, "Individual and Branch Type Air Admittance Valves for Sanitary Drainage Systems". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Point-of-use devices, including their disposable parts, used in potable water treatment systems shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B483.1 Drinking Water Treatment Systems
P/T Sentence Text: A drinking water treatment system or device shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B483.1, "Drinking Water Treatment Systems".

National Sentence Text: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast-iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and other ferrous pipe, brass and copper pipe, a caulking ferrule, or a trap standard.
P/T Sentence Text: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and, (a) other ferrous pipe, (b) brass and copper pipe, (c) a caulking ferrule, or (d) a trap standard.

National Sentence Text: Every caulked lead drainage joint shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with lead to a depth of not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Every caulked lead drainage joint shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with lead to a depth of at least 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: No paint, varnish or other coating shall be applied on the lead until after the joint has been tested.
P/T Sentence Text: No paint, varnish or other coating shall be applied on the lead until after the joint has been tested.

National Sentence Text: Wiped joints shall not be used except for sheet lead or lead pipe, or between such pipe and copper pipe or a ferrule.
P/T Sentence Text: Wiped joints shall not be used except for sheet lead or lead pipe, or between such pipe and copper pipe or a ferrule.

National Sentence Text: Soldered joints shall be made in accordance with ASTM B 828 Making Capillary Joints by Soldering of Copper and Copper Alloy Tube and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Soldered joints shall be made in accordance with ASTM B828, "Making Capillary Joints by Soldering of Copper and Copper Alloy Tube and Fittings".

National Sentence Text: Mechanical joints shall be made with compounded elastomeric rings that are held in compression by stainless steel or cast-iron clamps, or groove and shoulder type mechanical couplings.
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical joints shall be made with compounded elastomeric couplings or rings held by stainless steel or cast iron clamps or contained within a compression connection or groove and shoulder type mechanical coupling. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Caulking compound used in cold-caulked joints shall be applied according to the manufacturer's directions.
P/T Sentence Text: The caulking compound used in cold-caulked joints shall be applied according to the manufacturer s directions.

National Sentence Text: Cold-caulked joints in a drainage system shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with cold caulking compound to a depth of not less than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Every cold-caulked joint in a drainage system shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with cold caulking compound to a depth of at least 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel welded joints shall conform to ASME B31.9, Building Services Piping
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel welded joints shall conform to ASME B31.9, "Building Services Piping".

National Sentence Text: Drilled and tapped joints shall not be made in a soil-or-waste pipe or vent pipe and fittings unless suitable provision has been made for drilling and tapping.

Tees may be extracted from the wall thickness of Types K and L copper tube used in a water distribution system provided that a tool specifically designed for the purpose is used, the branch is at least one size smaller than the tube in which the tee is formed, the end of the branch incorporates a means to prevent it from penetrating into the run and thereby obstructing flow, and the joint at the tee is brazed with a filler metal having a melting point not below 540°C.

National Article Title: Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.3.3. Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be welded.

National Sentence Text: Slip joints shall not be used in a venting system, or in a drainage system, except to connect a fixture trap to a fixture drain in an accessible location.
P/T Sentence Text: A slip joint shall not be used,(a) in a venting system, or (b) in a drainage system, except to connect a fixture trap to a fixture drain in an accessible location.

National Article Title: Connection of Roof Drain to Leader
National Sentence Text: Roof drains shall be securely connected to a leader and provision shall be made for expansion.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.3.7. Connection of Roof Drain to Leader
P/T Sentence Text: Every roof drain shall be securely connected to a leader and provision shall be made for expansion.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.3.8.(3), floor flanges shall be brass.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3), every floor flange shall be of brass.

National Sentence Text: Where cast-iron or plastic pipe is used, a floor flange of the same material is permitted to be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Where cast iron or plastic pipe is used, a floor flange of the same material may be used.

National Sentence Text: Joints in a floor flange or between a fixture and the drainage system shall be sealed with a resilient watertight and gas-tight seal.
P/T Sentence Text: Every joint in a floor flange or between a fixture and the drainage system shall be sealed with a resilient, watertight and gas-tight seal.

National Sentence Text: Where a lead water-closet stub is used, the length of the stub below the floor flange shall be not less than 75 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a lead water closet stub is used, the length of the stub below the floor flange shall be at least 75 mm.

National Sentence Text: The size of the air break shall at least equal the size of the fixture drain, branch or pipe that terminates above the directly connected fixture, and it shall be not less than 25 mm. (See Note A-2.3.3.11.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: The size of the air break shall be at least 25 mm.

National Sentence Text: Wall-mounted fixtures shall be supported so that no strain is transmitted to the piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Every wall mounted fixture shall be supported so that no strain is transmitted to the piping.

National Sentence Text: Piping, fixtures, tanks or devices shall be supported independently of each other.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping, fixtures, tanks or devices shall be supported independently of each other.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.4.4.(2), vertical piping shall be supported at its base and at the floor level of alternate storeys by rests, each of which can bear the weight of pipe that is between it and the rest above it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), vertical piping shall be supported at its base and at the floor level of alternate storeys by rests, each of which can bear the weight of pipe that is between it and the rest above it.

National Sentence Text: The maximum spacing of supports shall be 7.5 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The maximum spacing of supports shall be 7.5 m.

National Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping shall be supported as stated in Table 2.3.4.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping shall be supported so that,(a) galvanized iron or steel pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3.75 m if the pipe size is 6 in. or more, and (ii) 2 500 mm if the pipe size is less than 6 in., (b) lead pipe is supported throughout its length, (c) cast iron pipe is supported, (i) at or adjacent to each hub or joint, (ii) at intervals not exceeding 3 m, and (iii) at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm if the pipe has mechanical joints and the length of pipe between adjacent fittings is 300 mm or less, (d) reserved (e) ABS or PVC plastic DWV pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not exceeding 1 200 mm, (ii) at the ends of branches, (iii) at changes of direction or elevation, and (iv) if the pipe is a fixture drain that is more than 1 000 mm in length, as close as possible to the trap, (f) plastic water pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (g) copper tube and copper and brass pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3 m if the tube or pipe is hard temper and larger than 1 in. in size, (ii) 2 500 mm if the tube or pipe is hard temper and 1 in. in size or less, and (iii) 2 500 mm if the tube is soft temper, (h) aluminum DWV pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not greater than 3 m, (ii) at both sides of all joints, (iii) at all branch ends, (iv) at all points where there is a change in direction, and (v) as close to all traps as possible, (i) supports and hangers for aluminum DWV pipe shall have a broad support base and shall be free of burrs and rough edges to prevent abrasion of the pipe, (j) where joints in the piping are less rigid than the pipe, the support points shall be selected so as to minimize the shear and bending forces imposed on the joints, (k) PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (l) PP-R plastic pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (ii) at the end of branches, and (iii) at changes of direction and elevation, and (m) stainless steel pipe or tube is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3 000 mm if the pipe or tube size is 1 in. or more, and (ii) 2 500 mm if the pipe or tube size is less than 1 in.

National Sentence Text: Where PVC, CPVC or ABS plastic pipe is installed the pipe shall be aligned without added strain on the piping, the pipe shall not be bent or pulled into position after being welded, and hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where plastic pipe or a composite pipe incorporating a plastic component is installed,(a) the pipe shall be aligned without added strain on the piping, (b) the pipe shall not be bent or pulled into position after being welded or joined, and (c) hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Where hangers are used to support nominally horizontal piping, the hangers shall be supported by metal rods of not less than 6 mm diam to support piping 2 inches or less in size, 8 mm diam to support piping 4 inches or less in size, and 13 mm diam to support piping over 4 inches in size, or solid or perforated metal straps of not less than 0.6 mm nominal thickness and 12 mm wide to support piping 2 inches or less in size, and 0.8 mm nominal thickness and 18 mm wide to support piping 4 inches or less in size.
P/T Sentence Text: Where hangers are used to support nominally horizontal piping, the hangers shall be, (a) supported by metal rods of not less than, (i) 6 mm diam for supporting pipe 2 in. or less in size, (ii) 8 mm diam for supporting pipe 4 in. or less in size, and (iii) 13 mm diam for supporting pipe over 4 in. in size, or (b) solid or perforated metal straps not less than, (i) 0.6 mm nominal thickness, 12 mm wide for pipe 2 in. or less in size, and (ii) 0.8 mm nominal thickness, 18 mm wide for pipe 4 in. or less in size.

National Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping installed underground that is not supported as described in Sentence 2.3.4.6.(1) may be installed using hangers fixed to a foundation or structural slab provided that the hangers are capable of keeping the pipe in alignment, and supporting the weight of the pipe, its contents, and the fill over the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Nominally horizontal piping installed underground that is not supported as described in Sentence (1) may be installed using hangers fixed to a foundation or structural slab provided that the hangers are capable of,(a) keeping the pipe in alignment, and (b) supporting the weight, (i) of the pipe, (ii) its contents, and (iii) the fill over the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Underground piping shall be protected in the absence of the pipe manufacturer s instructions for backfill, by backfill that is (see Note A-2.3.5.1.(1)(a)) placed and compacted to a height of 300 mm over the top of the pipe, and free of stones, boulders, cinders and frozen earth or other material capable of damaging the piping, or by concrete that is at least 75 mm thick and at least 200 mm wider than the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping is installed underground, the backfill shall be carefully placed and tamped to a height of 300 mm over the top of the pipe and shall be free of stones, boulders, cinders and frozen earth.

National Sentence Text: Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping passes through or under a wall, it shall be installed so that the wall does not bear on the pipe.

National Sentence Text: Plumbing, piping and equipment exposed to mechanical damage shall be protected.
P/T Sentence Text: Plumbing, piping and equipment exposed to mechanical damage shall be protected.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: Except in the case of an external leader, after a section of a drainage system or a venting system has been roughed in, and before any fixture is installed or piping is covered, a water pressure test or an air pressure test shall be conducted.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Except in the case of an external leader, after a section of drainage system or a venting system has been roughed in, and before any fixture is installed or piping is covered, a water or an air test shall be conducted.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: After every fixture is installed and before any part of the drainage system or venting system is placed in operation, a final test shall be carried out when requested.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a chief building official requires a final test, it shall be carried out after every fixture is installed and before any part of the drainage system or venting system is placed in operation.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and tests shall be conducted.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and tests shall be conducted.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a drainage system or venting system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected and a final test shall be carried out on the complete system when requested.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a drainage system and venting system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected and a final test shall be carried out on the complete system.

National Article Title: Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
National Sentence Text: When requested, a ball test shall be made to any pipe in a drainage system.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.1. Tests and Inspection of Drainage or Venting Systems
P/T Sentence Text: A ball test shall be carried out on a sanitary building drain, sanitary building sewer, storm building drain and a storm building sewer buried underground.

National Article Title: Tests of Pipes in Drainage Systems
National Sentence Text: Pipes in a drainage system, except an external leader or fixture outlet pipe, shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water pressure test, air pressure test and final test.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.2. Tests of Pipes in Drainage Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Every pipe in a drainage system, except an external leader or fixture outlet pipe, shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.

National Article Title: Tests of Pipes in Drainage Systems
National Sentence Text: Pipes in a drainage system shall be capable of meeting a ball test.
Venting systems shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water pressure test, air pressure test and final test.
P/T Sentence Text: Every venting system shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.

National Sentence Text: A water pressure test shall consist in applying a water column of at least 3 m to all joints.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.4. Water Tests in Drain, Waste and Vent Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Where a water test is made, all joints shall be tested with a water column of not less than 3 m.

National Sentence Text: In making a water pressure test, every opening except the highest shall be tightly closed with a testing plug or a screw cap, and the system or the section shall be kept filled with water for 15 min.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.6.4. Water Tests in Drain, Waste and Vent Systems
P/T Sentence Text: In making a water test,(a) every opening except the highest shall be tightly closed with a testing plug or a test cap, and (b) the system or the section shall be kept filled with water for 15 min.

National Sentence Text: Where a final test is made, every trap shall be filled with water, the bottom of the system being tested shall terminate at a building trap, test plug or cap, except as provided in Sentence 2.3.6.6.(2), smoke from smoke-generating machines shall be forced into the system, when the smoke appears from all roof terminals they shall be closed, and a pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column shall be maintained for 15 min without the addition of more smoke.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a final test is made,(a) every trap shall be filled with water, (b) the bottom of the system being tested shall terminate at the building trap, test plug or cap, (c) except as provided in Sentence (2), smoke from smoke-generating machines shall be forced into the system, (d) when the smoke appears from all roof terminals they shall be closed, and (e) a pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column shall be maintained for 15 min without the addition of more smoke.

National Sentence Text: The smoke referred to in Clauses 2.3.6.6.(1) and 2.3.6.6.(1) is permitted to be omitted, provided the roof terminals are closed and the system is subjected to an air pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column maintained for 15 min without the addition of more air.
P/T Sentence Text: The smoke referred to in Clauses (1)(c) and (d) may be omitted provided the roof terminals are closed and the system is subjected to an air pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column maintained for 15 min without the addition of more air.

National Sentence Text: The diameter of the ball shall be not less than 50 mm where the size of the pipe is 3 inches or more, or 25 mm where the size of the pipe is less than 3 inches.
P/T Sentence Text: The diameter of the ball shall be not less than 50 mm where the size of the pipe is 4 in. or more.

National Sentence Text: After a section of a potable water system has been completed, and before it is placed in operation, a water pressure test shall be conducted, except that an air pressure test may be used in freezing conditions.
P/T Sentence Text: After a section of a potable water system has been completed, and before it is placed in operation, a water test or an air test shall be conducted.

National Sentence Text: A pressure test may be applied to each section of the system or to the system as a whole.
P/T Sentence Text: A test may be applied to each section of the system or to the system as a whole.

National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and pressure tests shall be conducted.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be inspected and tested on site, off-site inspections and tests shall be conducted.

National Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a water system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected, and the complete system shall be pressure tested when requested.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a water system,(a) all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected, and (b) the complete system shall be pressure tested.

National Article Title: Pressure Tests of Potable Water Systems
National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 2.3.7.2.(2), potable water systems shall be able to withstand without leaking, a water pressure that is at least equal to the maximum in-service pressure, or an air pressure of not less than 700 kPa for at least 2 h without a drop in pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Every potable water system shall be capable of,(a) withstanding without leakage a water pressure that is at least 1 000 kPa for at least 1 h, or (b) withstanding for at least 2 h without a drop in pressure an air pressure that is at least 700 kPa.

National Article Title: Pressure Tests of Potable Water Systems
National Sentence Text: If a manufacturer states that an air pressure test is not recommended, a water pressure test shall be performed. (See Note A-2.3.7.2.(2).)
Where a water pressure test is made, all air shall be expelled from the system before fixture control valves or faucets are closed.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a water test is made, all air shall be expelled from the system before fixture control valves or faucets are closed.

National Sentence Text: This Section applies to sanitary drainage systems, storm drainage systems, combined building drains or combined building sewers.
P/T Sentence Text: This Section applies to sanitary drainage systems and storm drainage systems.

National Sentence Text: Fixtures shall be directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, except that drinking fountains are permitted to be indirectly connected to a sanitary drainage system, or connected to a storm drainage system provided that where the system is subject to backflow, a backwater valve is installed in the fountain waste pipe (see Note A-2.4.2.1.(1)(a)(ii)), drainage pans on heating/cooling units are permitted to be connected to a storm drainage system, provided that where the system is subject to backflow, a backwater valve is installed, a floor drain is permitted to be connected to a storm drainage system, provided it is located where it can receive only clear-water waste or storm water, fixtures or appliances that discharge only clear-water waste are permitted to be connected to a storm drainage system or be drained onto a roof, and the following devices shall be indirectly connected to a drainage system: a device for the display, storage, preparation or processing of food or drink, a sterilizer, a device that uses water as a cooling or heating medium, a water operated device, a water treatment device, or a drain or overflow from a water system or a heating system (see Note A-2.4.2.1.(1)(a)(ii)).
